Those who take a statin (Lipitor, Crestor and the rest of the statin family,) should know by now that many leading health care experts, physicians and clinical researchers recommend considering supplementation with CoQ10. This is because all statins effect, reduce and compromise the levels of CoQ10 produced by our bodies. CoQ10 is a fat-soluble antioxidant produced naturally and concentrated in the liver, kidneys and heart. As we age, however, levels of this important compound decline significantly.  If you smoke, you are also bound to have even lower levels of this important antioxidant. Therefore, sustaining adequate levels of CoQ10 becomes particularly significant for those who remain on statin medication, are diabetic, pre-diabetic (T2D), have Parkinson's disease or for those who have chronic neuropathy or cardiac pathology.Our typical processed Western American diet generally furnishes only about 10mg of CoQ10 daily so supplementation is usually necessary to reach more optimum levels (Andrew Weil, MD, NP).  Those under 30 may benefit from the less expensive form of CoQ10 (Ubiquinone) while those over 40 should consider this more bio-available and expensive "reduced" form of CoQ10 (Ubiquinol).There are two distinct forms of CoQ10:1. Ubiquinone (USP): This is the less expensive and more marketed oxidized or non-reduced form of this antioxidant. (Usually labeled as "CoQ10").2. Ubiquinol: This is the more expensive reduced form of CoQ10 claiming higher absorption and bio-availability. This product is UBIQUINOL.It is interesting to note that your body actually converts each form of CoQ10 into the other (Mayo Clinic).  However, some healthcare practitioners, and without question the supplement industry, claim that ubiquinol (expensive form) is more efficient since it has greater antioxidant efficiency, particularly for folks over age 40.  The choice is yours to make in consultation with your healthcare practitioner/physician.PROS1. This product delivers ubiquinol-the oxidized, bio-available and un-reduced form of Co-enzyme Q10.2. Product is GMP (Good Manufacturing Process) certified.3. Dairy, gluten, GMO-free per manufacturer's product label.4. Clear Date and Lot # stamped on side of product label.5. Excellent, competitive price points for this supplement (100 MG 60 capsules@ $22.67 on Amazon 11.10.2015)CONCERNS:1. Relatively large softgels make this uncomfortable for many folks to swallow as part of a daily regimen. (See Photos).2. Greater labeling transparency necessary for Doctor's Best supplements in my opinion. Doctor's Best outsources manufacture  of their supplements to a 3rd party facility as many other brands do. DB simply markets and distributes their products.  Without a clear sourcing statement, it is difficult to determine where the final product is formulated, encapsulated and finished.3. No desiccants supplied in Doctorâs best supplements to help displace moisture.4. Not Vegan or Kosher-Gelatin Capsules.RECOMMENDATIONS:1. With the above-referenced concerns, this is a good product appropriate for those over 40. Check prices and stay with a reputable  manufacturer  that is c-GMP and NSF compliant.2.  Always consult your health care practitioner before taking this or any supplement for potential adverse interactions with existing Rx meds  you may be taking. Be certain that you have been counseled on all of the potential interactions between Ubiquinol and other  prescription medications. Cancer meds (chemotherapy), warfarin (Coumadin) and high blood pressure (anti-hypertensive) medications can  interact unfavorably with ubiquinol and CoQ10 supplementation.3. If you fall into one of the affected risk groups above for low CoQ10, I recommend you consider a Coenzyme Q10 Reduced & Total Plasma  blood test. This is usually an 8 hour fasting blood test performed by your healthcare practitioner. Your lab results should be a reliable and  valid barometer whether or not you could benefit from supplementation and at what targeted clinically-therapeutic dosage level.  Here are the reference values for this test: (Mayo Clinic)CoQ10 REDUCED:<18 years: 320-1,376 mcg/L> or =18 years: 415-1,480 mcg/LTOTAL CoQ10:<18 years: 320-1,558 mcg/L> or =18 years: 433-1,532 mcg/L% REDUCED CoQ10:<18 years: 93-100%> or =18 years: 92-98%4. If the product label says CoQ10 it is NOT Ubiquinol. Even if it says "High Absorption CoQ10", it is NOT Ubiquinol, but standard CoQ10 with ablack pepper extract to help increase its assimilation and absorption. You will pay more than twice the average cost for Ubiquinol but for some, it may be well worth the investment in your health.  You can always identify Ubiquinol by the words "Kaneka QH" on the product label. It is made exclusively in Japan by Kaneka  and supplied to other manufacturers who then market their products to consumers, like DB, Jarrow, etc.To Your Good Health My Friends!

If you have recently purchased a new frig as we have, you will no doubt appreciate many of the new "bells and whistles" engineered into today's sophisticated appliances.  To me however, this snap-in activated charcoal air filter is something that should have been designed into these units decades ago. It essentially eliminates the need for auxiliary boxes of baking soda in order to address and neutralize offensive odors from food.Here's what you need to know to be a consumer-savvy smart shopper:PROS:1. Genuine OEM air filter compatible with many Whirpool, Maytag, Amana and Jenn-Air refrigerators. (Check your owner's manual to insure  you are purchasing the correct part number for these filters.2. Extremely easy snap-in installation.3. Filter media impregnated with activated carbon (charcoal).4. Designed to be replaced at 6 month intervals per your appliance manufacturer.5. Supplied with a separate triangular plastic replacement indicator  ("Time Strip") as a visual reminder when to replace. (See Photos).CONCERNS:1. Cost: Pricey when you factor in the long-term costs of replacement. Depending on your particular model, many refrigerators are designed  with multiple "peripherals", requiring replacement at given time intervals-water filters, multiple air filters, etc.  If you have a unit with many  "bells and whistles", be prepared to shell out hundreds of dollars over the life of the unit for these "accessories".  Think of it like getting  a subsidized computer printer for a great price initially, and then getting screwed on the price of the printer cartridges-sound familiar??2. These filters are not manufactured by Whirpool Corporation but FOR Whirpool, USA by Kemflo International (Taiwan).  My educated guess is that they cost about 0.35 cents each to produce-you can do the math to quickly determine how much profit is generated  on the sale of these filters, even at the "discounted" price of $7 per filter.  Here's an interesting  link to a major supplier of Kemflo filters: http://www.alibaba.com/product-detail/Whirlpool-W10311524-AIR1-Refrigerator-Air-Filter_60345399930/showimage.html3. Triangular "Time Strip" indicator not installation-compatible with many refrigerator models, requiring consumers to "retro-fit" installation.  I simply inserted the strip into a crevice on the top of my refrigerator ceiling. They are easy to lose without a secure installation.RECOMMENDATIONS:1. A necessary and convenient maintenance item for virtually every refrigerator.  Highly recommended.  Purchase in volume rather than for one filter.  Shop wisely-there are many vendors online offering these exact filters at less than half the  MSRP compared to ordering these filters directly from Whirpool.  You should be able to purchase a set of three of these filters for about  $20.2. Periodically check the filter(s) at 3 month intervals. You may find that you can go 6-9 months or longer depending upon the length of time  and frequency that your compressor runs. If your filter begins to develop mold, wash or replace the filter immediately.3. BEFORE you purchase any appliance, factor-in the annual cost of all of these "maintenance accessories". Very few of us do including myself.To Your Good Health!

Vitamin B-12 is a  water-soluble vitamin necessary for red blood cell formation, nervous system functioning and DNA synthesis. Unfortunately, plants do not produce B12 so we must obtain it from animal sources in our food or produce it synthetically through supplementation.  If like me, you are over 50 and take acid-suppressing meds, your risk for some degree of B12 malabsorption is significant.Because it is water-soluble, B12 has a relatively low toxicity potential as excess B12 is simply excreted in our urine. However, our ability to efficiently and effectively absorb B12 steadily decreases with age. While most B vitamins are readily absorbed,  B12, has more complicated requirements for absorption. As a result, optimal intake of vitamin B12 can sometimes be a challenge for many of us.  Even though U.S. adults average well above the Dietary Reference Intake (DRI) for B12, (2.4 mcg/day), there are still subgroups that are more commonly at risk of B12 deficiency.  These risk factors include: Long-term regular use of PPIâs (proton pump inhibitors like omeprazole and other acid-suppressing meds), depression, alcohol, pernicious anemia, diabetes drugs (metformin and others), Crohnâs disease, IBS, celiac disease, atrophic gastritis, ulcerative colitis, âleaky-gutâ syndrome, asthma, macular degeneration, MS, shingles, Alzheimer's, migraines, tinnitus, kidney disease, folate deficiency, pregnancy and lactation, H-Pylori, insufficient protein-digesting enzymes (usually as a result of aging) and adhering to a strict vegan diet.The only valid and reliable method for determining whether you indeed may have a B12 deficiency, is to have a B-12 blood plasma test.Here are the Blood Serum Reference Ranges to help you determine if you have clinical B-12 deficiency:Blood plasma reference range for B-12: 180-914 ng/L. (nano grams per liter of blood)< 180 ng/L: May cause anemia and/or peripheral neuropathies<150 ng/L:  Evidence of B12 deficiency150-400 ng/L: Borderline determination requiring a plasma homocysteine test as a follow-up screen.>400 ng/L: ânormalâ-not requiring further testing.If your results are in a "normal" range and you are not in any of these risk subgroups, I suggest simply modifying your diet to includesome or all of the following B-12 rich foods: sardines, salmon, tuna, cod, lamb, beef liver, scallops, shrimp, yogurt, cow's milk and eggs.If not, Vitamin Code Raw B-12 is an excellent supplement for the following reasons:PROS:1. This supplement contains a form of B-12 (methylcobalamin) more bio-available and absorbable in our systems compared to cyanocobalamin which requires a two-step process for conversion in order to be readily used by our bodies. Keep in mind however, that BOTH of these B12 forms are synthetically produced rather than naturally synthesized like cobalamin.2. Product is Vegan, non-GMO and gluten-free.3. Produced in NSF & cGMP-compliant manufacturing facilities.4. Medium-sized, easy to swallow capsules (Please see my size photos for comparison).5. Contains a desiccant in the bottle to help displace moisture.6. Bottle is tinted and protected from light penetration.CONCERNS:1. Bottle size of 30 capsules not practical for those on daily regimens. A 60 or 90 day supply would be preferable.2. Garden of Life outsources manufacture of their supplements to a 3rd party facility as many other brands do.  GOL simply markets and distributes their products as indicated on their product.. This is a very common practice.  These third-party facilities usually manufacture supplements for multiple product labels and their identity is proprietary  and not subject to disclosure.  I do not like this practice because it impedes full transparency.RECOMMENDATIONS:1. If you cannot maintain a well-balanced diet rich in B12 sourced ideally from foods, this is an excellent second choice. GOL supplements remain time-tested for brand integrity, quality and reputation.  GOL also has a comprehensive customer support network with specialists available to address product-related issues with accuracy and promptness. Check Consumerâs Digest, Checkbook or Consumer Reports that offer and perform unbiased research and product ratings and assessments on many of these OTC supplements for further ratings. These organizations do their own independent testing without accepting advertisements, kickbacks or compensation from manufacturers for posting favorable reviews.2. Like any supplement or medication, it is wise to first seek medical guidance from your licensed healthcare practitioner BEFORE purchasing any of these supplements based solely on any anecdotal accounts of these working for others. Each of us has different body chemistry and different medical histories and the potential for adverse interactions occurring between your Rx profile and many OTC supplements can be critical.3. Unless you have clinically-demonstrated B-12 deficiency (per blood lab test results reported above), you should always be cautious in purchasing this or any supplement without first discussing this with a knowledgeable healthcare practitioner. My preference is to heed thewisdom of our grandparents and try to obtain all of these vitamins and nutrients through a well-balanced diet of naturally-rich sources of B-12.Wishing you all good health my friends!________________________________________

I have struggled for decades with GI issues, from poor digestion to GERD to IBS.  After embracing all that mainstream medicine has to offer-endoscopy, colonoscopy, proton-pump inhibitors to reduce stomach acid, and a constellation of other questionable prescription meds, all with very unpleasant side effects, I decided to re-assess and reformulate my game plan for resurrecting my health.  This included avoiding the foods that trigger my GI symptoms, slowly tiering off of acid-suppressing meds, and taking daily enzymes to help with the digestion of my food.  I assure you, this was NOT an easy task and it took several unsuccessful and painful attempts to discover through trial and error, what guided me to freedom.As we age, our bodies become less efficient and effective at processing nutrients we eat, whether they be fats, proteins, sugars or carbohydrates.In fact, enzymes are responsible for virtually every single chemical reaction that occurs in our bodies. These reactions allow our cells to break down molecules quickly. Without enzymes, vitamins, minerals and hormones cannot function.Digestive enzymes assist in maintaining and sustaining gastrointestinal health.  They are the key substances of the digestive process, working to break down our food for proper absorption. The four primary digestive enzymes are:â¢  Lipase:  Assists in digesting and assimilating fats.â¢  Protease/Peptidase:  Assists in digesting and processing proteins.â¢  Amylase:  Assists in processing carbohydrates or starch.â¢  Cellulase: Assists in  converting cellulose molecules into simple sugars (glucose).Our Western diet of overly processed foods, often devoid of essential nutrients exacerbates the situation worse.  This is because processed foods often do not contain the digestive enzymes required for proper digestion and absorption of nutrients.Enzyme-deficient foods essentially force your body to obtain enzymes from other parts of the body, just to digest, rather than utilizing the enzymes from the food itself to do the job, the way nature intended.  This can also create inflammatory conditions leading to illness.If you are among the millions of us who regularly take GI medications ( antacids, H2-recptor antagonists, PPI's) to address GERD or otherinflammatory gut conditions, you need to pay particular attention to the importance for considering supplementing with wide-spectrum enzymes.These conditions compromise a healthy gut microbiome and can often be helped by such supplements.  This is one of many excellentenzyme supplements to consider for the following reasons:ADVANTAGES:1. A wide-spectrum enzyme supplement consisting of 18 different plant-based enzymes.2. Contains aspergillopepsin to support and enhance gluten digestion.3. "Inactive" ingredients contain no controversial substances-no stearates, dioxides, polysorbates.4.  Dosage is only 1-2 capsules at beginning of meals depending on individual needs.5. Made in USA in cGMP-Compliant manufacturing facility.6. Clear, transparent Date of Manufacture and Expiration Date printed on bottle.CONCERNS:1. No statement of non-GMO on product bottle.2. No desiccant included in bottle to help displace moisture  Bottle label: Could benefit from improved graphics and a more user-friendly redesign to increase readability, particularly ingredients list.RECOMMENDATIONS:1.  An excellent wide-spectrum enzyme supplement helpful for proper and complete digestion of most foods.2.  Comparing many different enzyme supplements can be a challenge because many use "proprietary" formulations which do not require  full transparency, making accurate apple-to-apple product comparisons difficult and frustrating. In addition, not all manufacturers utilize the  same metrics (units of measurement) for each enzyme. This forces you to both interpret and decipher the metric and then do the math.  So, look specifically for top-rated products which identify and list each individual enzyme along with their respective amounts as you  do your product comparisons.3.  Since each of us have different needs, I would trial 3-5 of the top-rated brands and determine which works best for you.  Dr. Tobias is one of my new favorites along with DigestWise, Pure Encapsulations and Garden of Life Raw Enzymes (pricey).  Hope this was all not too "difficult to swallow"!Disclosure: Complimentary bottle provided for unbiased and honest product evaluation and assessment.To Your Good Health My Friends

Middle-age can be a challenging time for our bodies-especially for the lower back. After numerous back injuries and persistent lumbarradiculopathy, I became a candidate for a firm orthopedic seat cushion which would maintain its resilience and integrity, offer solid support and reduce pressure on my spine.  I looked for one for the home/office and one for the car. The Liliyo Coccyx Orthopedic Foam Seat ComfortCushion ("Ultimate 3-in-1 Bundle") was worth a 3 week test drive and here is my product assessment based on my individual needs and response:ADVANTAGES:1. Extremely comfortable seating cushion ideal for folks with small to medium body frames (not exceeding 200 lbs.).2. Well-designed and engineered to relieve symptoms from tailbone (coccyx) pain, sciatica, sacrum and other lower lumbar-related discomfort.3. Manufacturer-warranted 6 month "no hassle" replacement/refund. Outstanding for a product of this type.4. Exceptionally responsive, pleasant and professional customer service.  Extremely customer-centric.5. Supplied with 3 removable machine-washable zippered velour seat covers (Black, Midnight Blue and Gray)6. Cushion is sealed in a white, non-allergenic cotton fabric.7. Zipper extends the entire width of cushion making replacing cushion covers convenient.8. Excellent, reasonable price point for this product in comparison to many other competing orthopedic cushions.CONCERNS:1. I personally found this particular cushion somewhat too soft for my personal preference. Too much compression and insufficient  cushion density for my needs as a 180 lb. male.2. Too soft for support as a car cushion. After reaching out to the seller, however, I was provided with a much firmer version of this cushion  (significantly more dense) for comparison to the one delivered on Amazon.  Both my wife and I trialed both of these cushions for three  weeks. Our results were identical: The firmer version of this cushion was a better choice for a car cushion, providing both proper  support and comfort most likely due to the different seating platforms and infrastructure in vehicles.3. I would not recommended either of these cushions for sharply-contoured (raised or curved) seating surfaces because they alter the  design of the cushion and compromise the integrity of the cushion's ability to address your discomfort.4. No anti-slip cushion bottom to prevent cushion migration from normal daily use.5. "High-density Rebound Foam": Like "memory foam", the term "rebound foam" casts a wide net in the foam arena and is somewhat vague  and generic. The truth is that there many grades and types each based upon a measure of its firmness (The ILD or "Indentation Load  Deflection Rating) and Density (which generally ranges from 1 lb. per cubic ft. up to 8 lb. per cubic ft.).  I would like to see ALL  "orthopedic" cushion and appliance manufacturers supplying both the density grade and ILD rating in addition to type of foam(s) on the  product label in order to become more transparent to consumers. This should be able to be achieved without jeopardizing the  proprietary design or nature of their products while providing consumers with clear, unambiguous metrics for evaluating and assessing  a product of this nature prior to purchase.6. No disclosure for country of manufacture: This can be a critical factor for foams sourced from China and other areas of the globe  whose industry, quality control and health standards are generally not as rigorous as ours in the US.  For example, foams from China  have been known to contain toxic VOC's (volatile organic compounds) such as formaldehyde and PBDE. Experience generally  suggests that a product without any statement of origin usually suggests China or other pacific-rim countries.RECOMMENDATIONS:1.  A good choice for small to medium-framed individuals (not exceeding 200 lbs.) for temporary relief from lower lumbar-related discomfort.2.  If you prefer a softer-density foam cushion, this may be a good choice for you.3.  For use as a driver's-side car cushion, I recommend considering the FIRMER version of this product (not currently available for sale on  Amazon).  NOTE: If you purchase the available softer version on Amazon and it does not suit your needs, I was informed by Liliyo that you may  request an exchange for the firmer version of this cushion by reaching out to Liliyo Customer Service through Amazon's "contact seller" link.4.  Remember that most of these cushions are designed for 180 degree (flat) seating surfaces. If you use this cushion as a car seat, it may not  perform as well as expected.  I do not recommend this product for use with bucket-type car seats or contoured (angled) seating surfaces.Disclosure: Received in consideration for an unbiased, honest product evaluation and assessment.To Your Good Health!

For years, I embraced all of the benefits of using my favorite Glide Floss because nothing seemed to work as well for cleaning my tight, crowded teeth.  It is exceptionally strong and very easy to maneuver around dental work.  The mint flavor also added a nice closure to my daily dental regimen. Throughout all these years of use, I was convinced that I was flossing with the Rolls-Royce of dental floss. I never gave a second thought to the long-term safety of using a Teflon-based material until recently. Companies never mentioned it in their product marketing and promotional literature and my dentists never discussed potential cautions or concerns regarding its use.  Well, times have changed and we need to take responsibility for our own health and educate ourselves.  So....In comes the tide and out goes the Glide!ADVANTAGES:1. Highly Shred-Resistant.2. Fresh mint flavored and light wax coated (petroleum-based wax).3. Easy to access floss and dispense from holder.4. Slides easily in tight dental spaces for those with crowded teeth and challenging dental work.DISADVANTAGES:1. Potential Health Hazards:  Glide, is essentially made from a synthetic polymer called  PTFE. Polytetrafluorethylene floss (PTFE) is the same material used in high-tech Gore-Tex fabric and the same compound that causes frying pans not to stick. Oral-B's Glide Floss is PTFE.  Many consumer, health advocates and environmentalists recommend non-PTFE brands, given the use of Perfluorooctanoic acid, a possible carcinogen, in the making of Teflon (PTFE).  These perfluorinated compounds, or PFCs are not only suspected as carcinogenic, but can compromise your immune system and affect hormone levels because they are endocrine disruptors. The amount you absorb from one flossing most likely is negligible, but because PFCs remain in your system, they can accumulate in your tissues and present a long-term health hazard which is avoidable.  If youâre flossing once or twice a day, you should  consider a PFC-free dental floss. There are currently no federal regulations that manufacturers disclose the ingredients in floss so you will need to be vigilant and voice your concerns directly to the companies.2. Consider water-based appliances designed to clean and floss the gums and interdental areas. For example, Water-Pic, Panasonic  and Phillips all make some excellent flossers. My picks here are the WaterPic WP-440W or the Panasonic Oral Irrigator EW-DJ10-A.  For those on a budget who still prefer manual flosses, I like Organix South Neem Mint Dental Floss, Eco-Dent Natural Dental Care  Gentle Floss and Toms of Maine Spearmint Floss-all PFC/PTFE free. They are more expensive but the small price difference is well  worth it to me.RECOMMENDATIONS:1.  Avoid PFC/PTFE-based dental flosses altogether.  Consider healthier alternatives available in the market cited above.  When in doubt,  contact the manufacturer directly.  Like the "Made in the USA" logo, these manufacturers are eager to boast about their ingredients and  will state this on the packages conspicuously. Remember, the "devil is always in the details".2.  Use water-assisted flossing appliances cited above and/or consider manual interdental flossing appliances such as GUM's "Proxabrush"  Dental Cleaners.3.  Discuss your concerns with a trusted dentist or healthcare professional who does not have a fiduciary interest or relationship with Oral-B  which might pose a conflict of interest to the patient.To Your Good Health!

Middle-age can be a challenging time for our bodies-especially for the lower back. After numerous back injuries and persistent lumbarradiculopathy, I became a candidate for a firm orthopedic seat cushion which would maintain its resilience and integrity, offer solid support and reduce pressure on my spine. The BackGuard Premium Lower back Pain Cushion was worth a 3 week test drive and here is my product assessment based on my individual needs and response:ADVANTAGES:1. Extremely comfortable for most folks with small and medium frame (not over 200 lbs).2. Removable zippered cushion cover is machine washable.3. Manufacturer-warranted for 90 days-No hassle returns within this return window.4. Assists in proper seating alignment of spine.5. Center cushion is breathable mesh to avoid retention of moisture/odor.6. Excellent, reasonable price point for the delivered product as is.7. Responsive, pleasant and professional customer service.DISADVANTAGES:1.  Not ideal for most auto use, particularly those with bucket or contoured seating surfaces.2.  Not designed for home use with sharply-contoured chair backs. Using it with these back surfaces may compromise the  comfort, usefulness and integrity the cushion was designed to address.3. The Achilles Heel" of this product is the adjustable strap, which is vulnerable to tearing at the seam when stressed by  repeated on/off uses and/or seats/chairs with thick backs.  The strap is also positioned at the center of the cushion and may be  challenging to attach to some types of office chairs.  One strap limits the degree of tension to keep the cushion stable and in  place without migrating.4.  "Proprietary Density Memory Foam":  The term "memory foam" casts a very wide net indeed and seems to imply that there is  but one grade/type of memory foam.  The truth is that there many grades and types each based upon a measure of its firmness  (The IFD Rating) and Density (which generally ranges from 1 lb. per cubic ft. up to 8 lb. per cubic ft.).  I would like to see ALL  manufacturers supplying the grade and type of foam on the product itself in order to become more transparent to consumers.5. No disclosure for country of manufacture:  This can be a critical factor for foams sourced from China and other areas of the globe  whose industry, quality controls and health standards may not be as rigorous as ours in the US.  For example, foams from China  have been known to contain toxic VOC's (volatile organic compounds) such as formaldehyde and PBDE. Experience suggests that no  statement of origin usually suggests China or other pacific-rim countries.RECOMMENDATIONS:1.  Extremely comfortable material and foam designed for small and medium-framed folks who desire auxiliary lumbar support.  With the exception of the above-cited concerns, definitely worth a try. I do not recommend this particular cushion for larger-framed  individuals over 200 lbs.2.  Strap redesign is necessary to strengthen the integrity of the strap material.  Manufacturer should consider using a clasp-type  mechanism for ease of use.  The two critical seam junctures where the strap joins the cushion back requires strengthening and reinforcing.  I would also like to suggest two straps (located top and bottom of cushion) to prevent the cushion from migrating.3.  Manufacturer might wish to consider designing a few different versions of this comfortable product tiered to small, medium and large body  frames each delivered with a different density of foam (low, medium and high density foam), similar to protocol of most mattress manufacturers.4.  This product is currently better than most products of this type on the market.Disclosure: Item received in exchange for unbiased product review, assessment and evaluation.To Your Good Health!

There are two variables to look for when purchasing a frig/freezer thermometer: temperature accuracy (performance) and design (engineering).My unit provided acceptable overall performance as measured by accuracy to within 2 degrees F but has some design limitations which make the unit inconvenient to mount or position prominently in many refrigerators or freezers not having wire shelf racks.All refrigerators should ideally be engineered with integral and accurate thermometers-one for the freezer and one for the frig. Unfortunately, unless you spend considerable $, you often have to "pimp" your appliance out by purchasing thermometers to insure your unit is maintaining safe freezing/refrigeration. I purchased this Rubbermaid "Commercial" FGR80DC thermometer along with a DayMark, IT115410 thermometer each with similar $5 price points, and then compared temperature readings of both units to one of the benchmark standard liquid scientific thermometers (The H-B instruments 5/2210 Durac organic liquid-in-glass total immersion thermometer) recommended by another reviewer colleague (Gene P. Louie) to provide a standard for comparing the performance of each.My findings revealed a 2 degree F variation (on the higher end) compared to the H-B standard for this Rubbermaid FGR80DC and a 1.5 degree F variation on the high end compared to the H-B standard for the Day Mark IT115410 Thermometer.PROS:1. Extremely well-manufactured for a $5 thermometer. Heavy-duty stainless steel case and bezel.2. Large, easy to read 2.25" tempered, shatter-resistant glass dial resists condensation.3. Clear, unobstructed metrics and dial calibrations with red  HACCP "safe" range.4. NSF-rated5. Excellent price point given the quality of manufacture.CONS:1. May be challenging to properly mount or hang in many refrigerators and/or freezers with glass shelves. The integral hook is designed to hang  down from wire rack shelves but may not be visible or practical if you have the thermometer obstructed from view due to a full frig or freezer.  Some units do not have proper clearance to permit the thermometer to hang properly and may impede shelf storage.2. The integral stand is inconvenient and easy to knock over without securing the thermometer to the shelf surface with proper mounting  or Velcro tape (See photos). If your objective is to mount the thermometer on the back wall of the frig or freezer as mine was, you can  forget that too. The back of the thermometer is not designed for mounting, limiting its resourcefulness from a design perspective.3. Made in China. I suspect quality-control may not be as rigorous with these low-cost units and there appears to be some variation in  accuracy reported by some users. Bi-metallic thermometers utilize a coil spring as a temperature-sensing element and are considerably  less expensive than other types of thermometers (liquid-in-glass stem, liquid crystal, gas, electronic/digital, infrared, resistance).RECOMMENDATIONS:1. This may be a very good choice if you want a reasonably-accurate well-made bi-metallic budget thermometer for your frig/freezer.  Design limitations however, (which could be easily addressed), make this a 4.0 star product.  For accuracy in a dial-type bi-metallic thermometer, I recommend the Day Mark above for the same price point with a slightly larger  dial; however, the same design limitations apply for both units.2. I suggest using the stand and placing a piece of Velcro or other temperature-stable mounting tape to your frig/freezer shelf if you  are not able to hang the thermometer prominently on your wire refrigerator/freezer shelf.3. Always cross-verify temperature to a reasonable benchmark standard to assess accuracy over time. The relatively inexpensiveH-B Instruments 5/2210 or 5/0220 Durac organic liquid-in-glass total immersion thermometer should provide you with an excellentstandard to verify the accuracy of most dial-type thermometers.Here's the link: http://www.amazon.com/Instrument-Organic-Immersion-Thermometer-Accuracy/dp/B00551NSFI/ref=sr_1_5?s=industrial&ie=UTF8&qid=1445106988&sr=1-5&keywords=h-b+thermometersTo Your Good Health.

If you are like me and have been struggling to gradually tier off long-term use of proton-pump inhibitors (omeprazole, esomeprazole, lansoprazole), in consultation with your gastroenterologist or healthcare practitioner, you are certainly not alone and there is much support for your struggles, frustration, discomfort and trials.PepZinGI is a patented molecule and the result of a proprietary chelation process developed in Japan. Japan, Mongolia and Korea lead the globe in the incidence of gastric-related cancers along with Asia, so there is much incentive there for research, education and development of new therapies to help address this concern. The compound consists of L-carnosine and zinc.  The manufacturers of PepZinGI (Hamari Pharmaceuticals) claim over 100 scientific studies and 38 clinical trials for PepZin GI; however, I found only 2 human clinical trials (http://www.humanclinicals.org/human-clinicals-p/#/pepzin-gi/).Most of the practice of medicine since Hippocrates remains, a process of trial and error. This is certainly true when it comes to choosing dietary supplements. While not all folks may be helped by PepZIn GI, this product helped me successfully eliminate my dependence on PPI's.  I am now PPI-free after a two month regimen of alternating my daily PPI with an H2-antagonist (Zantac 150 MG), while introducing 2x/day dosing of PepZin GI.PROS:1. Developed in Japan, patented in 1991 and in clinical use since 1994.2. An outstanding and safe adjunct therapy for trying to tier off long-term use of proton pump inhibitors (PPI's).3. Provides relief of indigestion without suppressing stomach acid.4. Promotes a healthy stomach lining by stimulating mucus secretion5. Protects the integrity of stomach cells through antioxidant properties.6. Helps reduce stomach inflammation by inhibiting cytokine expression.7. Small capsule is easy to swallow for those with swallowing issues. (See Photos)8. Tested and manufactured in the US.9. Gluten and GMO-free.10. cGMP-Compliant manufacturing.11. Reasonable and cheaper price point compared with other PepZin GI supplements.CONS:1. Ingredients are sourced globally with no disclosure of same on product label.  Although Doctor's Best claims to subject all of its  ingredients to rigorous testing and safety protocols, full sourcing disclosure is necessary to enhance consumer credibility.2. No desiccant supplied to help displace moisture.RECOMMENDATIONS:1.  An excellent supplement to consider in conjunction with DGL, digestive enzymes and an appropriate probiotic.2.  An inexpensive and safe alternative to gradually tiering off of PPI regimens.3.  Before committing to this supplement, consult with your healthcare provider and consider an H-Pylori titer (blood test) to rule out  this bacterial infection responsible for some types of gastritis and the majority of ulcers in the stomach and small intestine.4.  Find a good physician (MD/DO) who is licensed in integrative medicine and knowledgeable about nutritional approaches to managing  your healthcare.  Remember that most physicians are not trained in integrative approaches or holistic medicine.  Many (if not most)  physicians may not recognize or understand supplements or their usefulness for your particular condition(s).  Most importantly, they  may not be able to assess their interactions or potential adverse side effects if you are taking Rx meds.  You must be the most  important part of your medical team.  To Your Good Health!

I have purchased and installed Westek (2x), Intermatic (3x) and Woods (2x) photo sensors to control dusk to dawn operation of my 100 Watt HPS outdoor security fixture throughout the last 15 years. Simply put, they last only about 1-2 years before requiring replacement because the contacts oxidize in the unit and the photo cells go bad. I resolved never to purchase the above three brands again after having been disappointed so many times!The Tork 2021 was discovered by accident. An Amazon search for "photo cell" or "photo sensor" will not reveal this brand. You must search for "photo controls".  This is a winning unit for the following reasons:PROS:1. Manufactured to commercial installation specs. All Lexan enclosure-weather and moisture-resistant.2. Delay of up to 2 minutes to prevent false switching due to artificial light sources such as lightning, vehicles, etc.3. 180 Degree swivel arc4. Cover and Base are ultrasonically welded for unit integrity.5. Reliable metal slide for adjusting on/off light level.6. Excellent price point-$16.50CONS:1. Made in China.2. Very challenging to locate-I have only discovered this on Amazon through a 3rd party vendor-"Three Boys Lighting".RECOMMENDATIONS:1. An outstanding, reliable and well-manufactured unit that out-performs it's competitors hands down. I purchased 2 units.2. Coat the threads and washer with a fine veneer of silicone lubricant (Super Lube) to prevent deterioration.

Philips is a major market player in the lighting arena and manufactures lamps for most residential and commercial applications. Based in the Netherlands, they are reliable manufacturers with a very diverse and consumer-friendly infrastructure producing lamps for a global market.As lighting technology has evolved, the company outsourced some lines of older-technology bulbs (such as the HPS line) to other countries (China and eastern Europe) along with several other large competitors such as GE, Westinghouse and Sylvania.PROS:1. Philips generally has good quality control and will offer replacement if their product fails to perform as stated. I have found that their consumer support is accessible and generally friendly.2. Cost: Reasonable at about $20/100 Watt HPS lamp.3. Generally more reliable than many generic brands or Eiko and about equivalent in reliability as GE or Sylvania.CONS:1. Philips outsources manufacturing of some of its lines of lamps. The HPS line is one of these. This particular lamp is produced in China if that  matters to you. Quality control however remains acceptable. The equivalent HPS lamp made by GE is produced in Hungary. I have found that both of these are reliable lamps.2. HPS lamps contain mercury (Hg). These particular lamps contain 22 mg of Hg. and need to be disposed of in accordance with your municipality's/township's regulations governing hazardous waste.3. Specifications for these lamps can be a bit misleading as the devil is always in the details so to speak. For example, this lamp provides only 8550 lumens (approximate mean lumens); however, the manufacturer boasts 9500 lumens (approximate initial lumens).  You do the math but I assure you that you will not achieve anywhere near 9500 lumens if the application requires 9500.4. No where near as efficient or bright as the current LED lamps on the market. Progress and time marches on!RECOMMENDATIONS:1. An acceptable choice where low-level security lighting is necessary for about 25% of the cost of a 100 Watt LED spotlight fixture.  Expect to pay about $20/bulb compared to having to purchase and install a new UL-Rated Outdoor LED Spotlight Fixture at about $80 and up.2. Avoid handling the lamp (bulb) with bare hands as epidermal oils from your skin can cause the bulb to explode. Use a glove or soft cloth.3. Coat the bulb threads with a thin veneer of lubricant (Super Lube or similar silicone lubricant) for easy installation and removal).PRODUCT SPECIFICATIONS:â¢  Watts: 100â¢  Bulb: BD-17â¢  Bulb Finish: Clearâ¢  Base: Mediumâ¢  ANSI Code: S54Sâ¢  MOL (in): 3.5â¢  LCL (in): 5.4375â¢  Average Life: 24,000+ Hoursâ¢  Initial Lumens: 9500â¢  Mean Lumens: 8550â¢  Color Temp: 2100â¢  CRI: (Color Rendering Index): 21â¢  Philips Product Number: 34446-5â¢  Philips #: C100S54/Mâ¢  Section: Ceramalux High Pressure Sodium

I love great snacks and particularly cashews. When it comes to nuts, Planters has been a household and well-trusted name for many decades and synonymous with quality and freshness in its nut products. However, over the years, as our food supply and sourcing has changed, so have many U.S. companies in their efforts to sustain supply to meet both U.S. and global demand and to increase revenue.PROS:1. Planters remains a consumer-responsive brand and continues to diversify its product line to meet consumer preferences.CONS:1. Many "big box" mainstream US manufacturers have again put their ahead of providing consumers with product that uses healthy food-based ingredients and oils. This product most likely is roasted in cottonseed oil-classified as a non-foods crop. What many folks may not know is that this oil is not regulated as stringently by the FDA as those oils which are grown as a food source. The concern here is that cottonseeds are cleaned by bathing them in a solution containing hexane among other toxic chemicals-a known toxin and irritant.  Unfortunately, under current FDA regulations, US manufacturers are not required to identify the percentage of each oil used in any particular lot #/batch of their products. This is why you see the statement: "May contain one or more of the following oils.....", or "peanut and/or cottonseed oils".  I choose to not spin the roulette wheel of safety or play the "Guess That Oil" game.2. Planter's oil-"roasted" nuts tend to be excessively oily as other reviewers have suggested. Nuts are by nature, loaded with fat but some manufacturer's use a higher percentage. I much prefer dry-roasted cashews but they are nearly impossible to locate and when you do, they are extremely expensive.BOTTOM LINE:1. Purchase product (whether nuts, other snacks or any food) by reading labels carefully and avoid any that list cottonseed oil. Even if the label states peanut oil among others, you are more likely to receive product with cottonseed oil because cottonseed oil is dirt cheap for manufacturers compared to peanut oil which is expensive. A good example of this is the parallel between the use of cane sugar vs. high-fructose corn syrup (HFCS). Like peanut oil, cane sugar is expensive and high-fructose corn syrup is cheap, plentiful and subsidized in part by the federal government.. The choice is yours to make.2. For the most part, the U.S. is essentially alone in the world in using oil sourced from non-food crops for their food supply. Even a visit to the dollar stores (that sell products sourced globally and cheap) will reveal that nuts, along with other snacks contain no cottonseed oils. Consider this when making purchases.3. Consider purchasing cashews roasted exclusively in non-hydrogenated peanut or coconut oil. Years ago, most cashews in the U.S. were roasted in coconut oil-they were absolutely delicious-crunchy and crisp.4. Contact Planters (owned by Kraft Food Group) (1-877-677-3268) or your favorite domestic manufacturers and let your voice be heard about the use of these questionable and potentially harmful ingredients. They DO listen to us, especially when it begins to compromise their bottom line.....profits.Happy, safe snacking!  Be well snack aficionados!

PROS:1. Rich, creamy flavor that accentuates the taste of any coffee. Tastes better than ANY creamer currently on the market-including soy, rice and coconut-based creamers. Emulsifies completely unlike other types of creamers.2. Portion size is perfectly metered for enjoying your coffee regardless of brewing method.3. Units are well-sealed for delivery into your cup to enjoy.4. UHT stable-Doesn't require any refrigeration.5. Lactose, cholesterol and gluten-free product.4. Nestle is a respected and responsible manufacturer and this product remains the most popular coffee creamer after nearly 50 years.CONS:1. The manufacturer claims this product should be fresh up to 9 months from the expiration date ("Use By" Date) on your package/box. However,if the product is stored improperly at any point in the distribution process (e.g. excess humidity, freezing), it may result in "clumping", resulting in the creamer not emulsifying as expected in your beverage. Unfortunately, I have had this occur on many occasions which compromises the integrity of the product.2. These "single-serve" units are considerably more expensive per ounce than the refrigerated liquid Coffee-Mate in your grocer's dairy case.Unfortunately, the ingredients for each of these products differs and tastes different. I prefer the single-serve units because it tastes better and does not contain corn syrup solids as does the refrigerated liquids as well as the powder forms of Coffee-Mate.3. Contains artificial flavor and emulsifying agents that some folks may not want.3. This is NOT a dairy-free product. Coffee-Mate contains sodium caseinate which is simply a milk protein for those on dairy-restricted diets.BOTTOM LINE:1. Coffee-Mate is an excellent adjunct and supplement to light cream or half & half in your morning beverage when used in moderation.2. Consider purchasing in bulk boxes of 50 or more if you love this as I do.

For those of us who prefer to avoid the potentially dangerous side effects of undergoing testosterone replacement/enhancement, these OTC supplements may be helpful for many folks.  I decided to try this supplement due to the many positive reviews. Unfortunately, I am unable to endorse this supplement.  When taken as directed, this product appears to have absolutely no more of a therapeutic or clinical effect as a placebo.Moderate daily exercise seems to be a more prudent strategy. Your own results may be different; however I suggest the following cautions before taking this or any supplement without first consulting your own healthcare practitioner:PROS:1. If you are NOT taking Rx meds, this supplement may be one to consider. (See cautionary note below).2. Made in USA; however, only the supplement distributor is identified on the bottle-NOT the manufacturer because this information is usually considered "proprietary".3. If purchased on Amazon, product comes with a $ back guarantee.CONS:1. Unable to contact distributor: The bottle lists a contact number for "JG Sports"; however, there is absolutely no customer support whatsoever. After 9 calls over a 3-week interval, you continue to speak to an unanswered phone.2. Product expiration date: Completely invisible unless held up to the light. Located on the bottom of the bottle but stamped in light yellow on the surface of a glossy white bottle. I find it a hard sell that anyone truly interested in transparency would think of such inconspicuous labeling.3. Directions for Dosage: Inconvenient. Having to alternate dosage after 5 days and off for two is often inconvenient and resulted in no noticeable therapeutic change after 5 dosage cycles of the supplement.BOTTOM LINE:1. DO NOT take any supplements (particularly herbals) without first contacting your physician. If you are on RX meds, there are many potentially serious adverse interactions between some herbal supplements and conventional prescription medications which may either enhance or compromise the effect of the supplement(s). Unfortunately, even today, many MD and DO's are not adequately schooled in interpreting these critically important interactions.2. Consider consulting a trusted senior RPh. (pharmacist) knowledgeable with these interactions if you are uncertain about this.3.  Save your money-Remember the old adage...."If something seems too good to be true, it probably is"!!

The benefits and advantages of Vitamin D continue to accumulate in the research arena, particularly over the past 5 years. We now know how important it is to maintain adequate vitamin D levels for optimal health, since insufficient vitamin D has been linked to cardiovascular disease, diabetes, depression, osteoporosis, autoimmune disease and cancer.Here is what you need to know about the differences between the two forms of Vitamin D:1. Vitamin D2: (ergocalciferol) This is the synthetic (artificial) form of D produced from fungi and yeast.Recent research has demonstrated that D2 is not as effective in increasing blood (serum) levels of Vitamin D as D-3.2. Vitamin D3: (cholecalciferol): This is the natural form of Vitamin D naturally produced in our skin by sunlight. It is synthesized from lanolin (sheep's wool).** Note: There is now a Vegan D3 available on the market. Here is your link: http://www.amazon.com/Solgar-Vitamin-Cholecalciferol-Vegetable-Capsules/dp/B0019KAS66/ref=sr_1_2?s=hpc&ie=UTF8&qid=1416178087&sr=1-2&keywords=vegan+vitamin+d3+2000+iuPROS:1. D3 is the clearly preferred form of Vitamin D because it is more effective at increasing blood serum levels of 25 (OH) D-The standard blood test for Vitamin D. (Tripkovich et al, 2012).2. D3 has a significantly longer shelf life compared to D2 supplements.3. These softgels are small and easy to swallow-even for those who have difficulty.4. Product is GMP (Good Manufacturing Process) certified.5. Contains extra virgin olive oil (EVOO) as a natural emulsifier.6. Wheat, yeast, egg, gluten, milk, tree nut, fish, shellfish and soy free.7. Clear "Best By" Date stamped on bottle bottom.CONS:1. This softgel capsule contains animal by-products (bovine gelatin) and should be avoided by those with allergies, sensitivities or who are vegan.2. This product is not GMO-free.RECOMMENDATIONS:1. An excellent product for the price, recommended for daily supplementation of D3 but 4 stars for GMO and bovine gelatin.2. I would like to see a 360 count bottle, GMO-free and veg caps available as does Nutrigold for this product.3. Take with a fatty food for best absorption.4. Ask your physician for a "25-hydroxyl D" 25 (OH) D blood test if you believe you are at-risk for low D3. This is the standard test to measure blood serum levels of Vitamin D. The optimal range (referred to as "reference range") of Vitamin D for us is between 30-40 ng/ml on this blood panel. You can then monitor accurately your levels and make necessary adjustments when appropriate.Wishing You All Good Health!!

PROS:1. Contains PTFE (aka....Teflon-DuPonts famous trademark)2. Does an excellent job lubricating lock shackles, tumblers, and equipment exposed to cold temperatures.3. Supplied in a thin tube with an integral syringe to deliver the lubricant.4. Made in USACONS:1. Plastic outer container is both difficult to open and subject to cracking if opened abruptly out of frustration.2. Clearly overpriced at 0.25 oz. for nearly $10.3. Syringe has no metering and is challenging to verify that you have delivered the recommended 2-3 drops, whether vertically or horizontally into the keyhole because you cannot see the drops when inserted into the keyhole.4. Lubricant is runny-over-dosing of lubricant will cause it to run out of the cylinder.5. Supplied shirt (pen) clip is unnecessary.RECOMMENDATIONS:1. Does the job and appears to provide excellent lubrication; however, there are more cost effective alternatives that do the same job e.g. CRC heavy duty silicone lubricant ($2 for an 11 oz. can); "Super Lube" 51010-Same exact product ($5) and of course the go to favorite-WD-40 ($3 for a 3 oz. can).  The choice is yours!!

Broan makes quality ventilation accessories and is a U.S. based manufacturer.  This is a popular and well-rated roof cap with pluses and minuses. If you heed the warnings and make the necessary adjustments relative to installation you should have a roof cap that provides trouble-free performance for years.PROS:1. A reasonably well-manufactured residential low-profile roof cap made from 24 gauge CRCQ  galvanized steel (frame).and aluminum internal sub-parts.2. Black electrically-bonded epoxy finish3. Integral back-draft damper and bird screen4. Clear and relatively straightforward installation instructions.CONS:1. This roof cap is actually an import but cleverly and prominently depicts the politically-correct USA logo on its box. If you have an electron microscope, you will see that the item is actually a hybrid product globally sourced. The manufacturer does not provide details as to which parts are manufactured in the US.2. This item should be supplied with the proprietary 4" DC4 duct collar necessary for proper installation, but you need to purchase this separately ($6.61) or purchase the RVK1A Roof Ducting "Kit"  which supplies all you should need for the job-two tie wraps,8' of 4" diameter flexible foil duct transition hose, the duct collar and a strip of self-sticking compression-type weather-seal.3. The "bird screen" is simply a loose-fitting light gauge wire screen which can and will be penetrated by some birds and most definitely by ambitious squirrels searching for safe harbor, moisture and nesting. This screen should have been heavier gauge and screwed into the cap frame on all four sides.RECOMMENDATIONS:1. Still one of the better residential roof caps on the market at this time.2. If you purchase the Broan kit (cited above) DO NOT USE the 8' compression duct hose. In most municipalities and townships, this is clearly not compliant with fire codes and regulations and will also trap more lint in the inner lining of the hose restricting air flow and creating a potential hazard. Instead, purchase a semi-rigid 4-8' section of smooth fire-rated aluminum duct available at most big box hardware stores and certainly any roofing supply outlet.3. Skip the cheap tie-wraps furnished in the Broan kit if you purchased this-They are flimsy and do not yield a tight and secure grip on each duct junction. Buy two 4-5" stainless steel adjustable clamps.3. Prior to installation, be certain to insure that the duct collar is properly installed into the roof cap aperture (opening). To do this, you will need to seat the seal with a good caliber roofing cement and seal all nails with this compound as well to assure water-resistance.

If you purchase the Broan 636 3-4" Roof Cap/Vent you will need this exact duct collar (DC4) in order to complete your installation properly. Broan's Catalog # for this part is: S99610002.PROS:1. This fluted-edge collar is specifically designed to fit the Broan 636 roof cap.2. Made from anodized sheet metal3. Made in USACONS:1. Poor, uneven riveting off-center (See Photos)2. A bit awkward to properly fit into the Model 636 roof cap vent opening aperture.2. This is a proprietary part which must be purchased separately from Broan/Nutone for the Model 636 roof cap.RECOMMENDATIONS:1. If you purchase the Broan Model # 636 roof cap you must be certain to also purchase this duct collar or it will NOT fit properly!2. Broan should supply this collar with the purchase of the 636 roof cap-A real minus in my opinion.

I will cut to the chase on this review since so many of my other colleagues have reviewed these Panasonic headphones.In my opinion, you will not find a set of open headphones with the caliber of tight, punchy, rich and rewarding sound as these.Worth every penny and then some imho as a classical guitarist, musician and headphone aficionado.PROS:1. Price is a clear market-buster-I paid $4.562. Extremely lightweight (1.7 ozs) and uber comfortable-does not pinch or bind.3. Unsurpassed base response at 16 Hz-Clearly "Best in Class" (Sensitivity rated at 100 dB/mW)4. Excellent for listening to just about any genre-infuses richness to the listening experience.5. Large 30mm diaphragms with neodymium magnets.CONS:1. Mediocre treble response (tinny, shallow, superficial highs but within expected frequency response parameters considering  the exceptional price point.2. Plastic un-reinforced headband does not retain its original flexibility after extended use and may become somewhat distended.RECOMMENDATIONS:1. Purchase several pairs of these. At this price, you can afford to have several around the house, work, auto, studio!!2. I still love my old metal RS PRO-35 Titanium Phones the best but these blow anything away at this price.The Richness of

Avery has a fine reputation for quality stationery and office supply products.  This item is excellent for archiving documents for professional business or educational presentations, K-12 projects requiring a polished, classy appearance or for archiving important family photos.PROS:1. Excellent non-vinyl based material that does not yellow, tint, crack, blister or peel.2. Available in 2 finishes: "Diamond Clear' (high-definition) #74130 or non-glare (#74401).3. Acid-Free and Avery claims protectors "will not lift print from documents"4. Easy access and document insertion: top and one-side.5. Thickest caliber sheet protector Avery manufactures.6. Avery's "PRS" nomenclature helps you select the correct protectors for your application:  "P" for Presentation-caliber documents for professional business and educational materials; "R" for archiving Reference-  related materials and documents and "S" for Storage documents.CONS:1.  These sheet protectors are not suitable for many hobbyists, stamp and coin collectors who demand archiving documents, stamps or coins in completely acid-free and/or oxygen/nitrogen free environments. Stamp collectors who have stamp sheets will not be able to properly archive them using this product if there is selvage to the stamp sheets.2. I would like to see Avery amend their "print transfer" claim to:  "transfer-resistant material" to be more accurate.  Although Avery claims this product will not lift print from documents, I have found that this will indeed occur if there is adequate compression placed on the documents for a period of time- For example, if you are storing these documents horizontally in a stack.3. It would be helpful to identify the exact "mil thickness" as a useful metric to help consumers actually compare competing manufacturer's sheet protectors before purchasing.RECOMMENDATIONS:1.  Overall an excellent product and highly recommended for specific applications.
