Those who take a statin (Lipitor, Crestor and the rest of the statin family) should know by this point that it is helpful to supplement with CoQ10. This is because all statins reduce and compromise the levels of CoQ10 made by your body. CoQ10 is a fat-soluble antioxidant produced naturally and concentrated in the liver, kidneys and heart.  As we age, levels of this important compound decline significantly. Therefore, sustaining adequate levels of CoQ10 becomes particularly significant for those who remain on statins, are diabetic, pre-diabetic (T2), have Parkinson's disease or for those who have chronic cardiac issues.Our typical American diet generally furnishes only about 10mg of CoQ10 daily so supplementation is usually necessary to reach more optimum levels (Weil).Folks under 30 may benefit from this less expensive form of CoQ10 (Ubiquinone) while those over age 40 may wish to consider the more expensive reduced form of CoQ10 (Ubiquinol).All supplements labeled "CoQ10" are clearly not the same.  (At least as far as the marketing goes!)There are two distinct forms of CoQ10:1. Ubiquinone (USP): This is the less expensive and more marketed oxidized or non-reduced form of this antioxidant.2. Ubiquinol:  This is the more expensive reduced form of CoQ10 claiming higher absorption.It is interesting to note that your body actually converts each form of CoQ10 into the other (Mayo Clinic). However, some healthcare practitioners, and without question the supplement industry, suggest that ubiquinol (expensive form) is more efficient  since it has greater antioxidant efficiency, particularly for folks over age 40 (Dr. Weil).  The choice is your to make in consultation with your physician.PROS1. This product delivers ubiquinone-the oxidized or un-reduced form of Co-enzyme Q10.2. These softgels are somewhat smaller than most other manufacturer's CoQ10 gels and may be easier to swallow.3. Contains "BioPerine", a patented, standardized extract from black pepper used to enhance bioavailability and absorption.4. Product is GMO-free and GMP (Good Manufacturing Process) certified.5. Egg, gluten, milk, nut, shellfish and soy free.6. Clear "Best By" Date stamped on bottle bottom.7. Excellent, competitive price points for this supplement.CONS:1. Product label introduced as "High Absorption"  is somewhat misleading to many uninformed folks (See Photo). Although they are technically and legally transparent in the ingredient listing the front label implies ubiquinol, the reduced form of CoQ10 associated with higher absorption.2. The softgel capsule uses animal by-products (bovine gelatin) and should be avoided by those with allergies, sensitivities or who are vegan.RECOMMENDATIONS:1. This is for many an excellent product but those over 40 should consider purchasing ubiquinol which some studies have demonstrated to have higher absorption and higher antioxidant activity. Check prices and stay with a reputable name brand that is GMP certified.2. Take this supplement with foods containing fat e.g peanut butter, cheese for better absorption.In Good Health!

Samsung is a major player in the electronics and HDTV market and there are many excellent in-depth technical reviews on the performance of these Samsung sets. The purpose of this review is to comment on the overall reliability and customer support on Samsung products and to share my experience.PROS:1. Extremely energy efficient- $8/year2. Clear, crisp picture when working3. Excellent price on Amazon4. VESA wall mount5. A best buy compared to the comparable 2013 40" version.CONS:1. Reliability: If your priority is features then reliability becomes secondary to many.  However, I believe reliability is paramount.  I received a lemon from the outset on this Samsung.  The unit consistently cycled on and off making it impossible to watch. It was subsequently returned to Amazon and I purchased a 40" Panasonic which performs beautifully. Consumer Reports rates Samsung reliability at 4%. The highest reliability on these sets continues to be Panasonic at 2% with an absolutely stunning picture compared to its Samsung counterpart. The small price differential was more than worth it to me.2. Samsung and many other manufacturers, continue to participate in "panel roulette", purchasing other manufacturer's panels to save cost. So, depending on the model and version of your Samsung set, you may actually be purchasing a generic Chinese,  Sharp or Samsung panel...spin the wheel and good luck!  Panasonic now uses LG panels for their sets. However, Samsung has earned a reputation for using low-caliber components, resistors, capacitors and power supply's compared to other manufacturers such as Sony and Panasonic. This also impacts overall brand reliability if this is important to you.3.  Customer Support:  Samsung continues to have one of the worst customer support networks available. Support is globally-outsourced to non-native speaking associates on poor VOIP lines and the company has a long and well-documented history of making it challenging at best to receive manufacturer-supported and sanctioned customer-focused quality and attention. Over the years, I have owned several Samsung appliances only to be disappointed at the lack of their interest in your purchase at having their equipment repaired or replaced under the terms and conditions of their "warranty".RECOMMENDATIONS:1. 2 Stars for reliability and consistently unacceptable customer support.2. Consider what is most important to you in choosing a TV then select accordingly. Reliability and quality components are highest for Panasonic, LG, Sharp and Sony and lowest for Westinghouse, Mitsubishi and Sylvania.

Purchased to connect my phenomenal old Radio Shack PRO35 titanium cans to a Little Dot 1+ hybrid headphone amplifier. (See Photo)I would still have preferred a smaller adapter but this is acceptable.PROS1. Excellent build quality for the price point.2. Tight, static-free connection for a 1/4" male to 1/8" female adapter3. Durable, easy to grip black polymer overmold (not rubber)4. Fully-shielded 24K-plated contacts5. Designed by D'Addario manufacturers of fine accessories and guitar strings for musicians for decades.CONS1. Ergonomic but unnecessarily bulky and cumbersome, particularly for smaller electronics and headphone amplifiers.RECOMMENDATION1. A wise purchase. Recommended.

Solgar is a well-recognized player in the supplement market for many years and has established a fine reputation for quality, reliability and customer support. This product's evolution has witnessed some interesting formula/ingredient changes over its product lifetime-some favorable and some unfavorable. Given these considerations, this is clearly a 4-star product at this time for the following reasons:PROS:1. Uses a cross-flow, micro-filtration proprietary extraction process which does not compromise the amino acids.2. Offers the complete amino acid profile and BCAA (branched-chain amino acids) and immunoglobulins.3. 98% lactose free, rBGH (recombinate bovine growth hormone), gluten and artificial flavor free4. Free-form L-glutamine and BCAA's5. 20g protein per 25g serving  (scoop); 90 calories/serving, 5 calories from fat.6. Emulsifies easily even when mixed with cold beverages.7. Good price point compared with similar competitors for a full 2 lb. can.8. Vanilla-neutral flavor acceptable for mixing with almond/coconut milk and fruit.CONS:1. Contains a blend of both whey protein isolate and concentrate vs. the preferred 100% isolate.2. Contains a negligible (< 1%) but nevertheless undesirable amount of soy lecithin for those allergic or intolerant to soy.RECOMMENDATIONS:1. Solgar should remove the soy lecithin (which they use to increase emulsification) and switch to sunflower lecithin.2. This product is acceptable for those who have no sensitivity to soy and who use this product as an adjunct to increase dietary protein.  I use this in my Nutri Bullet as a morning superfood "protein shake" mixed with fruit, spinach, kale, coconut milk and water.3. I ideally prefer a 100% whey protein isolate like Blue Bonnet but this is acceptable-If you are using this simply to mix with water I would strongly recommend this product in the chocolate flavor.

I have tried at least 13 different probiotic supplements over the past 20 years including Jarrow Dophilus EPS which used to be very effective.  If you have a sensitive GI system or suffer from any type of chronic digestive/GI issue you no doubt understand how frustrating it can be to find the perfect supplement.  For me, this product has been superb and I recommend it for the following reasons:PROS:1. Without question, one of the finest probiotic supplements on the market for quality, product integrity, price points and support.2. Perfectly balances and regulates the GI system.3. Contains 10 different clinically-validated acid-resistant probiotic strains with added FOS4. Delivers 25 billion organisms through the "Best Buy" date stamped on bottle bottom.5. Clear, transparent and generous "Best By" dates usually 2 years to expiration.6. GMP Certified. Dairy, wheat, soy and gluten-free veg capsules.7. Light-resistant bottles to help maintain product potency.CONS:1. With much debate and controversy regarding deterioration and reduction of product potency after the product leaves the production facility, Now should use "At Time of Manufacture" (ATOM) as a more accurate metric since ALL probiotics begin to lose their potency and become compromised gradually following production.2. Although these probiotic strains claim to be "acid-resistant", I would prefer to see enteric-coated capsules as a delivery vehicle.3. Size: Should be supplied as bottles of 60 and 120 instead of 50 since the recommended dosage is 1-2/day. Who ran the numbers on this one?4. I would also like to see included in each bottle "Tri-Sorb" cylinder desiccants rather than the current paper sachets.RECOMMENDATIONS:1. This is an outstanding first-rate probiotic. Highly recommended. Remember however, that you may need to adjust your dosage based upon your individual results and body chemistry.  Start with 1/day and titrate to two if necessary.2. Like many supplements and other types of medications, you may find that after time the probiotic becomes somewhat less effective.  If this occurs, simply rotate off to a different probiotic.  Experts recommend rotating your multivitamins for the same reason.3. Refrigerate all of your probiotics upon receipt even if it is not required to do so-you will prolong the product's effectiveness.  If you are traveling and cannot refrigerate, store in a cool, dry and temperature-stable environment.

Square Trade has been a major player in the residential warranty arena for many years now. For some time, they have enjoyed a reputation for reasonable and attractive price points for covering your electronics, phones and other equipment as well as for their customer service. I have purchased 6 warranties from ST but there has been a clear and substantial deterioration in the quality and consistency of their repair and customer support "experience" which has now altered my assessment of the value of a Square Trade purchase for the following reasons.PROS:1. Market-competitive price points compared with Best Buy's Geek Squad and other competitors for large electronics, HDTV's, android and i Phones and other equipment which draw you in initially on the purchase.2. Customer Support still in the U.S.3. Most customer support associates are friendly and generate the perception of a friendly customer culture but often lack the training, resources or empowerment to address customer concerns.CONS:1. Access ALL of the terms and conditions BEFORE you purchase your warranty. If not, you are likely to be very disappointed if and when your item requires repair.  Unfortunately, Square Trade is not transparent in making this information conspicuous before the purchase. ST strategically places their "Terms and Conditions" in text at the very end of the page requiring an electron microscope to read.  Most of us never think of reviewing this prior to purchase but you should ALWAYS do so. Remember that the devil is always in the details and this is especially relevant with Square Trade. Their liability under the terms of the warranty is limited to the actual purchase price of your item. READ IT CAREFULLY.2. Like all warranty companies, they remain excessively bureaucratic.  Expect to spend indefinite periods of time and space waiting on the line as they "review" your inquiry or case while you age.  ST thinks nothing of asking their customers to hold for  30 minutes as they educate themselves at your expense. Instead of guaranteeing a time-sensitive call-back for those issues demanding such attention, Square Trade associates challenge your patience while they search for information which should be at their fingertips.3. On many occasions, Square Trade provides inaccurate and/or clearly incomplete information regarding your inquiry. Supervisors are often unavailable or not empowered to resolve customer issues quickly and accurately as used to be the case several years ago. Having had (and have) multiple policies and a repair claim to my credit, my experience suggests that their "Customer Service" is extremely porous with little respect for customer's time.4. Claim Processing can be inconsistent and cumbersome and is far from a seamless, coordinated process. My repair claim resulted in having to make over six calls to ST. Not only did ST initially deny a valid laptop claim due to a poorly trained associate, but also failed to send out a shipping box as they had agreed.5. Square Trade's promotional incentives can be misleading and their lack of transparency in honoring them often marginal at best. Keep in mind that to receive ST-sponsored promotions, you must purchase your warranty directly through Square Trade's website and not through Amazon. This can be a clear disadvantage because the best prices on Square Trade warranty products is consistently through Amazon.  For example, ST does not offer a 5 year HDTV warranty on their own website; to get this, you must purchase it from Amazon.6. Communicating with ST through their poor, tinny "outer-space" VOIP line contributes to frustration and not an efficient and pleasant customer experience.  The "experience" equation becomes even more prominent if you are unlucky enough to get the representative whose native language is clearly not English or who does not articulate clearly.7. In addition to their verbatim phone script, ST addresses each client by their first name which I suspect is intended as a friendly gesture. Many of us may find this practice somewhat juvenile and patronizing, particularly those who of us who graduated from kindergarten-I find that "sir" or using a last name seems to work just fine.RECOMMENDATIONS:1. Consider if you really need these types of "warranties".  Consumer Reports has consistently recommended to avoid these types of warranties because the return on investment is often not worth the price of the warranty product.2. If you do decide to purchase a Square Trade warranty, purchase it directly from Amazon. Here's why: Amazon's partnership with ST is a revenue-enhancing conduit for delivering Square Trade's products.  As such, any grievances become arbitrated and rectified quickly and efficiently by Amazon on behalf of its customers. My 9 calls to ST to try and resolve a recent issue remained unresolved until Amazon intervened to issue the accurate credit.3. Amazon's price points for ST warranties is volatile and changes frequently, often by as much as $10-$15. I suggest placing your chosen plan in your cart and waiting a few days before purchasing since the price fluctuates rapidly. In most cases, you have 30 days from the date of purchase of your equipment to purchase the warranty so you have time to determine the price ceiling and floor for your particular warranty.3. Request a complete copy of the terms and conditions governing your specific warranty and READ IT CAREFULLY BEFORE PURCHASING.

PROS:1. Exceedingly excellent quality control on all Scotch 3M products making a 3M purchase one you can trust to perform consistently.2. Outstanding performance particularly for sensitive documents and applications or for those projects having little tolerance for error.3. Superior to Elmer's, Avery UHU and Crayola and other generic glue sticks hands-down.4. When 3M initially released their purple glue sticks back in the late 1980's, they were labeled as a "permanent adhesive",  manufactured in France and supplied in 0.25 oz. sticks.  Several decades later, the present version is just as good, supplied in 0.28 oz. sticks, manufactured in Korea for 3M, but not specifically labeled as "a permanent adhesive".  "Permanent" is a relative term and I suspect that this word was omitted in the current generation of this product for risk-management by the Company.5. Although not specifically stated on the blister cards, 3M has a fine reputation for standing behind the integrity and performance of their products. The company will generally replace the product without hassle.6. 3M Support: This is an American company staffed with friendly and responsive customer support, especially their corporate offices in St. Paul, MN.  Their toll-free # is: (800)-328-6276. No difficult to hear VOIP lines outsourced to the Philippines, Panama or India. Just English-speaking, knowledgeable and respectful professionals well-trained in helping you complete your project without keeping you on hold indefinitely or providing you with inaccurate or misleading information as so many other companies do.CONS:1. Price points for 3M continue to be among the highest in its class (along with Avery) and glue sticks are no exception here. Expect comparable products to be $1-2 cheaper on average.2. Avoid using this product on highly-glossy surfaces and materials having textured and/or raised surfaces. This is the Achilles heel for this product yielding only marginal adhesion.BOTTOM LINE:1. You get what you pay for generally speaking.  If you have non-textured paper projects that demand sensitive applications these are by far one of the best you can buy and well worth the price differentials in my opinion.

To find great items, you truly do need to "think outside of the bottle" so to speak.  When one hears of "Dr. Brown's", you either think of a vintage cream soda or a line of patented baby bottles.  I was interested in neither of these but was looking for a set of hobby brushes which could be used for a wide variety of applications around the house.PROS:1. These are phenomenal little brushes which have a multitude of resourceful uses......from cleaning piano, phone and PC keyboards to straws, automotive uses (cleaning radiator and HVAC compressor fins), small vented appliances, hairbrushes,  musical instruments, audio equipment and maintaining medical equipment....the uses are really endless and limited only by your imagination.2. Supplied in a blister-carded display of four brushes, each measures: 5.50" in total length. The actual bristle-portion measures 1.5" in length and 0.25" in diameter.  The bristles themselves appear well-attached to their twisted wire shafts and did not pull out throughout intense rotation and cleaning into tight crevices.3. Product is claimed by the manufacturer to be dishwasher-safe (top-rack) and BPA free.4. Extremely versatile product whose uses extend well beyond those conceived by the manufacturer. (see above comments)CONS/CAUTIONS:1. All brushes are the exact same dimensions.  I would like to see a "set" of four of these with different diameter bristles and handle lengths.  Understandably, these were marketed specifically for Dr. Brown's baby bottle brushes and its "system".2. The wire handles could stand a bit more tensile strength.BOTTOM LINE/SUGGESTIONS:1. For $2.16 (Amazon, 7.02.2014) this is a deal you cannot pass on. I paid nearly $7 for these back in January 2014 and they are worth every penny.  Highly recommend!2. I would recommend hanging these brushes by their integral handles and allow them to air-dry after cleaning rather than placing them in the dishwasher.In good health!

3M has a fine reputation for manufacturing outstanding adhesives for residential and commercial use.  That is why I decided to try this tape rather than a cheaper line (such as Frost King) to help address a leak in a relatively new vinyl replacement window. Here are my thoughts and observations as a DIY'er:PROS:1.  This 1.5" wide tape is substantial in terms of thickness; it is smooth and applies easily as per the directions on the outer sleeve.2. For minor to moderate air leaks I have found this tape to be very effective if properly applied prepping the surface with isopropyl alcohol as recommended in order to assure ideal surface adhesion.3. Has not cracked, split or yellowed after 4 months of use.4. 3M customer service is particularly helpful in answering questions regarding application and product availability.  I believe that this is factored into their retail consumer price structures.  When I called on 7.2.2014, I spoke with a 3M rep who spoke English, took the time to answer all of my questions-clearly and thoroughly ("Scott") and was meticulously professional. You get what you pay for folks!CONS/CAUTIONS:1.  This tape is designed only as a seasonal product; if you intend to use the tape to permanently seal leaks (beyond 4 months), there will most likely be adhesive transference, making it extremely difficult to remove the tape.  However, 3M says that you can use this tape permanently if you choose to do so but it is not recommended.2. This tape is made from polyethylene with a proprietary acrylic adhesive in order to facilitate removal at the end of a season, according to 3M. DO NOT apply firm pressure on the tape, just assure a smooth, bubble-free seal.  When removing tape, remove very slowly and evenly if applied to acrylic latex painted surfaces.  Some reviewers have been disappointed at this process but I did not encounter a problem.3. This is an expensive product compared with the market competition from other vendors. The package supplies 10 yds. of tape-meager in comparison to Duck Brands, Frost King and others.4. This product, which has been in 3M's product line for decades, is unfortunately only supplied in 1.5" widths x 10 yd. rolls.5. No integral cutter supplied making the process a bit more inconvenient.6. No traditional "3M roll tab" for easy starting and peeling as with other 3M products.7. Tape picks up your fingerprints which can compromise adhesion due to your epidermal oils.BOTTOM LINE/SUGGESTIONS:1.  A  3.0 star rating, compromised by a number of inconveniences which should be able to be simply addressed by 3M making this a truly great sealing tape.2.  Tape should be supplied in 1" rolls as well depending on specific application.3.  Steep price point-Look for off-season sales if available. I would like to see a 15 or 20 yd. roll priced with economy of scale for consumers.4.  Recommended product but with the above-cited caveats.

I usually love Rubbermaid products. They have had a history of well-designed products with their finger on the pulse of the U.S. consumer market for housewares for many decades.  Not this time though.  This is essentially, a mislabeled toilet brush masquerading as a "bottle brush".  As such, it is somewhat misleading to many consumers and the manufacturer should attempt to trash the label or re-design the product properly.PROS:1. Reasonably well-manufactured. Solid, ergonomic, comfortable-rubber grip handle.2. Stiff, coarse 1" "flared" bristles with a 3" bristle head for maximizing and cleaning many surface areas3. Elliptical handle for hangingCONS/CAUTIONS:1. The versatility of this brush is limited by its restrictive and "stereotyped" design.  This is essentially, a Rubbermaid toilet brush, both by appearance and function.  It both looks like and performs as a toilet brush.  From a marketing perspective, it is extremely dated and anachronistic. Rubbermaid....time to come into the 21st century.2. It is not uncommon, when used regularly and vigorously, for bristles to dislodge in use.  This is a potential safety hazard in my opinion, particularly if consumers are using this for baby bottle cleaning.3. This brush does not fit in many applications for which it should have been designed. For example, because it is only 13.5" in length and has a 2.5" wide bristle head, it will not fit into many sports water bottles, a quart Thermos with a standard 1.25" mouth opening and many other types of bottles.  Clearly, this was a clever attempt by Rubbermaid to "cross label" their classic toilet brush for use as a "bottle brush"!  Shame on you Rubbermaid!4. The brush handle is too rigid, too short and lacks the flexibility necessary to thoroughly clean many bottle surfaces.5. Brush bristles are all coarse and uniform in tensile strength-not ideal for cleaning ANY type of infant/baby bottles or supplies where safety is seminal.BOTTOM LINE/SUGGESTIONS:1. Use this to clean your toilets folks....not bottles used to hold potable fluids. I suspect that Rubbermaid decided to axe the product review panel usually comprised of regular folks who actually use this stuff.2. This product requires a more transparent re-labeling initiative to call it what it REALLY is......A Rubbermaid TOILET BRUSH! If it looks like a duck and walks like a duck.....(You all know the ending)!3. For cleaning water bottles and Thermos-like containers try the Oxo "Good Grips" Water Bottle Cleaning Set: http://www.amazon.com/OXO-Grips-Water-Bottle-Cleaning/dp/B008HMF9LS/ref=sr_1_4?ie=UTF8&qid=1404258653&sr=8-4&keywords=oxo+bottle+brush.4.  For baby bottles, try the Philips AVENT BPA-Free Bottle Brush: http://www.amazon.com/Philips-AVENT-Free-Bottle-Brush/dp/B0009ET49K/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1404259427&sr=8-1&keywords=top-rated+baby+bottle+brush.Wishing you all good health.

Selecting an appropriate air filter for our Trane XV-95/16i HVAC system has been a challenge, in part due to differences of opinion from each HVAC company.  In fact, even Trane was reluctant to provide specific performance metrics making it easy to select the right filter for our system-even when provided with the ducting specs and sq. footage of our home.  I contacted 6 different HVAC contractors and received five different opinions.  Two suggested purchasing the cheapest .59 cent filter, one an electrostatic filter, another suggested a custom-made electrostatic filter, one said to purchase a Filtrete Ultra (3M) and one contractor recommended experimenting with an assortment of filters-not exactly scientific nor did it engender any degree of confidence or credibility in these folks.After using other brand-name filters and discovering considerable lint and dust in our home, we used the Filtrete 600 MPR filter.Here is my assessment of its performance in our home:PROS:1. 3M manufactures outstanding filter media in a wide variety of performance metrics and applications.  This particular "Dust and Pollen Filter" appears to strike the perfect compromise between protecting your HVAC equipment and fan motor by not restricting air flow through the system with doing a reasonably good job of cleaning the air.2. If you do your research, you will find that this particular 3M 600 MPR filter has the lowest pressure drop (at 0.14) of any 3M filter in the Filtrete line. This is an important metric which many other manufacturers do not disclose.3. Approx. 70% efficient compared with other filters in the 3M line but the best cost/benefit price points and bang for your buck.4. Good for a maximum of 90 days depending on usage and home environment. (See comment below)CONS/CAUTIONS:1. Since MERV and MPR are completely different metrics, all manufacturers of filter media should be required to provide equivalent indices TOGETHER on EACH filter to help consumers compare similar-performing filters across brands and manufacturers. For example, it would be useful for some consumers to know that a 600 MPR-rated filter is equivalent to a MERV rating of 8.  The MPR metric was developed by 3M engineers to help demonstrate the advantage of 3M filters in capturing the smallest airborne particles-i.e. those from 0.3 to 1 micron in size.  The MERV standard however, measures the ability of a filter to capture larger particles using a scale from 1-12. TMI !!!! Let's have just ONE valid and reliable standard which everyone can understand and use!2. The 90 day (3 month) replacement window is essentially a marketing strategy to increase sales through customer perception.  The real truth is that filter longevity is affected by many variables including the use of tobacco, fireplace/wood-burning stove smoke, burning candles, construction projects in the home, sanding projects, pets and dirty duct work.  If any of these conditions exist, filters should be replaced MONTHLY.BOTTOM LINE/SUGGESTIONS:1. This is an excellent filter dollar for dollar with acceptable metrics for performance, equipment protection and cost.2.  Even without any of the above-cited "special conditions", I replace our filter monthly.  I also leave our fan on "circulate", which runs the fan continuously and cleans the indoor air better.  Of course the disadvantage here is that this requires us to swap out the filter more regularly.3. If you are inserting your filter vertically through a drop-down narrow, sheet-metal plenum, it is often difficult to retrieve the filter for replacement without mangling the filter frame. My suggestion is to spray a light film of lubricant (silicone or PAM) along each side of the paper frame. I also use two pieces of duct tape to help retrieve the filter from the narrow cavity.4. To determine when the filter needs to be changed, hold the filter up to an unobstructed light source. If you cannot see light through the filter, it should be changed regardless of time interval.I wish you all a happy and healthy home.

Good Idea but Energy and HVAC Equipment InefficientThese are essentially, secondary filters designed to contribute to decreasing allergens and dust particles in the house. For the $6.48 I couldn't go wrong, right?  Wrong. Here's why:PROS:1. A good concept. These are white electrostatically-charged filter media that are extremely easy to measure, cut and place into position into your floor registers or inside of your vent plate.2. They appear to be reasonably effective in reducing air-borne dust in the room(s) in which they are placed.3.  They appear on the surface to be cost-effective (i.e. cheap) at .54 each and the manufacturer claims a 90-day replacement period.CONS/CAUTIONS:1.  One of the major disadvantages to these filters is that they clearly compromise and reduce the energy efficiency of your HVAC equipment-especially on residential ducted systems more than 5-6 years of age.  Your equipment (fan motor) needs to perform harder to adequately distribute cooled/heated air through the vents.  This explains why there is a caveat listed on the package discouraging users from installing multiple filters throughout the property for this reason.2. I am using only one of these filters in our small, galley-type kitchen and have discovered that the filters need to be swapped out  EVERY month during active winter and summer seasons to operate efficiently.  At 90 days, as recommended by the manufacturer, this small filter became clogged with debris restricting air flow by approximately 75%.  This is very consistent with advice provided by our HVAC technicians who also do not recommend using these filters due to the potential for air flow restriction and equipment strain.3. If you use these filters, you must insure that your secure the filter snugly into the register opening. If the filter installs too loosely, it can fall into the duct and become useless or block air flow severely.BOTTOM LINE:1. A good concept but flawed implementation and engineering at this point rendering the filter only marginally effective and efficient when both cost and equipment efficiency are taken into consideration in the equation.2. I strongly recommend that you heed the advice of more seasoned HVAC professionals: Consider using inexpensive pleated filter media and change your HVAC primary filter every month.  One of the highest-rated filters for most residential HVAC systems is the 3M Filtrete 600 MPR Cat.# 9831DC .  It is an excellent filter at a modest price point and balances cost-effectiveness with equipment efficiency and performance.  Here is the link: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000P75WKQ/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc=13. Remember that "dear is cheap and cheap is dear" as my mother used to always say.  It is wiser to protect expensive components in your system from breakdown by avoiding unnecessary secondary filters if possible.  The exception to this would be households with critically-sensitive or immune-compromised individuals who require higher levels of allergen filtration but that is the subject for another review.Wishing you all good health.

Men's fragrances, cologne and eau de toilette (EDT) represents one's personal "scent signature".  Since each of us has a different body chemistry which affects scent, it is not unusual that some fragrances might be incompatible or not the right choice for some of us.  I respect the many favorable reviews which have been posted for Thallium but this clearly was not for me.Thallium (For Men) has a cloyingly-sweet, juvenile aroma. The scent reminded me of a budget-line cheap barber-shop unbalanced after shave.  A gray Thallium box arrived wrapped only with a thin polystyrene sleeve over the outer box inviting me to embark on a most unpleasant olfactory journey on the S.S. Skank.  Here are my impressions:PROS1.  Delivered in a gray cardboard box revealing an attractive pseudo-Grecian "vintage" apothecary decanter.2.  No cap necessary-The top of the bottle has an integral spray button for your scent experience.3.  If you look carefully, you will find a lot # and production/date of manufacture on the rear outer panel of the box-  (mine was 6.12.2013), which should still be reasonably fresh product.4. Believe it or not....made in France....oui oui oui!!!!!!!!!!CONS/CAUTIONS:1.  There is no indication anywhere on the bottle or box that this is a men's EDT (pour homme).  It is not unreasonable to expect such a transparent label for a product such as this and it leads one to suspect that this may not be a men's EDT.  Tighter labeling is necessary for purchasers of this product.2. Amazon has classified Thallium (and most other EDT's and colognes) as a hazardous (i.e. potentially combustible) item. As such, even given Amazon's generous and liberal return policy, you will be unable to return this item. Please think carefully before purchasing this item if you are unfamiliar with the scent or simply wish to sample it.3. Check ingredients carefully before purchasing if you have a history of skin allergies or other sensitivities: For example, Thallium contains carboxaldehyde (Lyral), which is linked with contact skin dermatitis, butyl metoxydibenzoyl-methane-a free-radical generator when exposed to sunlight,  bht-a suspected carcinogen used as a preservative and several dyes of questionable use (D&C blue 1 and red 33).  Although these substances are used widely and generally safely in the cosmetic arena, those with the above-cited conditions should take this into consideration.4. My box was not sealed like most other brands of EDT's with cellophane wrap-Given the potential for evaporation due to differences in humidity and climate, it is possible that the scent became compromised; however, I understand that this is how Thallium is supplied and packaged.BOTTOM LINE IMPRESSIONS:1. Smells like a raw deal gentlemen!  One whiff should be enough to singe your nasal passages leaving you nauseous and in  need of a respirator. Stale, rancid, repulsive, cloying, annoying aroma reminiscent of revisiting unpleasant childhood memories of your aunt dowsing herself in the skankiest scent possible as she attacks your cheeks with hugs or the smell of your elementary school teachers long past their retirement window.  But then....Allow me to tell you how I REALLY feel!!!2. No need to worry about "scent disintegration' as others have commented on. Thallium stimulates your gag reflex and attacks your nasal passages like a rabid pit-bull without remorse.  The initial assault (spray) is intense and clings without mercy for some time. My family refused to get within 20 ft. of me until I showered and "de-Thalliumed"!3. An excellent choice for lighter fluid, mace or insect repellent but NOT for humans.3.  Try a sample if available at Bloomingdale's, Macy's, Neiman Marcus or Lord & Taylor.  There are far better choices.

The probiotic market is anticipated to reach 28.8 billion in revenue by 2015 in part due to the increased marketing and health-consciousness of consumers seeking healthy alternatives to traditional healthcare.  Some, but not all probiotic products have been studied and show considerable promise. However, the exponential growth in marketing, consumer interest and use has outpaced our current ability to run valid and reliable scientific research on the safety and efficacy of many probiotics.Jarrow Formulas, has earned an excellent reputation for manufacturing quality products with an outstanding track record for some time and I have tried many of their supplements over the years with some success.  I have no doubt that many consumers and reviewers have found this supplement to be effective for their own ailments-from IBS to hernias, to reflux to ulcerative colitis to diverticulitis and celiac disease among others.  However, I have discovered that the effectiveness of this probiotic tends to decrease the longer it is taken.  Although I do not agree that this supplement works for everyone,  I can say that it can be effective as an adjunct in combination with a good diet, daily exercise and more traditional treatments.PROS:1. Easy to swallow and minimal GI distress when taken as directed for 2X/day on an empty stomach.2. These are enteric-coated capsules which remain shelf-stable with reasonable expiration date cycles (mine is 11/2015).3. This preparation offers 8 different strains of bacteria formulated to deliver "beneficial" bacteria to your intestines and gut flora.4. The supplement is wheat, gluten, dairy, fish and tree nut free.CONS/CAUTIONS:1. Relatively expensive compared to other somewhat similar alternatives.  Check Swanson Vitamins for some excellent multi-strain probiotics that can be just as effective. "Now" (Now Foods) also makes excellent probiotics at about half the price with 25-50 billion viable cells.2. Do not assume that probiotics work similarly in different folks. Our bodies are different and our body chemistry is different. Whether a particular supplement is effective or not depends upon a constellation of variables, including diet, gender, age, exercise level, medical history and genetic disposition among others.2. One of the potential dangers of probiotics is the risk of transferring antibiotic resistance from probiotics to more deadly microorganisms. All bacteria have the potential for exchanging genetic information. Thus, there is a potential risk of transferring antibiotic resistance to other undesirable strains of bacteria. This explains why scientists have strict rules on which bacteria can qualify as a probiotic.BOTTOM LINE:1. Consider probiotics with at least 3 different strains and no less than 5 billion viable cells at the time of manufacture (ATOM). If this is not identified on the product, don't purchase it!  Jarrow is very transparent here!2. Vary your probiotics the same way you vary your multivitamins. Rotate off to a few different but effective brands each few months or so. Remember, your system learns to adapt to routine and, just like drugs, your body adapts to the supplement and it can become less effective over time.3. Even "shelf-stable" probiotics i.e. those not requiring refrigeration, work best when refrigerated so refrigerate them after purchase if possible-they will retain their potency longer according to many manufacturers including Jarrow.4. If you have chronic GI or immune-system disorders, check with your healthcare specialist and PCP BEFORE you decide to put yourself on this regimen. (Check the cons section above) for an explanation of why this is critical.5. .Our current understanding of probiotics continues to evolve and is therefore a work in progress. Although probiotic products are marketed for many different uses, scientific documentation supporting specific uses is still embryonic.  In fact, the FDA has not approved any health claims for probiotics despite product manufacturer claims.  Therefore, before using probiotics, educate yourself thoroughly on their pros, cons, and potential side effects by discussing this with your health care provider in addition to researching some unbiased, reliable sources of information (For example Mayo Clinic, Cleveland Clinic, Consumer Reports, etc.)I wish you all good health.

Maytag has enjoyed an outstanding record for performance and reliability of their appliances and quickly became the gold standard in the washing machine arena for nearly a century. Unfortunately, rapid acquisition of other brands, including Amana, contributed to Maytag introducing many cost-cutting initiatives that in the end, compromised Maytag's ability to remain competitive and the market leader for reliability.  An avalanche of consumer complaints on Maytag's low-end "Performa" and "Legacy Series" line of washing machines surfaced in combination with Maytag's "Neptune" units which were recalled by the Consumer Product Safety Commission due to fire hazard potential and a class-action lawsuit resulting in the company hemorrhaging millions in settlement costs to consumers..  This was, essentially the end of what we used to know as genuine Maytag units.On April 1, 2006, Maytag was acquired by Whirpool Corporation and the original Maytag production plants were subsequently closed.  Whirpool then assumed all brand administration although the Maytag Brand is still used on Whirpool-designed appliances and repair parts.This explains why when you contact Maytag (800) 344-1274, your call is routed to Whirpool Corporation in Benton Harbor, MI. and their call centers.Thank goodness that these relatively-common service parts are still available to DIY consumers like myself.  If you are lucky enough to have an original Maytag (manufactured in Newton, IA) then I strongly suggest you repair the unit if it is cost-effective.  The three most common repairs to these units are the drain hose(s), pump and transmission/drive belts.PROS:1. This is a common replacement part and the genuine OEM replacement curved drain hose for many Maytag washing machines manufactured in the 1980's and 1990's-Back when Maytag meant quality build and performance and the units were built like a Sherman Tank!2. This part is manufactured in the USA and distributed by Whirpool Corporation and supplied in a sealed plastic bag with the Whirpool name.3. Fits properly on both ends for a perfect seal.CONS:1.  None-I would however, like to see the two drain hose brackets supplied with the hose as a kit.  For first time DIY's, it would also be useful to have a brief, clearly labeled diagram and simple instructions.BOTTOM LINE:1. I paid $13.25 for this hose through Amazon. Don't get ripped off by other appliance parts distributors that charge $18-27 for an imported item.There is no question about the fit if you are careful in cross-referencing the correct replacement number for your Maytag appliance.  Part #: 213045 fits the Maytag A-612 and many others seamlessly. Be certain to also have your serial and "series" # available if you call and/or order online. You will find these on the riveted metal plate located on the top of your machine for top-loading machines like the A-612.2. This is an extremely simple repair that should save you at least $85-115 on a service call.  Be sure to ask for two new mounting brackets when you purchase your drain hose. These are not included with the hose but often necessary and strongly recommended to replace if they have become rusted or seized.3. I spray the inside of the new drain hose with a light coating of heavy-duty silicone for ease in attaching to the pump assembly.  Be careful not to force the hose onto the plastic pump assembly as it can break. Tighten each clamp gently but firmly, especially on the pump end and run the unit through a cycle or two to insure that there are no residual leaks before you put the front cover back on the machine. That's it and you should be good for another 25 years!

Lithium Cells are rapidly becoming the new gold standard for many household uses, from simple flashlights to sophisticated hybrid vehicles. These lithium-ion batteries are now ubiquitous in the retail arena and their popularity has steadily increased because of their power efficiency compared to more traditional delivery technologies far surpassing carbon-zinc, nickel-cadmium, nickel-metal hydride and alkaline.Here Is my Assessment of The Energizer "Ultimate" Lithium AA Cells:PROS:1. Superior in overall power efficiency compared to traditional battery technologies. Lithium cells retain their charge longer and become superior performers in retaining their charge. When stored properly (in a cool, dry and dark environment), these cells self-discharge rates are substantially slower compared with previous generations of batteries.2. Unlike nickel-cadmium cells, lithium-ion batteries have no (or a very negligible) "memory" effect.3. Lithium-Ion cells also perform better at lower ambient temperatures than their predecessors.4. Lithium-Ion batteries are noticeably about 33% lighter than previous types of cells making it an additional plus in heavier types of equipment such as larger flashlights, power equipment, etc.5. Energizer lithium cells (and all lithium-ion batteries in general), have expiration dates considerably longer because they discharge much more slowly compared to previous generations of batteries.6. Lithium cells are more environmentally-compliant and friendly compared to previous generations, particularly those cells which contain toxic, heavy metals such as cadmium and mercury.CONS:1. My rating on these particular cells is 4.5 stars due to the perceived steep price points of the Energizer brand.  However, if you do the math, as another conscientious reviewer has, you will find that lithium cells are actually a more cost-effective choice when compared to an equivalent-sized alkaline battery. Nevertheless, you are still likely to pay more for a name brand such as Energizer, in order for the company to recoup their research and development costs. By the way, the AAA and 9V platforms still tend to be more expensive compared to their AA, C and D counterparts-This appears to be valid regardless of the type of battery technology (e.g. alkaline, carbon-zinc, NiMh).2. Lithium cells may be a safety hazard, particularly when exposed to high temperatures for sustained periods of time. For this reason, the federal government has imposed transport restrictions on lithium batteries. Although these restrictions have recently been relaxed, lithium cells can and do explode because they contain a pressurized, flammable electrolyte. For this reason, it is advisable to store these cells in a temperature-stable environment.3. Energizer currently has several different "quality tiers" of Lithium batteries on the retail market-each with a different price point and different retention claim (i.e. "Lasts up to....x longer). For example, Energizer currently has three discrete lines within lithium cells: Energizer "Advanced" (retention claims "up to 4X longer" in selected devices); Energizer "Max" (retention claims up to 8X longer" in selected devices) and Energizer "Ultimate" (retention claims up to 9X longer" in selected devices). For the relatively modest difference in price and at more than twice the retention claim, my choice would be Energizer Ultimate.Be careful to select the latest available expiration date card(s) to avoid purchasing an earlier production lot of the product. Each cell also has a production/ lot code embossed on it; however, they are not at present, user-identifiable without assistance from Energizer.BOTTOM LINE:1. These are excellent batteries when used properly and in the correct equipment. In consideration of the longer storage and discharge interval, my recommendation would be to use lithium cells for those appliances and equipment requiring longer replacement intervals such as fire, smoke and CO2 detectors; water sensors, outdoor sensors, digital cameras and remote controls to name just a few.2. Avoid storing these cells in extreme temperatures-cool, dark and dry is recommended for maximum shelf life and safety. Avoid storing lithium cells in the refrigerator or freezer.3. Energizer's lithiums are, in my opinion, no better than those manufactured by other reputable companies. As such, price shop. If store (generic) lithiums are available, shop prudently with your wallet. This is an excellent technology but there are deals available on these cells if you shop patiently-both online and in-store.

Each cell also has a production/ lot code embossed on it; however, they are not at present, user-identifiable without assistance from Energizer.BOTTOM LINE:1. These are excellent batteries when used properly and in the correct equipment. In consideration of the longer storage and discharge interval, my recommendation would be to use lithium cells for those appliances and equipment requiring longer replacement intervals such as fire, smoke and CO2 detectors; water sensors, outdoor sensors, digital cameras and remote controls to name just a few.2. Avoid storing these cells in extreme temperatures-cool, dark and dry is recommended for maximum shelf life and safety. Avoid storing lithium cells in the refrigerator or freezer.3. Energizer's lithiums are, in my opinion, no better than those manufactured by other reputable companies. As such, price shop. If store (generic) lithiums are available, shop prudently with your wallet. This is an excellent technology but there are deals available on these cells if you shop patiently.

PROS:1. An exceedingly well-manufactured phone case for the Verizon EnV Touch Phone Model#: VX-11000.  Fits this phone seamlessly protecting it well from abuse and damage. Case cut-outs for accessible ports.2. Black Velour interior is nicely lined throughout the entire case.3. Case supplied with both two belt loops and a strong belt clip for versatility.4. Simply cannot beat the price for a case this well made. A smart purchase all variables considered.CONS:1. Belt loop stitching can become quickly worn and compromised if attaching to the belt loops as a result of daily use.2. Case is NOT genuine leather but rather is black vinyl ("leather-like").  This appears to be a misrepresentation by the vendor that requires correction.BOTTOM LINE:1. A very well-manufactured phone case for $2.56.  For the value-conscious consumer this is a must buy.2. I purchased 2 cases and remain very happy after more than 6 months in use!

A search for orthopedic auto seat cushions (8.10.2013), reveals some 156 choices for the consumer desiring a quality orthopedic-style car cushion.  With these kinds of choices in the market, you need to consider factors not often addressed by the manufacturer of many of these seat cushions.  For example, your weight DOES indeed matter in selecting a cushion which will retain its firmness, resiliency and not collapse in a year or so. Another important variable not discussed is the slope and position of your driver's seat and the specific vehicle you are driving in the overall equation for a comfortable and orthopedically-sound seat.  Remember....All cushions are not created equally!Because of these important factors, it is necessary to do your research and not exclusively rely on other customer's reviews since we ARE all created differently-e.g. body mass, weight, size, somatotype, etc.  My suggestion is to use customer reviews as a starting point and then contact a few manufacturers before you make a purchase.  Remember that unless you purchase directly through Amazon (or a similar vendor with a liberal return policy), many manufacturers will not permit returns once you have used the product for reasons of hygiene.  The following product assessment takes into consideration use by an average individual (less than 180 lbs).PROS:1. Polyurethane foam wedge appears to retain its shape and density reasonably well after 6 months of daily use.  This product is a step better than the mass-marketed "Seat Solution" which penetrated the tele-ad market a few years ago.2. When properly positioned and used, this product can reduce tailbone and lower back pressure for some.3. Washable, zippered "velour" cover is very practical.4. Easy to adjust-Product weighs 15.5 ounces.CONS:1. NOTE: This product was not designed to properly fit many SUV's having bucket seats with slightly raised side panels. (e.g. Toyota RAV4 and many other similar vehicles).  The product measures 15 3/4" x 13.0".  If you use this cushion with vehicles having raised side seat panels, it will not fit properly and the cushion will become compromised and not offer the caliber of orthopedic protection claimed by the product manufacturer.  Please take this into consideration before purchasing. You may also want to contact the manufacturer prior to purchasing to insure you receive the correct cushion if applicable. Here is the contact info: Kinetic Diversified Industries, Inc.  1 (800) 451-6206.2. The carrying handle appears to be an unnecessary feature which does not contribute anything substantive to the product.3. When exiting the vehicle, the cushion moves significantly and frequently and does not remain in driving position.  With this in mind, a Velcro strip attaching the seat cushion to the seat material would have been a better feature than the "carrying handle" for a cushion weighing only 15.5 ounces!3. Grossly overpriced for a simple 1 1/4" thick polyurethane wedge (at its smallest point) in my assessment-should not cost more than $24.99 MSRP.  "Made in the USA" need not equate with twice the market price!BOTTOM LINE:1. Acceptable product but only marginally better than the old "Seat Solution" which I have tried.2. Not worth 2X the price of the Seat Solution at a steep $50.  Note: Tush Cush now offers a more expensive version of this cushion designed for folks weighing over 200 lbs. at $56.3. Check with your medical professional for better alternatives on a true orthopedic seat cushion through your physician.  Some of these medically-necessary designated cushions and other appliances may be covered or subsidized by your health insurance carrier and are top quality.Be safe and comfortable!

Disclaimer: No...I am not a professional mechanic or a Toyota sales/service rep. However, I am a discriminating consumer who recently purchased a '12 RAV4 V6 and love it.  Understandably then, I was particular when it came to searching for a premium-quality oil filter for my spunky little jack rabbit RAV.PROS:1. A genuine OEM oil filter manufactured specifically to match the performance specs and tolerances for specificToyota vehicles.2. This type of design permits you to inspect the spent/used filter media to assess the overall performance of the filter-A real plus in my opinion compared to sealed, traditional screw-on cartridges.3. Both filter o-rings are supplied pre- lubricated making for a more convenient installation job.4. The yellow filter media provides an excellent contrast to identify the contaminants captured and filtered, providing a good performance-barometer.5. At $6.47, with free S/H, this deal is hard to beat.6. Installation directions are clear, in English and conspicuously appear on both the filter box side panel and end flaps.CONS:1. A bit messy and more time-intensive for DIY's who prefer a more conventional cartridge-type canister that simply screws into the engine flange. Remember, there are no cartridge-type screw-in oil filters available for vehicles requiring this type of oil filter, like most RAV-4's.BOTTOM LINE:1. Nearly 99% of automotive oil filter manufacturers (regardless of brand/make), achieve differences in the thickness of their filter media within a parameter of only 1-2 microns.  This means that unless you intend to race professionally or consistently haul/tow vehicles or heavy payloads, the differences are marginal at best and negligible for most of us who simply drive 12-15K/year.  Therefore, there is no need to consider a more expensive oil filter promising only questionable and exaggerated claims.2. Purchase the least-expensive OEM oil filter for your specific vehicle and be assured that you are complying with your vehicle manufacturer's recommendations for properly servicing your vehicle.  The added benefit of this is that you are also insuring that you will not compromise the warranty on your vehicle should any major repairs be necessary by using aftermarket filters/parts that may have slightly different fitment tolerances with your engine block.  Keep all of your service receipts as proof that you purchased OEM Toyota parts.  Now....Don't worry and enjoy your vehicle!3. Change your oil regularly. This is the life-blood of your vehicle.  Change at 3K for your initial oil change and then at 3-5K intervals based upon your vehicle manufacturer's recommendations!

If you are looking for a very good pair of what I would call "Hybrid" sun/safety glasses....look no further.  Actually, I discovered these glasses accidentally through a friend who is an electrician who gave me a pair when I misplaced mine.  Initially, I thought it looked like junk-I was most surprised and here is why:PROS:1.  These glasses are supplied by a company that manufactures safety eyewear for contractors so they tend to be well made especially for the $8 price per pair.2. They meet or exceed the performance standards for ANSI Z87.1+ and provide 99.9% UVA and UVB protection.3. Each pair is supplied with a lanyard for removing the glasses temporarily without losing them-Very convenient.4. The shape of these glasses are contoured and provide side protection.5. Composite rubber nose piece is excellent in preventing slippage if you sweat heavily.6. Very stylish pair of glasses offering good sun protection for an excellent price.CONS:1. These are unpolarized sunglasses, so please take this into consideration if you prefer a polarized lens.  Polarization is a useful feature if you  are especially sensitive to glare. When light reflects off of flat surfaces, such as water, the light waves align in horizontal patterns, creating intense glare. The filters in polarized lenses block these horizontal light waves, substantially reducing blinding glare. However, In some instances, polarized filters react with the tints in windshields, creating blindspots and diminishing the visibility of LCD readouts in your auto equipment, such as GPS navigation systems. If this occurs, you should consider mirrored lenses as a glare-reducing alternative for driving.  Remember...you will spend at least $20-$30 for a cheap drug store pair of polarized lenses.2. Each hinge is secured by a jewel-sized Phillips screw. I have found (after purchasing 6 pairs of these glasses), that these glasses do not adjust well by tightening the screw into the plastic frame. The screws strip easily.  If one of the hinges is looser than the other my advice is simply to leave it alone.  This appears to be a quality control issue but for $8, I'll accept it.3. The Nemesis lenses appear to soil easily from epidermal oil from your skin and especially to sunblock and other types of oil-based preparations.  The blue tint of these lenses seems especially difficult to keep clean.BOTTOM LINE:1. All variables considered, you will not find a better pair of hybrid sunglasses for the money. Remember...these are sold by a company that manufactures and supplies safety glasses to contractors and other industrial and commercial suppliers.  You will not find these glasses at CVS, Rite Aid, Walgreens or Wal Mart.  If these were marketed exclusively as a retail package I can assure you that both the quality of the product would likely be compromised and the cost would be doubled or tripled!2. To clean the lenses well, pick up a box of Zeiss Lens Cloths (they are supplied in boxes of 50 disposable wipes) and are specifically designed for properly and safely cleaning lenses.  They do a great job, are made in the U.S. and the wipes are very inexpensive-about $2 a box. Here's the UPC: 0-74887-54410-0.3.  This is essentially a "hybrid" product, functioning as both sunglasses and "safety eyewear" and the package states so. However, this will not replace the need to wear face shields, mask(s) or other appropriate eyewear if you are doing anything other than driving an auto or using them for casual and non-impact work or walking.4. Grab these while they are still available. They provide the most bang for the buck!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! BE SAFE!

We have enjoyed vanilla wafers for years. Compared to commercial brands of these wafers in the U.S., there is absolutely no comparison whatsoever in terms of both quality of ingredients and taste. For the most part, wafers produced in Europe have always remained superior. This is largely because they have eschewed all or most of the artificial colors, flavors, dyes and preservatives that have been pervasive in the U.S. market for decades, thanks to the large conglomerates that now control most of the U.S. food and snack industry.Loacker has been a standard in these types of snack wafers for decades in Europe and has become more widely distributed and imported in the U.S. within the past 12 years or so. They are now regularly stocked at Whole Foods Markets, Wegmans and many major retail supermarkets throughout the U.S.We have tried nearly all of Loacker's interesting flavors (Tiramisu, Coconut, Chocolate, Dark Chocolate, Lemon, Almond and Hazelnut) but continue to return to vanilla for its simplicity and integrity.  My wife adores and devours these 'lil cubes  like a well oiled shredder so I need to buy in bulk.  Here is my review:PROS:1. Good ingredients without unnecessary preservatives, artificial colors or flavors.2. Imported from EU (Either Italy or now Austria)3. Convenient bite sized wafers.4. The smaller 4.4 ounce pouches stay fresher compared to the larger sized retail pouches.5. Proportionately lower in sugar than any competing commercial brands.6. Contains genuine vanilla bean pods.CONS:1. Loacker has been manufacturing these wafers for decades at their plant in Italy.  They are now producing these in Austria and are not quite as tasty or flavorful as those which were produced in Italy.  To a discriminating palate, they are a bit dry and lack the rich vanilla note they were always known for.  My guess is that they have slightly altered and diluted the recipe (taking a "lesson" from Nabisco and Keebler's notebook!).2. Cost for these wafers continues to be increasing as import fees rise. The 6 pack of 4.4 oz. wafers appears to be only available through Amazon. The better deal is to purchase the regular retail 8 oz. pouches.BOTTOM LINE:1. Still an excellent choice for the vanilla wafer purist although a bit dry.  Pairs well with good vanilla ice cream or sorbet.2. Try some of the other competing brands of wafers now imported from Italy, Germany (Bahlsen), Belgium and France (Burry Lu line) and shop for price with all other variables being equal-you will not be disappointed!3. Read your labels and HAPPY SNACKING to all of my snacking compadres!!!!!

I have tried diligently to locate the OEM recirculating charcoal filter that originally came with our GE Microwave Oven (Model# JVM-190K). I both found and compared each of these filters and here is my honest assessment of the JX81 filter purchased from Amazon for your consideration: Part#: WB2X4267:PROS:1. This filter installs easily and slides on an angle down into the two metal brackets on each side of the assembly. It measures true to scale at 17.5" x 6" x 5/16" thick.2.  The filter has a light caliber latticed aluminum frame holding a thin charcoal medium.3.  This particular filter is significantly more cost effective compared to purchasing same from other suppliers including GE which sells the OEM for $43.CONS:1. Compared to the OEM filter that came with the microwave, the differences are stark and disappointing. The original recirculating filter was manufactured for GE by: D-Mark, Inc., Mt. Clemens, MI 48045-Phone#: 1-800-343-3610 or 1-586-949-3610. The OEM filter frame is twice as heavy and the charcoal filter medium is also twice as thick as the JX81 Amazon filter just purchased.2. According to GE, (who I contacted), these filters should be swapped out every 6 months and at least every year.  In addition, they are NOT intended to be re-cleaned or re-used per manufacturer's directions. This makes it a relatively expensive proposition with little measurable or observable usefulness in my opinion. Without any specific metric to measure the product's performance at eliminating smoke and odors, it seems to have only marginal usefulness.3. Aftermarket recirculating charcoal filters designed to fit this appliance are without question, of poor quality. My best guess is that if you choose to spend $50-$60, you may indeed locate a better filter but in my opinion it is simply not worth it.BOTTOM LINE:1. Consider converting to a proper vented installation if at all possible-It will be safer and save you $$ over resorting to this type of only marginally-effective filter.2. Save your money and purchase thicker granulated charcoal sheets if available from Home Depot, Lowe's and/or other appliance part distributors if you must use this. Cut to size if needed. You really do not need the tissue-paper thin aluminum frame which will only rattle and resonate if loose.3. Look to purchase this particular filter on Warehouse Deals (An Amazon division). You can save 50% or more on this filter when and if they are available.Hope This Helps.  Be Safe.

PROS:1. Manufactured and supported by a U.S. company: AVS, a division of Lund International in Lawrenceville, GA. (Support#: (800) 241-7219).2. Supposedly custom- made to fit your vehicle. The box I received was clearly marked for my year and make of vehicle. Even comes with a dorky âAVSâ decal to affix to the unit.3. Responsive and accessible customer support is a positive.  Native English-speaking and landline (rather than VOIP-based) phone support was helpful and receptive.CONS:1. Hood shield does NOT extend across the entire front surface of your vehicle-only the 31" lip of the hood.  I guess the bugs and stones have been read the riot act and instructed to ONLY land on the shield itself rather than the remaining surfaces of the vehicle's front!2. The plastic molly-type fasteners are flimsy, sub-standard and do not install properly on many vehicles for which the fasteners are intended.  Customer support suggested that a redesign of these fasteners is being considered due to complaints from customers. The fasteners are nothing more than cheap plastic toys whose threads strip easily when tightening the plastic Phillips screws into the fasteners as per the directions. These do not make for a permanent, quality install.3.  The instructions accompanying the product are insufficient for proper installation of the fasteners. Only by contacting customer support will you be assisted in making a successful install.  Better and sturdier clips, rather than 1/4" plastic fasteners will yield a better and more permanent install.  The inadequate hardware renders a quality acrylic hood shield a mediocre product, accounting for my rating of 3 stars.4. The manufacturer claims that the hood shield is âcar wash safeâ; however, cleaning instructions inserted into the box state: âNot for use in brush-type car washesâ-A misleading statement. This statement really means that YOU can hand-wash your vehicle yourself but the shield is not designed to go through automated car washes, since well over 85% of automated car washes use circular brushes.  Not an advantage in my opinion.5. Amazonâs product description for this item indicates that it âInstalls with 3M adhesive foam tapeâ. Two problems here: a. This particular item (#: 24139), is designed to be installed with plastic fasteners (supplied in the box) and; b. There is no 3M adhesive foam tape supplied nor does the installation manual indicate this as an option.BOTTOM LINE:1. A quality U.S. product but supplied with inadequate and substandard plastic fastening hardware which requires a more reliable upgrade.2.  Quick fix for the âfastenersâ: Replace the fragile plastic Phillips screws with identical metal or stainless steel ¼âscrews for a good permanent fix.3.  My advice:  Not worth the $50 price. Pass on this unit and find better and more convenient alternatives like WeatherTech, carid.com, autoanything.com and J.C. Whitney.Hope this helps.

At the outset, I will say that this appears to be a well manufactured wheel cover with the following caveats:PROS:1. Well worth the $18 compared to other cheaper imitations costing about the same.2. Smooth, non-abrasive leather skin bonded to a thick thermoplastic/rubber elastic base.3. Easy, 60 second application requiring no tools.4. No observable toxic chemical odors as with many other synthetic covers, which can linger for months.CONS:1. Caution: This cover is what I would term a "universal/generic" product, designed to fit MANY but by no means MOST vehicles.  If you own an SUV, this product will likely cover only HALF of the circumference of your steering wheel and thus explains my rating of 3 stars, because an accurate description of this important product detail is missing.  Great if you want 1/2 of a steering wheel cover....disappointing if you expected to receive a cover that wraps around the entire surface of the wheel handle.2. Despite the manufacturer's claim that it will fit your vehicle's steering wheel tightly, it does not in many vehicles and applications.  Try gently heating the interior rubber surface of the cover prior to installation. (Use a hair dryer).3. This cover is considerably thick and therefore adds substantial bulk to the wheel.  Those individuals with small hands  may not therefore, find this cover comfortable to grip.BOTTOM LINE:1. Before purchasing this item, verify that it will fit at least 3/4ths around the circumference of the wheel.  I would email the manufacturer before considering purchasing this product for your vehicle.2. This is a nicely-textured steering wheel cover which would be appropriate when fitting your vehicle's steering wheel properly.  It is not however, a good value if you do not care for a product that only wraps halfway around your wheel.3. Consider other auto part discount sellers for a wider selection of this product such as: J.P Whitney (online).

Moen is an excellent company that is very customer-focused and sensitive to consumer feedback about their products.  With this being said, If you are seeking the OEM replacement hose for your Moen hand shower, it is available directly through Moen or discounted through Amazon and numerous other suppliers online.  Be warned however, that the price differential is considerable, ranging from approximately $40 to $149.95. You will need to shop around to find the best deal-it will NOT however, be through Moen.I  examined two of these A726 replacement hoses, one which I ordered directly from Moen and one which was ordered through Amazon.  PLEASE READ THIS BEFORE ORDERING:PROS:1. Looks nearly identical to the original hose supplied.  Attractive and functional.2. Easy to install without tools; however, you may need to use some Teflon tape to seal the fitting threads.CONS:1. Moen has outsourced many of its replacement parts and this particular hose is manufactured in China.  This would normally not be a problem; however, the quality of the hose is "tinny", exceedingly light suggesting that, unlike the original hose (which was heavy and lasted for well over 22 years), the product is not intended to last more than a few years.  I doubt there is even a milliliter of chrome in these units.  My best guess is that the new replacement hoses do not even contain an inner hose but rather a very thin rubber film/coating, if at all.  These hoses are made to be replaced frequently and I do not expect them to withstand leaking for long.  Chalk this up to planned obsolescence!2.  The hose is delivered in a plain white box and supplied with one "screen washer" which is used as both a washer and  sediment filter on the spray end of the hose fitting.  These washers are also manufactured overseas and are poorly constructed.  Be careful depressing the screen washer into the hose fitting-they are designed flimsy and the screen will break off from the washer.  See my permanent fix for this issue below.3.  Moen customer service indicated that these washers were not supplied with the hose and recommended purchasing two washers at $5 each plus $8 shipping and handling.BOTTOM LINE:1.  This is an attractive OEM replacement hose but by no means is this a quality hose designed to last.  This, in my assessment, compromises the integrity of the Moen brand, long regarded in the industry as a quality player.2.  My advice for a great install: DO NOT use the "bloated" black screen washer supplied with the hose-they are defective.  Instead, call Moen (1-800- 289-6636) and request a domestic-manufactured screen washer for this unit.Ask for Moen Part#: 101199 with UPC Code: 0-26508-06069-8.  This is the quality screen washer made in the U.S.-It will look beige and will fit perfectly into the fitting.  I purchased two and I believe it was worth the small investment.

As a new car owner, I had heard much about the new WeatherTech product line. After hearing the rave reviews of these mats, I decided to jump in and purchase an entire set of mats for my new vehicle-front, rear and cargo liner. Several days and $276.00 later, they arrived in huge boxes and I installed them the following day.Here is my honest and complete assessment of the new WeatherTech "Custom Fit" Liners and their Value to the consumer: (My apologies David MacNeil):PROS:1. The liners are intended to fit the contours of your vehicle's floor "like a glove". The front floor liners have raised edges to help restrict water and debris from surfacing under the liner. Each liner is allegedly, laser cut and measured to align with the precise contours of your vehicle. For the most part, it does.2. These are essentially semi-rigid thermo-plastic liners that are not designed to be warm or aesthetic but rather functional. If you have a truck or SUV, they are ideal.3. MacNeil Automotive Group manufactures their products in the US with materials that are locally sourced (if that is important to you).4. Materials are non-toxic, manufactured using recycled materials and comply with all federal regulations for safety.5. Customer support appears to be acceptable at this time-As of this writing, WeatherTech has native English-speaking associates to address your questions; however, a poor-caliber VOIP line compromises both ease of communication and the "customer experience".6. Product has a 3 year "limited" warranty. (See Comment Below)CONS:1. Price: In my opinion, steep with a marginal-to-questionable return-on-investment. Remember, these are simply plastic liners with shallow edges (or lips) to help contain water. As popularity of these products continues to rise and competition ensues, prices should fall. An entire set (including cargo liner) will run you about $300. To date, there are at least 5 other companies that manufacture custom fit car floor liners, including Husky, Nifty, Newark, Highland and Lloyd. In addition to Amazon, check JC Whitney online for a very comprehensive selection.2. Depending on your specific vehicle, your WeatherTech floor liners may not fit as "seamlessly" as you might expect: Installed as per the directions (and it doesn't take a rocket scientist to drop these into your vehicle), you may notice a 1/8"-1/2" gap between the liner's edges and the floor contour. This gap is conspicuous, especially on the side that faces the vehicle's front door's (both driver and passenger) which can and will permit liquid and debris to enter the vehicle below the liners.3. The lips of these liners could easily accommodate another 1/4-1/2"" as an added measure to help contain liquids. They appear only marginally adequate in my assessment, particularly given the high price.  The rear liner is a thin, one-piece unit that simply installs over the transmission hump.  In my opinion, the quality of the rear liner is below par compared to the thickness of the front and cargo liners and without question, definitely not worth the $70 price tag!!4. Be careful about which product you decide to purchase from WeatherTech. WeatherTech manufactures BOTH custom fit floor LINERS and all-weather floor MATS. Unfortunately, the photos of each product do not represent the actual product that you purchase and can be misleading.5. The floor liners are not as slip resistant as you might be inclined to think, especially in wet weather. My guess is that a second generation of WeatherTech liners will no doubt incorporate such important safety upgrades in these areas.6. These products should have a lifetime warranty, excluding of course, excessive or unreasonable abuse. Instead, the manufacturer chose to only offer a 3 year "limited warranty", which essentially permits the manufacturer to exclude and/or deny warranty coverage at their exclusive discretion.  In my opinion, these types of "warranties" are useless because they are not consumer-friendly.BOTTOM LINE:1. This product can be particularly useful if you own an SUV or truck because of its functional design.2. Check prices carefully, especially with Amazon marketplace vendors. Including shipping and handling, I saved $12 purchasing just one of these liners from a marketplace seller.3. Consider waiting for the 2nd generation of WeatherTech liners to address a few important upgrades or consider comparable-quality liners from other manufacturers cited above.
