But I was frustrated when, time and time again, Jacob would resolve to work harder, be more faithful, to ignore temptations.Now, I understand thatâs typical behavior in these types of situations. But it ties into my biggest peeve with EDEN WEST: not a lot happens.The book doesnât really dig into any of the issues it brings up. Jacob thinks about his life a lot, and by the end of the book, it seems like he may leave Nodd. But will he?SPOILER.And thatâs where the book ends. Iâm the type of reader that likes a firm conclusion, so the vague openness of EDEN WESTâs ending left me disappointed that I bothered to finish the book.If you havenât read other cult books before, you might enjoy EDEN WEST. But if you have, Iâm not sure youâll find anything new or extraordinary here. I didnât.

THE WITCH OF STALINGRAD initially captured my interest because of the night witches. I canât believe I havenât heard of them before, because now Iâm fascinated! Once I dove into this book, I dove just as quickly into researching the night witches, and I was pleased to learn the author based many of her characters on real Soviet pilots.The book is told from the perspectives of two different women: Lilya Drachenko, Soviet pilot extraordinaire and night witch, and Alex Preston, American photojournalist and a former Russian. Throughout the course of THE WITCH OF STALINGRAD, both women question the beliefs theyâve grown up with as well as question what their futures could be. There is a lot of character growth in this book, which is something I enjoy.THE WITCH OF STALINGRAD is way more than just a wartime romance. At first, I didnât expect such depth and historical accuracy, but I was delighted to find it. This book is gritty, a realistic look at life in a warzone. Thereâs details on living under Stalin for the Russians, lots of piloting from night witch flying to fighter battles, and even time in a concentration camp. If you have any interest in the Soviet side of WWII, or the night witches, Iâd recommend this book for that alone.Lilya and Alex do become attracted to one another, but also spend a lot of the book apart, due to the war and their respective duties. Their relationship is sweet and realistic, with a few hints of explicitness that fit into the time period. Aside from Lilya and Alex, this book is full of strong women, female friendships, and women supporting each other. I like how the author put her own spin on âwomen canât do X or Y,â showing over and over again that yes, they can. And I loved when Alex went off on General Patton. Iâd quote, but I donât want to spoil it. Iâll just say itâs fantastic.Disclaimer: I received a copy of this book from the publisher in exchange for an honest review.

THE GIRL AT MIDNIGHT is the first in a YA urban fantasy series. I was intrigued by the publisherâs comparison to Leigh Bardugoâs SHADOW AND BONE, which is one of my favorite YA fantasy series. However, THE GIRL AT MIDNIGHT didnât remind me of SHADOW AND BONE at all, other than both books having a firebird.I liked the first half of THE GIRL AT MIDNIGHT. Echoâs a fun character, full of snark and longing to belong to an alien world. When she was a kid, she ran away from an abusive home. The Ala found her in the New York Public Library and took her to the Nest. The Ala is the Seer of the Avicen, a race of feathered beings. Their mortal enemies are the Drakharin -- dragon people -- and theyâve been in a war thatâs gone on for centuries under humanityâs nose.But somewhere around the middle, THE GIRL AT MIDNIGHT lost its shine for me. The book slowed down. I got bored, and even when things picked up again, I didnât really care. Iâm writing this review a few days after finishing, and I already canât remember a lot of the book. I had really high hopes for THE GIRL AT MIDNIGHT, but it was just okay.WHAT I LIKED:--Whenever the characters hopped to a new place, the author described that place really well. Her writing is atmospheric, and I felt like I was in New York or Paris or Strasbourg. There were also lots of yummy food details.--The friendship that developed between Echo, Ivy, Caius, Dorian, and Jasper. I also liked the romantic relationship between Dorian and Jasper -- yay for diversity, and a romance that didnât feel like insta-love.--The *idea* of the Avicen and Drakharin. Bird people and dragon people? Very cool. The glimpses I got of their worlds were fascinating, leaving me wanting a lot more.WHAT I DIDNâT LIKE:--The author told me the Avicen and Drakharin are at war. But *why* have they fought each other for so long? The author didnât show me they hated each other, just told me again and again. So I didnât feel invested in Echoâs quest for the firebird.--Echoâs romantic entanglements. Thereâs somewhat of a love triangle here, complete with a leg of insta-love. I did appreciate that Echo usually realized when she was on a hormone high, because Iâve very rarely seen that. But I didnât see the attraction between Echo and Caius, and their moments felt forced for me.--Everything else. I donât know how to describe it, and Iâve been trying for days. But THE GIRL AT MIDNIGHT justâ¦ fell flat. Usually I can write a review very quickly, but Iâve been struggling with this one for a few days, which is a sign. This book just wasnât memorable or outstanding for me.Overall, I was left wanting so much more from THE GIRL AT MIDNIGHT. I expected more fantasy, more about the Avicen and the Drakharin, more basis for Echo and Caius, more of everything.

Aaronâs work blew me away; it was thoughtful, honest, and considerate without being inaccessible. I was immediately impressed by his ability to craft language. Many of his poems address grief, loss, and other sometimes-nebulous concepts with a clarity and humility that illuminates the commonalities we all share. Very motivational and inspiring. If you looking for something inspiring and uplifting you should definitely get this book.

I am completely satisfied with this product,, The product is great and does exactly what it said it would do. They work better than many others I've recently tried. Amazing product at a great price!

This coloring book is definitely for adults (or anyone with time and patience.) It's much more intricate than other activity books of this sort. The designs and variety are wonderful. I use a binder clip to fold the pages back for easier handling.

As another review stated, I'm also waking up at 5AM. Averaging 6 hours of sleep, but at least I'm not tossing and turning on the front end.

Heavy duty closed case stainless steel body. Easy to read markings. Works as expected. The reading was the same as a 35-year old Made in the US Cooper I have in a side-by-side test.Thinking there was something off about the old Cooper thermometer, I wanted to take a comparison reading on my [POS] Breville BOV650XL Compact 4-Slice Smart Oven with Element IQ. Yep, the "smart oven" is exactly 50 degrees lower than the dialed temperature in two tests inside an empty oven. At least I know the two thermometers are working as they should be.

I reach for these nearly every day for one thing or another. The silicone is just the right handle length and head hardness for general cooking use. The heads can come off for cleaning. The only ding is the quality of the wood handles which are somewhat rough, I oil them to keep them smooth. Advise not to leave the wood handles sitting in water. Other than that, they are very useful.

Kind of nice. Helpful pages on technique and color theory for those who need itstruction. Good starter. A variety of simple designs to color in. Wished there was more actual sugar skulls. Some pages allow you to dabble on your own. Ok for colored pencils or crayons. Perforated pages. Designs suitable for older children, with a few for younger kids.If you're looking for something more ornate, more designs, I recommend "Just Add Color Day of the Deadly Sarah Walsh." Had I seen the two side-by-side, I would have chosen the latter.
Many familiar favorite tunes and a few not so familiar, but still good. Some I have in other compilations already, some hard to find. Great addition to any 80s collection.

There's too many bad reviews on these. Mostly from people who are doing it wrong. I find that applying a little butter with your finger around the inside works the best. This also makes cleaning effortless after. Forget spraying, that's hit and miss and you'd need to be liberal with the spray. Be sure the rings are clean and smooth to begin with. Set the buttered rings in a non-stick pan and medium heat both together. When the pan is hot enough, pour the eggs into ring. If you're doing scrambled eggs, use cream. I have not found any "leaking" issues in a perfectly flat pan surface. Note: I learned the hard way, spraying doesn't work. Once the rings are crusty with egg, it's next to impossible to clean off, but not impossible. The same with your plate and utensils. Stuck on egg is a pain to get off. I used a black ScotchBrite Extra Heavy Scour (non-scratch) pad I found at Target and gently scrubbed. Soaking doesn't work and only promotes rust. Pinch the handles together to remove from ring to wipe any little rust off. After wash, I dry them well. The perfect size for muffins. Heavy-duty.

Excellent quality. Light-weight and viewing area is quite adequate without being too small or big or too heavy. I was concerned the reading panel would be "floppy", but it's a flat stiff plastic. Great for reading iPad or iPhone for those of us whose eyes need a little help reading online newspapers or websites. The plastic attracts dust and the microscopic grooves will get dirty with use. Nothing a gentle wash with mild soapand water, and dry with soft cloth wouldn't help. My personal issue is settng it down and losing it under newspapers or books! I can see using it for a book marker. Includes a convenient protective cover. Liked this so much I bought another.

It's what I would call a training electric toothbrush. Timed quadrants, red light, buzzing to indicated your 30 second mark. The timing helps you keep focus if you tend to walk around the house as I do. As good as any high quality electric toothbrush with bells and whistles although louder. The handle is shaped like a hammer handle. My only problem is the brush head doesn't get around the back of the rear molar before the brush starts to complain. I also have the Sonicare using the tapered head brush that gets around the back much easier. Other than that, I see no difference between comparably priced electrical toothbrushes.

It's ok, none of the 3-in-1 tools does a better job than a good knife. However, if you're intent on getting it becaue it's an OXO, keep in mind, your avocado cannot be too hard nor too soft. Too hard and it'll be difficult to use; plus unripe is not tasty. Too soft, and you'll have avocado mush; but it'll taste good. If you have unsteady hands, then maybe this will be better than a knife.
Not as thick as expected, but should fluff up after a few washings. I doubt these would "hold" flour, but they are pretty all-cotton kitchen towels. Good square shape with a sewn in hang loop.

Nice looking trail âtrekingâ or walking shoe. Well constructed. The charcoal, black, and fuchsia combination is attractive without looking garish. I would not recommend them for for running due to the non-existent cushioning. Docking 2 stars because it appears the insoles were left out of my pair. Sometimes when activity shoes aren't exactly right, I replace the [normally] removable foam insoles with Spencos, but that's completely impossible with these. These are fitting fine for now, but probably won't be after some wear. The fit size is the same as my other ASICS.Update: For cushioning, I inserted insoles from my other pair of Ascis; a teeny bit snug, but necessary for arch support. I do believe my pair was missing the insoles.
Alright. Nobody needs this, but I couldn't resist. Does the job, good secure fit, funny, and it's a show stopper (pun intended).

I bought mine directly from the Vans Store in town. Now on my 3rd pair (somehow lost one pair), which I bought again just in case Vans discontinues the KVD style. That's how much I love them. They're a "lighter" looking style and more feminine than the skateboard shoes Vans is known for. For casual canvas shoes, they fit just a bit loose, but they are slip-ons afterall. Classic, comfortable, very well made and durable which I can attest to, having owned several pairs now for three years. I wished they had more colors and came back with the black canvas with white stitching on white soles style (the pair I lost).

It is a fairly accurate 3-foot ruler. Markings and number are large and easy to read, but illegible (scratched in) on the brass hinge joint. The stiff joints had to be oiled to loosen up. The wood is slightly rough with a light lacquer finish. It appears sturdy enough. Overall, for the price, it's not exactly the greatest quality. I would not recommend it unless you absolutely require a (hard-to-find) 3-foot wooden folding yard stick and willing to fork out a high price for the quality.

Just what I needed. Works as advertised to lift cable box up (which oddly gets warm enough to burn permanent imprints on the top of my soundbase.) Appears to be excellent quality composition. Highly recommend.

IMHO, Gigi D'Agostino is one of the most underrated artists. To me, it is evident that he has a solid understanding of what makes music work. Touches of classical to disco to electronica meshed together in his own style. He is known for "I'll Fly Away - L'Amour Toujours/Chansons for the Heart" one of his best, he's got lots more in his repertoire. Try this CD set if you want to check him out, you won't be disappointed. Try and stand still if you can.

The freedom is is exhilarating. Total immersion into the land of beautiful music. Complete isolation from external sounds. The flat cable is smooth and doesn't catch on clothing. Everything is very well-thought out.Set up was simple, paired easily, controls are easy to understand and works very well. The user manual is small and designed to make one cuss due to small hard-to-read light text on black paper. Thankfully, a downloadable version is available for you to blow up to read, once you "get" it, no more need to refer to it. Occasionally, they get lose (but a little spit works great). However, I'll put up with it, for the quality build, instant Blutooth connection, excellent sound, and the bliss and freedom of being untethered. High price, but not regretting purchase of this excellent headphone. Note: JayBird customer service is totally responsive.Side note: Everytime I thought the tip fell off and panicked, I found it still in my ear. Helps not to "yank" them off.Overall, happy as a clam. There is NO way I'm ever going back to "wired" headphones.

A gift item. The wrap was attractive and was easy to install. Fit my Canon S95 perfectly. Unfortunately, the screw-on plastic plate developed minute cracks and then broke in two. The allmost new wrap is now totally useless. Well-designed, but the plastic was way too brittle to last. Totally bummed. (photo. So I removed the screw to use for a wrist strap.)

Unfortunately the stock tips for the Bluebud x's are too easily lost. The 500 series is the ones recommended for BlueBuds X. I had a heck of a time getting the Comply Tsx-500's on, but they're on real good now. No fear of them ever detaching. It was so difficult getting them on that they appear deformed. The only problem is, now that they're on, they don't stay in the ear very well either. Can't win for tryingâ¦

This is a really great set!  They are really nice looking, sturdy and heavy.  They fit perfectly inside each other for storage (a problem in many kitchens) and I love the various sizes.  Also happy that they are dishwasher safe.The only downside for me is that for the largest pan, at a minimum, I'd like a lid and will try to purchase one.I'm very happy with this set.

It's unavoidable to purchase products made in China.  But it's bad for our economy and bad for the environment.That being said, in my test this product did what it said it would do.  I put steaming hot water in the thermos and left it overnight.  Probably around 20 hours.  The water was still hot - though obviously not as hot as was when I put it in, but still drinkable.I think it's handy to have around.

This is a great internet only laptop and I can think of a lot of applications for it.  My mom being the first - she doesn't need a laptop and a tablet is just something new she has to learn (by calling me and asking me how to do it, every. single. day!)  She doesn't word process, she doesn't iTunes, she just needs internet access.  At the price point, it's perfect.Another great use for this is just for travel when you don't need the full power of your laptop.  It's really light, and seems to have good battery life.Finally, I think it would be a great first laptop for kids.I like the keyboard feel and the matte screen and though I prefer a mouse, the touchpad works really well.  I tried my normal level of internet use, and everything worked as expected.  No lag or hang ups.  A feature I really like is that the help section helps you to understand the limitations of the machine, for example - I looked to see if it was possible to download iTunes (it is not) and the Chromebook told me how I could listen to music on the machine.Overall, I think it's a great value for the money.  I'm eager to see how long it lasts.

I could not finish this book.  The writing was abominable, the story seemed like something right out of Pinocchio and the overt message conked you on the head at every turn.  Waste of time and money.  (great cover, though)

My house is off white, and always gets dirty on the most visible parts of the house.  Having this is super handy.Set up was easy.  The only thing I didn't really think about is that it's an engine, and needs gas ... duh!  So that slowed me down.  Since we are in a drought, I haven't yet put it through it's paces and tried the various hoses, but I did get the most visible dirt off the front of the house.  Once we are off water rations I'm going to work on the moss in the back and side yards.Probably a bit more power than I needed for house dirt, but I know I will need it on the moss.

Who wouldn't enjoy the look of pure delight on the face of an adorable 3 year old as they play with this GIGANTIC toy?  Seriously, this thing is HUGE.  It takes up half the available space in the living room.But it's quite fun, and my favorite 3-year-old loves it.  As others have mentioned, the train does derail on occasion,, but if you really get the pieces securely in place it works more often than not.  Speaking of getting the pieces in place, there are a lot of them.  The instruction sheet is almost as big as the set itself.The train requires 2 AAA batteries, not included.

When I picked this book for my book club I knew it was topical. I knew we (as a nation) need to focus our attention on the racism in this country and one way to do that is to remind ourselves what we've already been through. When I picked this book for my book club, the shooting in South Carolina hadn't happened. And the Confederate flag was a mostly forgotten relic gently flapping its message of hate at a state capitol building, and sparking the fire of racism in some southern minds. When I picked this book for my book club, Donald Trump hadn't yet announced his 2016 Presidential bid along with his racism.Let's turn to 1963. On September 15, 1963 there was a bombing at a church in Birmingham, Alabama killing 4 young girls. Children. Addie, Denise, Carole and Cynthia - The Four Spirits. The white author lived in Birmingham during this era and she promised herself that if she ever became a novelist, she would write about this time in history. There are autobiographical elements. It's not about Addie, Denise, Carole and Cynthia - it's about cross section of fictional characters, black and white, good and evil. There are a lot of characters points of view and at times I thought too many, but the author set out to paint a picture of life in the time and life in that time can only be described through many visions. It worked for me.This is a story of the most extreme bravery. I have been the only white person in a room many times and never felt a qualm about it. I remember one time I was on a local bus in Jamaica, it was PACKED and I was not only the only white person, but the only woman. I see a policeperson and generally feel safe (or that I'm going to get a ticket :( ), they see a policeperson and wonder if they are going to be killed. Today. In 2015. It IS that black and white. I applaud every person of color who ever tried to grab a burger at a Woolworth's lunch counter. Who put themselves in that seat of rejection and were rejected. I want to cry for them. To hug them, and because I'm Italian, cook for them.After the bombing, one of the characters is digging through debris of the church, looking for survivors. In his head echoes of MLK ..."I live a nightmare, I live a nightmare ... "There's a quote in the book: "In church, you have a right to be safe. Surely?" (Fast forward to 2015: Not yet.) "No safe place. She wept with shame. They allowed no sanctity, no sacred place. And she? The force of hate left her mindless. Helpless. Bound to the shame of her own helplessness. Raped again, made helpless."In November, Kennedy is killed. I've always thought of that day as the entire nation mourning. Our beloved president shot. I don't think of the past in the terms of the "red and blue" I think of the present. But it was there. Residents of the South celebrated because Kennedy was pro-integration and now he was gone. "The dusk air of the city was festive...... Everybody walked briskly. They were exhilarated, these shoppers and commuters of Birmingham." One of the characters in the book works at a gas station. He offers customers free confederate flag stickers in celebration. (Fast forward to 2015: Confederate flag patch on a jacket.)To talk about the characters and their circumstances is to recount the whole book. Suffice it to say that there were heroes, and cowards. There was great, gut wrenching sadness. There were goosebumps. There was so much fear. Palpable fear. There were the Four Spirits watching over the city. There were martyrs. Was there change? True change? We changed the laws, but did we change hearts and minds?This felt like a passion project for Jeter Naslund. I'm a fan of her other works, but there is something about this book that just got me in the core. Not sure it would impact everybody the same way, but it certainly did me. Though a long book, it moved quickly and I was completely immersed in the reading of it. I'm so glad I finally read this! It's been sitting here for AGES. But I know that the timing was right. I know that because because less than a month ago 9 people were killed in a church. And just a day before that an overt racist announced his bid for the White House. AND HE'S NUMBER TWO IN THE REPUBLICAN POLLS. (Supporting Trump is a condoning racism. No ambiguity.) This is a nation with people who teach their children racism, as Roof's father clearly did. We have to just say no. We have to make it stop. WE HAVE TO MAKE IT STOP.In Jeter Naslund's words we need "a readiness to be kind, one to another; the courage to embrace people, without regard for color, for their essential HUMANNESS."

I have never had all 3 of my cats eat a new food like this.  They REALLY like it.I'm a big fan of Wellness foods.  Right now I'm using the Wellness TruFood which is really expensive, so I was eager to try this.  And while the cats love it, it has potato in it, and I'm not really a fan of the cats eating potato.  But for a more cost friendly alternative, I think this is an adequate choice.

I would love to give it 5 stars, but I am disappointed in the overall sound quality.Set up was simple and the headphones are easy to use.  There is great coverage - in a 2-story Townhouse and I can hear in any room...upstairs, downstairs (away from the transmitter) even outside on my patio, without losing any volume or tone quality.On use - I have to have the TV volume OFF when using the headset because there is a slight delay.  I have also used the Sennheiser RS120 and that's not an issue with that system.  It's fine when I'm watching TV by myself, but when others are in the room it's a bit annoying for me because of the delay.  The sound is adequate for voices, I was disappointed in the quality of the music transmission.  When you are listening under these conditions, if the music is full and intense, it adds to the drama of what you are watching...you are "there"...and that's what I was missing...I wasn't "there".  I would have thought for the advertised price, it would sound more like the higher end headsets available from Bose, Sony, etc.  I will definitely continue to use it and be happy with it, but I will miss the experience that could have been "there"!From a comfort perspective, it's more comfortable than the Sennheiser but from an overall experience perspective the Sennheiser wins.I have not tried to hook up any other devices so the amplifier other than the earbuds that came with the system.

I haven't purchased a full album since Back to Black by Amy Winehouse.  Usually when I like a song, I just play it on YouTube until I'm burnt out.  I've been playing all of these songs on YouTube for about 3 weeks now, and I just can't get enough.  Del Rey is exceptionally talented as a singer, writer and visual artist.  If you've not seen the video for National Anthem, you should go do that right now!Off to the Races is my favorite on this album, but National Anthem is a close second "Red White Blue is in the sky, summer's in the air, baby heaven's in your eyes."  Blue Jeans is amazing, Video Games amazing.I'm sorry I waited so long to listen to this whole album.  Definitely worth the purchase, and if you buy the CD you can download it right away to your computer, and transfer it right into iTunes.  And, if you haven't use the Amazon music app it's pretty awesome as well - and it comes with lyrics.  You kids today don't know how good you have it. :)

This is a really nice oven mit, but it is HUGE.  It goes all the way up to my elbow.  It's also a bit bulky.  Aside from that it's thick and sturdy - and the silicone skids are handy.  Quality product - I would expect nothing less from All Clad.

I'm really on the fence about this.Pros -Case is really sturdyNice having the extra battery lifeAttractiveCons -though it only adds 2.2 ounces to the phone, it feels heavier and the phone is bulkydoes not use Apple charger, so the 5 extra phone chargers (including one for the car) become sort of uselessNot easy to slip the phone in and out ofI got 24 hours on my phone before the battery completely died.  I played games, texted, talked on the phone.  I just not sure the need is great enough that I put up with the cons.  We'll see the next time I have a heavy GPS day.

I've tried red, blue and now brown mechanical keyboards, and the red remains my favorite.One of the great things about this keyboard is that it comes with the key puller.  I know that might seem minor, but it's super handy.It's getting quite a workout, and the keys feel great.  It took minimal time to adapt too.  I like it, but my first choice would be red.

I got overzealous when I ordered this.  I love L'Occitane products, and failed to notice that this is oil.Yes, it removes the makeup.  It also leaves behind an oily residue - but that doesn't stay oily for too long and then the skin feels pretty good.  For me, the fragrance is WAY too much for something you are going to put on your face.

I knew this wasn't my kind of book, but I'm actually super annoyed by it. It was really just "OK" - The dialog was stiff, weird and unnatural most of the time, and I HATE being told how funny something or somebody is, when it's not at all funny. Also, the author said people "Rappelled up" a tree, and rappelling means to descend, so why didn't somebody catch that???  And no child has said "Cool Beans" for years.Auggie has a horrible facial deformity, and he's starting his first year of school. Children can be horrible, as we all know. But somehow Auggie has this fantastic personality (not seen in the book) and at this miraculous school he comes to be accepted by his whole grade. NEVER. HAPPENS. Really, this was a fairy tale. And I suppose if you had a facial deformity and you read this book it would make you hopeful, so from that aspect I suppose it succeeds. I don't know why I felt this needed to be realistic, because the reality of it was super depressing.I understand it's written for a younger audience, but are we doing our children any good by pretending that this could actually happen?  The book should have been about Summer's bravery in bucking the tide at the school and being the kinder person.  That would have been the better message for kids.Palacio felt bad for being a schmuck and this was her way to assuage her guilt.  The reality is, as sad as it is, many of us may have that kind of reaction.  But it's irresponsible to use this book as a way to teach a lesson.It was a blessedly fast read.SPOILERThe dog did not need to die. that was just stupid and unnecessary - a ploy to bring emotion to the story.END SPOILER

I've had this for 3 years, and am seriously considering another.  A year after I bought this one, I bought a Wine Enthusiast 24-bottle model.  It died last night.  RIP.  If you are considering a wine fridge, this has stood the test of time thus far.Make sure when you are buying a fridge, that you are really getting the size you need.  Thus far I've spent $500.00 on two fridges and still don't have enough room.  I have wine everywhere! (Must cancel wine clubs!) I'm sorry I didn't just buy a big one to start.

There are a lot of things people don't tell you about aging, and one of those is how sensitive your teeth and gums get, so if you have any sensitivity, switch to Sensodyne toothpaste before using this.  I had been using Tom's of Maine for a quite a while and the first time I used this was quite uncomfortable.In fact, many times I've used this it was uncomfortable.  I found wetting the brush with warm water also helps.I have super plaquey teeth, and even though I brush thoroughly and floss every single day, going to the dentist for a cleaning is still uncomfortable.  My hygienist recommended this.  I read a lot of the reviews, and frankly they scared me.  People talking about how loud, and how much vibration there was.  It did not sound comfortable, so I waited.  Then my dad convinced me to give it a try.  It takes adjusting, and if you have a headache, it may amplify the headache, but after about 2 weeks you hardly notice anymore.  Just try to make it as comfortable in the beginning and you will adjust.My teeth feel cleaner and look better.  I think this was a good decision for me.  I'm eager for my next cleaning to see how it helps!

I don't have much trouble with my earbuds falling out, fortunately, but these are actually a lot more comfortable than I expected.  Sound is good, and I really like that there's a clip to keep the cord attached to your shirt.I think these would be great for running, walking, cleaning the house, etc.  Recommended.
This smells great, but there is absolutely no flavor in the tea. I wouldn't buy this - not even sure what I will do with it. I ended up dumping my cup out.

I loved the Spellman Files, and I think Lutz could have had a lucrative career if she did nothing but those.  Obviously she realized she had more in her, and I'm glad she did for a lot of reasons.  (One of them being I don't continue on with series that long, and one of them being this book.)This is the story of the friendship of three women, told over 25 years.  It is completely non-linear.  Often times I find that when a book is told in this way, it's jarring for me when the timeline changes, but Lutz did this so well that I wasn't disappointed when we changed timelines, I was excited.  I couldn't wait to see "when" we were going next.This isn't a totally unique premise .... the girls meet, and their bond is forged and/or tested by an "event."  The success of this book hinges entirely on the storytelling and the characters!  Lutz is known for her humor, and it's more subdued in this book but it's definitely still there.  The personalities of these characters are great.  You can see a bit of the Spellman girls in these women, but they transcend those characteristics.  Honestly, I'm not sure if everybody is going to love the characters - but I did.I finished this in two sittings.  There was a suspenseful quality to be sure.Definitely recommended.
I wish I bought every color.  These are the perfect kick around town, and wear to the airport shoes.

Got this for my 3 14-pound cats to take them to the vet or for when I take them to visit family.  It's really the perfect size.  I find it so much better than the metal crates.  I was hoping it would be lighter, but I can't say that it really is.  And I haven't tried to get it in the car yet, which may present a challenge.  But, because the frame is collapse-able, I will be able to get it in that way,and then add the cats one at a time.  I'm happy with it, and they like it.
Super cute!  I absolutely love these shoes.  I wish I'd gotten other colors.

These are very cool glasses, and I'm not just talking about how they look.  The way they are designed minimizes the alcohol smell and maximizes the smell of whatever spirit you are drinking.  Really a must for anyone who enjoys fine spirits.
My Sony laptop plug had a short, and I was so happy I didn't have to spend Sony dollars to replace it.  This works perfectly.

I like Tom's of Maine, I use several of their toothpastes, so I was happy to try this one.I appreciate that it's "enamel strengthening" but really I have no way to tell.  Other than that, recommended.

I liked Haunted, and I thought this might be like that.  I'm not sure what this is.  It's a bunch of boring stories, which aren't in any way entertaining.You don't need to "unread" them, you need to never have read them to begin with.  Save yourself ... it's too late for me.

Some books aren't about very much and at the end you kind of go ... "meh" and totally forget about them.  Some books aren't about very much yet they pack a punch.  This was the latter.  This book was about simple people coping.It was beautifully written, told with such simple emotion.  Short, sweet, and sad.I loved it.EDITED TO ADD:  As of my review, there are 13 5-star reviews of this book.  I just wanted to throw it out there that this is my first Haruf and my review has no sentimental attachment to the author.  I agree that this is a fitting end to his career even though I don't know his other work, and I'm eager to read more.  What I'm saying is - it really is a 5-star book.

I am the worst at opening wine bottles.  Many a cork have I ruined.  Sadly, I've also ruined an electric wine opening by getting a cork stuck in it.  I generally use Oster, which are half the price so I'm eager to see how long this one lasts.So far so good ...

A black male, a southern male, a Malaysian comedian male, and mid-Western white female who is 1/8th Native American meet while students at Berkeley and become friends. During one of their classes, D'aron, our southern boy, remarks that in his hometown of Braggsville, Georgia they have civil war reenactments. His offhand comment snowballs into a project for class - their own reenactment - and by virtue of it, a protest."It was foolish to fake a hate crime to make the opposite point. But we weren't faking a hate crime. We were reenacting American history."This is a powerful book. The writing is fantastic, different. And be forewarned, dialog is not in quotes (so it's destined for a Pulitzer), and though that normally REALLY bothers me, it didn't in this book. I've seen a couple comparisons between this book and Oscar Wao (shudder) and it almost made me not want to read the book. Honestly, I don't see the comparison at all. (Except for the punctuation/Pulitzer thing.)"Irony is a bastard. A special kind: mother unknown"Filled with social commentary, it would make a great book for discussion. I imagine it will be quite polarizing. I found myself wishing I'd jotted down questions I could ask others after they have read it. It's a very timely tale. I'm eager to see what the general response is. Though there were a couple parts which dragged for me, it has really stuck with me in the weeks since I read it. It made me think about how I think. I found it a very worthwhile read.And now, just because I liked this line:"Louis beamed like he'd found a buttered Olsen twin in his bed."

If I wasn't getting a complete set, I don't think I would have bought all of these items.  I already have an aerator and I'm not 100% sold on the air pump, though I do like the idea of the wine savers because sometimes we break our corks.  But mostly, we try to drink the whole bottle on the first day.  That's the only true way to guarantee freshness.The best part about this set, though, is the wine chiller.  It's a perfect way to put a quick chill on a bottle of white, and keep it cool.  It's super easy.The cork screw is nice as well.

I love Bliss products, but am often unwilling to spend the money.  This is a really nice gift set, and a better value for Bliss.  I'm not sure I quite understand what the Love Handler does, needs to be used in conjunction with diet and exercise, well .... if I wanted to diet and exercise, I wouldn't be looking for a product to help with that area.  So I dropped it a star for that odd product.  Kind of feels like a throwaway in the package.Everything else is great though.

I very much enjoy dark twisted Japanese fiction, and this was definitely dark and twisted. A photographer of some renown is on death row and a journalist is trying to write his story. What unfolds is - confusing to say the least. You're never entirely sure who is speaking, and I don't know if it was because of translation, deliberateness or just weak writing - I never felt a connection to any of the characters. In fact, I spent a lot of the book unsure who was even speaking.There were some interesting examinations, however, and some unexpected story points. I don't know that I can say I enjoyed it - I was interested. This is not your typical dark book, it's definitely for someone who already know they like - what I said at the start - dark-twisted-Japanese fiction

Last we left me, I had sworn off Chuckie P. So many duds in a row - I just couldn't fathom subjecting myself to it again, until I read this tagline "A billion husbands are about to be replaced."This was in no way a great book, but I didn't hate it.It's this science fictiony take on - well - masturbation. Corny Maxwell has released a line of female pleasure products called "Beautiful You" and the women get addicted. It's an interesting idea, but wow you can tell it was written by a man. It's in no way believable, there were flaws all over the place and it was only mildly funny and yet, I was entertained. It was about sex, but it was so clinical. Really, the biology of sex, I really didn't find anything sexy about it. Overall, it was a CRAZY idea and I guess because I had zero expectations, it worked for me.NOT A SPOILER BUT YOU MIGHT NOT WANT TO READ THIS IF YOU ARE PLANNING ON READING THISMaxwell does a lot of - let's call it - market research and Penny becomes a "test subject" she's also the book's protagonist. I pictured Penny as Lena Dunham the whole book. I like her, but she's not somebody you necessarily think of as sexy.END THAT WHICH YOU CAN'T UNSEEI definitely don't think this book has any kind of mass appeal, but that doesn't seem to matter to Mr. P and his legion of fans
Works great as far as I can tell.  Charged 50% in a little over an hour.  Not sure I've timed my regular charger, though so I can't really compare it.

According to my favorite 3-year-old "It's Amazing!" No really, amazing.This toy is gigantic.  I don't think you realize until you see it next to the child how big it is.  It's got a lot of moving parts, and the push a button and it talks to you is super fun.  What I don't really know is how "amazing" this will be after the novelty wears off.  For the money, it just doesn't seem to do much.  So while it's fun for now, I can see it getting relegated to the garage in a short time.EDITED:  As predicted, it was relegated to the garage.  But not because of boredom, but because of the size.  I don't know if absence makes the heart grow fonder or what, but our little three year old wants to play with this every single day.  It's been weeks, and he still loves it.

This is a nice blender.  I tend to keep all my small appliances on my kitchen counter, and like that it looks good.Thus far I have not had any issues with the smoothie attachment as others have mentioned, and I think it's a great addition to the blender.

It's so nice to have a photo printer!  I'm one of those people who always means to order prints, but never get around to it so having this around is a great help.Set up was fairly easy though took a bit of time.  I almost threw away the ink, not noticing that it was taped to the Styrofoam so be on the look out for that.  The Wi-Fi was really easy to set up, it connected from my computer and works great thus far.What I didn't think of is that I didn't come with paper (duh!)  So make sure you order some photo paper before starting your projects.

These photo programs are so amazing, but they are also overwhelming!  There are so many features I will probably never use, even though I'd like to.  I probably need to take a class.Fortunately, there are some video tutorials and I've been doing those.  Even still, using the fabulous "magic fill" feature I managed to give my cat two extra paws, and using the straightening feature, I managed to cut off my friend's head.  And I haven't quite been able to figure out how to fix either of those.With time and practice there are endless photographic opportunities to be had and Magic Fill will be awesome once I figure it out.

If you know a kid who loves Thomas THIS is the towel for them.  Really there is no way to explain the pure joy (theirs and mine.)  It's soft and looks so much better on the child than in this photo.  A winner!

There is a lot to like about this monitor, great image quality, great colors, consistent backlighting, and the price. I love the sleek frameless design and the antiglare screen that you can view from almost any angle.Earlier this year I purchased a HD Samsung monitor that was priced slightly more than this HP and was shocked at the poor quality of the construction, it looked cheap, it wasnât level. The color was unnaturally vivid, the backlighting was uneven and there was bleed -through of the backlighting on the edges.  I couldnât return it fast enough.After that experience I was fully prepared to be underwhelmed with this HP. I hooked it up, turned it on and heard myself saying âoh wowâ.  The image and color was fabulous.  The monitor auto-adjusted and looked great without installing any software. It comes with a disk that includes a manual, driver and âMy Displayâ software. The My Display control panel will give you choices of presets for gaming, movies, photo editing or working on documents.  It will also allow you to partition the screen to allow independent control of each partition.On the stand it sits 15 1/4â high and is 19 3/4â wide. It canât be adjusted for height; it only tilts forward and backward for viewing angle. It connects with HDMI or VGA but only a VGA cable is included in the box.I am very happy with the performance of this monitor and wouldnât hesitate to recommend or purchase as a gift.

I have been using ZipLoc quart Freezer bags exclusively and I found these to be comparable in quality. The Hefty are a little wider and not as long as the ZipLoc and I do appreciate the wider opening on these. Slide-close bags are very convenient if the slider works well and the Hefty slider does work well and stays closed. The 140 count package pricing is a great deal!

This case interested me because I liked the idea of being able to personalize the back with my own photos or artwork. It would have been nice if they included a template and I checked the manufacturer web site in case they made one available. But no template, they donât want to make it easy to use anything other than the inserts they offer for purchase.After getting the case and looking it over I realized that I wouldnât need the template because it is so ugly and cheap looking I didnât want to put it on my phone.  The rubber bumper was poorly molded and bits of extra material cling to the edges that frame the front glass of the phone.  The rubber material has a mottled matte/glossy finish that looks cheap. The back of the bumper is glossy black plastic that is very slippery in hand and will slide off a surface easily. The clear back is slightly indented so it will not make direct contact with the surface you place it on but It appears to be made of polystyrene and despite my case has never been in use it already is scratched. If you think your phone is just too nice looking and a âgrungeâ look is what you are after this might be the one for you.This case is a huge disappointment especially considering the exorbitant price and overall I think putting it on a beautiful iPhone just diminishes it. As a manufacturer I would be embarrassed to have my name on it.I read every positive review to try to understand what people liked about this case but I just donât get it and none swayed my opinion about it.

These are excellent quality heavy duty gloves that are perfect for jobs like staining or nasty cleaning tasks and are tough enough to reuse.They do fit a little snug though and I would order one size larger than usual unless you want a skin-tight fit.

Overall I was impressed with the amount of pet hair and dirt, even fine dirt this can pick up for a âbudget pricedâ robotic vacuum. The dust bin is very small and needs to be emptied frequently. There is a trash can icon that lights up on the vac as a reminder it needs to be emptied. It has two speeds; normal and turbo.  Turbo is very loud.If you want to set up unattended scheduled cleanings you will need to use the dock. It requires 40â of open space on the left of the dock, 12â on the right and 79â in front so you are limited in where you can set it up. The dock itself is very light weight and has two pieces; the dock and a mounting bracket. The bracket is secured to the wall with either the supplied double-stick foam tape or screws. My dock is on low pile carpet and there is enough friction I have been able to get away without mounting it to the wall. If you have an area that doesnât need any pre-vacuuming prep to remove obstacles the programed running times are convenient.I do like the feature that this vac can be charged with either the dock or by plugging the cord directly into the vac. That is convenient if you donât have a clear place to set up the dock or if you never do unattended vacuum cycles. When repeatedly pressing the power button to select running time the vac will instantly start after the last press.  The default is random pattern and with that setting it will just randomly switch between patterns until the time runs out. I did not find that to be as effective as choosing a single pattern to systematically go over the floor.I found the virtual wall generally performed well, the only time it failed was when the beam was interrupted by being too close to the folds of a bed skirt.It has some of the same issues all robot vacs do; inadequate edge and corner cleaning, problems with rug fringe and cords getting caught in the wheels.

This is a very nice looking case that does provide great protection. I like the once-piece design with the soft silicone bezel and interior. It fits my iPhone 6s snugly but does noticeably add to the weight of the phone. The hard shell is slippery but the silicone bezel and buttons do provide a decent grip.The manufacturer claims the hard glossy case is scratch resistant but it isnât; not even slightly. Iâve had the case on my phone for 4 days and during that time either the phone was on a table/desk or by itself in a fabric lined pocket in my purse. Despite the tender treatment there are quite a few fine scratches on the case already. These cases are pricey and I did expect to get better wear from it. At full retail price I donât think it is a good value and wouldnât purchase another.

Esthetically this scale is beautiful, and honestly I love it just for that.  Its  14â x 14â x 1 1/4â high with a large easy to read digital display. It is accurate and seems to be very well made.  If you want to use the app they have two My Vitals apps for the iPhone. The My Vitals 2.0 is 64 MB vs. 94 MB for the original app. You donât have that choice for the iPad the 94 MB version is the only one available. Both versions are designed to work with other iHealth Bluetooth devices like the blood pressure and activity monitor.  You can also enter data manually for blood pressure and pulse/ oximeter but not the activity monitor.Fortunately you donât need to bring your phone with you for every weigh in; it will remember up to 200 weight measurements that can be downloaded next time the scale is connected to the iPhone/iPad. The Bluetooth will not activate when you step on the scale if the paired device is not in range, saving battery life. Reconnecting takes just a few seconds.You donât need to use the app at all if you donât want to create a weight record. But if you donât have the app installed you will not receive notices if the scale has a software update.

It looks like they had entertaining in mind when they designed this model with a sleek glossy black body with and chrome details. I love the hinged lid feature; no longer do I have to wonder where I will set down a hot, wet lid and it is so nice for buffets when serving foods that tend to dry out on top if kept uncovered. The stoneware is oven safe so I can bake something in the oven if that would give better results than slow cooking and use the crock pot to keep it warm for serving.The glass lid is very tough. I accidentally dropped it from about 8â above the stoneware, and it hit hard! I thought for sure it was totaled before I ever had a chance to cook with it. But there was not a chip or crack in either the lid or stoneware.When set to low temperature it is hot enough to cook at a brisk simmer. I would be wary of cooking on high, especially if I was not going to be home.I do wish there was a simple provision to wrap the cord in the back for storage.16â x 13â x 9â high.

I have a 2005 Weber Performer and purchased the Weber model 9911 cover in 2008. It was very expensive but it lasted 8 years. I replaced it last year with the Weber model 7455; also not inexpensive and I was disappointed that for the price it was so thin and flimsy feeling. I knew immediately the cover was not going to last; a year later it is brittle and cracking. Both of the Weber covers would get lifted off in strong winds and condensation would form under the cover.I could tell immediately that this Ravenna is much higher quality than the Weber 7455. It is made from heavyweight polyester fabric with a water resistant layer laminated to the inside and double stitched seams. I love the details like the vent for better air circulation and the quick and easy to use hem straps.  It fits my 2005 Performer just fine and covers to the top of the casters.I think this is the best value in a grill cover. Great color too, not so light it will show every bit of dirt and grime and a pleasing neutral brown that blends in and doesn't call too much attention to it.I like this so much I'm planning on purchasing a patio table cover from the same line.

I purchased this cover May 2014 and it is already stiff and cracking. The quality is so bad I'm not sure if it even is a genuine Weber cover, my first one lasted 8 years. I wouldn't waste my money on this one again.

Both my cats were suddenly having trouble with vomiting and diarrhea from the canned food they have eaten for years.  I wasn't sure it was the food at first, but I started feeding them only the Nutro Chunky Loaf Chicken Dinner and they were fine. One day I slipped a can of their previous brand into the bowls and the diarrhea came back.This is a pate style cat food with random soft chunks in it. The main ingredients are Chicken, Chicken Broth, Chicken Liver and Pork Broth. Both my cats like it, I feel better giving them much higher quality food, and for a reasonable price. Win-win-win.

I have been using an Omron 10 series upper arm cuff and an Omron Series 7 BP652 wrist monitor before receiving this BP654. Like the BP652 This 7 Series Plus BP654 reads slightly lower than the upper arm cuff; particularly the diastolic measurement. But I love how easy the wrist BP monitor is to use so I am more likely to take the time to read my blood pressure than with the upper arm cuff. The 654 has added the feature of using with an app to record readings. It isn't necessary to use the app; the monitor will store up to 100 readings and also can give you an average reading from the last 3 readings taken within 10 minutes.  It is also very quiet; it doesn't make a sound as it inflates. And it is compact, the hard plastic storage case is, just 3" x 4" x 1-3/4" so it is easy to keep handy in comparison to an upper arm cuff monitor.Overall I like this wrist monitor very much, it is quick and easy to take a reading and so much more comfortable than an upper arm cuff monitor. My dentist uses this same model on his patients as part of his pre-dental screening.

When I unpacked this griddle my first thought was; wow, this is one serious piece of equipment!  It is very well constructed from heavy gauge stainless steel and care was taken to finish all of the edges.It fits my 22 1/2" Weber Kettle perfectly and I love the 2" high sidewalls that make it easy to keep the food on the griddle.  I had been using a flat, round cast iron griddle and the lack of side walls made griddling challenging. The Kettle Q is a pleasure to cook on and it does an amazing job creating perfect crispy charred and blistered crust on pizza. It has been performing very well and seems like it will be very durable.You have to clean it while its still warm, I keep the kettle cover on while we have our meal and it is still warm enough to clean after we are done. I follow the cleaning instruction the manufacture posted on You Tube; squirting water on while still warm to steam up the grease scrape the bits into the grease trough and scrub with a high temperature grill scrubber. Little Griddle makes an inexpensive set.Little Griddle GK540 Grill Cleaning Kit, Silver/Black/Green.

This is a nice solidly built cradle. The suction pad is a large 2 3/4" and is slightly tacky. It has a screw collar to tighten the suction cup to the windshield or dash that I find easier to use than a lever attachment. I attached it to my slightly textured dash and despite the lack of a completely smooth surface it is holding strong. You can turn the cradle to hold your phone in the landscape or portrait position.The arm grips are well padded and hold my phone very securely without concern about scratching or damage and I like that they included the fold down supports for the bottom of the phone for an extra security. They don't block the charging port so I can keep my phone plugged in while in the mount. The arm grips release with a push of a button so it takes a second to release the phone and go.This model has a short stem for use in smaller vehicles where the dash and windshield are closer to the driver. They do make the same mount with a telescoping stem if you need the extra length.I received a free sample of this product for the purpose of an unbiased review.

I had a Thermos King Travel Tumbler and it worked great. It kept my coffee hot all morning but the cap mechanism was a pain to disassemble/ reassemble for cleaning and the gasket eventually gave out after a year and I tossed the tumbler with no interest in buying another one.Thermos Stainless Steel King 16-Ounce Travel Tumbler, Midnight Blue.I bought a two pack of Contigo auto seal travel mugs to replace the Thermos.Contigo Autoseal Travel Mug - Stainless Steel Vacuum Insulated Tumbler - 2 Pack (Blue/Green) They are very easy to clean and I liked the auto seal feature that keeps the mug sealed at all times unless you press a button to sip. But they are not insulated very well and my coffee would already be tepid after 2 to 3 hours. They are so poorly insulated the exterior of the mug would get very warm. So off to the thrift store with those.I decided to give this Stanley a try. It is very easy to disassemble/reassemble for cleaning and has the same type of auto lock feature I liked about the Contigo.  I always preheat thermal containers with boiling water for at least 5 minutes before filling with coffee about 7am. With the Stanley my coffee is still hot at noon after sipping on it all morning, performing just as well as the Thermos brand mug.The only disappointment I have with this mug is the finish. The product page picture gives the impression it will be of the classic green hammertone finish that has been on Stanley containers for years. But its not.  It is a much less interesting glossy olive drab paint with a textured finish. If you zoom in on the picture of the Navy color option it is the same finish only olive drab.

In comparison to wood or plastic raised bed gardens that have a more utilitarian appearance this garden bed is attractive enough to use in the front of the house for flower beds. The almond sides and brown corner posts match almost exactly the almond stucco and brown painted trim on my house.It assembles quickly and not counting site preparation I was ready to add soil and start planting in about 20 minutes.All surfaces except the corner post cap are finished with matte painted metal. The corner post caps are plastic and do benefit by a periodic wipe of a vinyl protectant like you would use for a car.Mine arrived without some push-in fasteners. I emailed the customer service address included with the instructions and I received the parts in about a week. When they arrived I was disappointed to see that the fasteners are plastic and I wonder how well they will hold up year after year. At least that is not the only thing holding the bed together, the side panels attach to the corner posts with a screw-head and keyhole fastener and should be strong enough on its own. The plastic fasteners are installed on the interior corners of the bed and I did need to use a mallet to fully seat a couple of them.Overall I am very pleased with the Spacemaker Raised Garden Bed. its a nice addition to my garden and I think it is a good value.

This syrup has a wonderful rich caramelized flavor and is fabulous for sweetening hot or cold beverages like tea, coffee, sweet tea or cocktails.It is very sweet so you don't need much and it is slightly thinner and less sticky than honey so it is easy to add just the right amount from the squeeze bottle.I also tried it in my favorite caramel popcorn recipe in place of the corn syrup and it worked very well. The cooked syrup did not crystalize and it intensified the dark caramel flavor.  I found it too sweet for my taste to use as is on pancakes or waffles but I combined 1/4 cup of the syrup with 2 T of butter and  1 T of dark rum; boiled for 5 minutes to combine and served the syrup with coconut pancakes. Delicious!

I purchased this to replace an older Panasonic phone system that could only block 30 numbers.  In addition to the ability to block 250 numbers they have added a dedicated call block button on each handset to easily block an incoming call. You can also block numbers from the caller ID list by "Select" "Save" and "Call Block". You can choose if you want the phone to ring once for a blocked call or not at all. I like it to ring once because I take great pleasure in knowing a telemarketer has just been disconnected. You can also manually program in blocked numbers.Just a few of the other great features:You can link two cell phones or a headset and one phone. You also have the ability to program which extensions will ring when a cell call comes in.You can use the landline and a linked cell phone simultaneously effectively creating a 2 line phone service.If you don't want your sleep disturbed you can program a silent mode for certain hours of the day and you can choose to silence all or let some contacts ring through.The only down side to this phone is the ring-tones; they are awful and seem like they are carryovers from the early 90's electronic ring tones. I have an older AT&T phone set that has much better choices for tones and the ability to customize individual tones for contacts but it can't block numbers. So I have both phones set up and I keep the ringer volume on the Panasonic low. There are no conflicts between phone systems and I get the best of both worlds.

I like Belkin cables; I have many and have never thrown one away because it failed. I was intrigued by the idea of a metallic cable; reading the description of the cable and taking in consideration the price I expected the cable would be covered in a metallic braided wire and thought that would be a cool looking and durable cable.But apparently the metallic part of the description refers just to the satin finish aluminum connectors.  The cable is covered in a grey braided cloth that reminds me of the vintage cloth covered power cords.  I don't like the fabric as a cover because it will absorb grime start to look grungy in a hurry and will stain if you spilled something on it. It just seems like a bad idea for something that gets handled as much as a charging cable.

It was surprising to find a speaker this small with an actual subwoofer and it makes a big difference in the overall quality of sound.The volume is limited so you get the best listening experience when the speaker is within arms distance. It can project across a small room but the further away you are the less you can pick up on the nuances of your selection.  If you like to listen to music, internet radio or podcasts at your desk but hate using ear buds this would be an excellent choice.Using as a speaker phone I found the performance adequate for brief conversations but the volume of the incoming call can be low so it is best when the speaker is within 2 feet of the listener.I rate the sound quality for a small personal speaker at 5 stars, as a speakerphone; 3 stars so my overall rating is 4 stars.I received this speaker as a free sample for the purposes of an unbiased review.

This is a perfect charger for those who need to charge their phone more than once a day or if you just want to carry some backup power just in case.At just about 4 ounces and 2 3/4" X 5" X 5/8" it easily slips into a pocket or purse. It charges quickly and it will charge my iPhone twice. You can also keep the phone plugged into it and it will trickle charge as needed; handy when using high power consumption apps like NAV.  It will work on a tablet but you won't get much of a boost with a 4600mAh; I will get an extra 25 to 30% on my iPad.It takes about 6 1/2 hours to fully charge the 4600 so I just let it charge overnight and its ready to go.If I were to wish for one improvement; it would come with a slipcase to protect the ports and a pocket to tuck a short charging cable.I received this Portable Charger as a free sample for the purpose of an unbiased review.

I love how quiet this Aera Baby Max purifier is and it is compact so it fits easily into smaller rooms. The controls are intuitive and I appreciate the ability to dim the display. Although the controls can be locked to prevent children from playing with them and changing the settings it isn't represented as a "child proof" air purifier.When set on Auto the purifier will run on the lowest speed until it detects a decrease in air quality and will step up the fan speed as needed. It is incredibly quiet on the two lowest speeds; high is noisy but for average use you wouldn't need to run the fan at the two highest speeds.  With the fan on low I really don't even notice the fan at all, perfect for a bedroom. It does freshen the air and reduce odors.They recommend replacing the Hepa filter #9287101;True HEPA 9287101 Filter with AeraSafe Antimicrobial Treatment for AeraMax 200 Air Purifier once a year and the Carbon Filter # 9324101, sold in a package of 4;Carbon Filter for AeraMax 200 Air Purifier - 4 Pack (9324101) every three months.  At the prices on Amazon now it would be about 52.00 a year for filters.

It was difficult to decide how to rate this Wi-Fi extender because it is a nice device with great features but ultimately not something I wanted to continue using.I like the design of this extender with the adjustable antenna, dual band, and Ethernet port for connecting devices that don't have wireless capabilities. The pass-through plug outlet is a nice touch so you don't even need to give up a plug slot. They did place the extenders plug very close to the top edge so it doesn't block use of the other outlet.  I had the best signals when I could use it in an outlet that was not near the floor on a baseboard.Set up was not difficult and can be done on your phone, tablet, or PC. I love the feature that lets you know if you have selected the best location. Why waste your time setting up only to find the extender isn't getting a good signal.I have an old brick and stucco house with lath & plaster interior walls that do an effective job of reducing my routers signal strength, especially in my kitchen. Just to see how well the extender could receive a signal far from the router I set this up in several areas in my house including the basement laundry room in an outlet on the cement foundation with a washer, dryer and upright freezer between the extender and router one flight up and across the house. It had no complaints about the signal and I was able to connect no problem.I decided not to use the Linksys extender at all because it reduced the overall speed of my connection in the places I already received a great signal from my router. I would rather have the reduced signal in the kitchen than give up the signal strength and speed I get in other areas. That isn't a problem just for this Linksys but Wi-Fi extenders in general. I think it may be the most useful for those who have a severe problem with dead spots or if you need the Ethernet connection feature.

I'm using the Personal Cloud to store files and photographs I want to access from other devices and locations and as a backup for individual files and folders.Set up was quick and easy. It comes with a 4 foot Ethernet cable and a 68" power cord. My computer recognized the drive right away. A very minimal Quick Start guide is included but full user manuals for the Personal Cloud and using Seagate Access are available at the Seagate website. After registering with an email and password for the account I installed the S drive software on a Windows desktop and laptop; and the Seagate Media app on my iPad and iPhone.You can select to view files by type or show all and you can choose between thumbnails or list. Actual thumbnails are only available with photos so in thumbnail view with other files you will see a generic icon for document of video. There is a search function so you can also search for files by name.If you choose to invite other users to have access to your Personal Cloud, they will have to download the Sdrive and/or Media app and register an email address and password with Seagate. Everything put in the Public folder can be viewed by everyone you have invited to have access to the drive. There is a private folder but it is only available to the owner when accessing the Personal Cloud with the Sdrive not the Media app.I was quite happy with the Cloud until I realized some files and folders were not showing up when using the Media app. I found the files and folders were in the public folder when I used the Sdrive on my laptop to check if I had missed adding them.I poked around in the Seagate forum to look for a solution and tried disabling and enabling the Media app access and then re-indexing.  I usually hate the process of looking in forums for answers but Seagate has theirs set up so I was able to find what I needed relatively painlessly.  The indexing is supposed to take a "few minutes" but over an hour later my iPad and iPhone were still indexing. And that was for a relatively small amount, just 11.4 Gigabytes. But it worked like a charm and everything is visible on the Media app now. So if you try this just be patient, it will look like it isn't progressing, but it is and eventually will finish.The Personal Cloud is very quiet, much more than other NAS I have used. I also like that Seagate went beyond the plain rectangular box and added aesthetics like ventilation grills of elongated triangles, the slight cutaway on the bottom edge and the subtle Seagate Logo.

A ceramic knife can't replace a traditional stainless or carbon steel knife because of it fragility. You can't use any force to cut through hard food like winter squash without risking snapping the blade.What a ceramic knife does excel at with its very sharp, thin and smooth blade is precise cutting like paper thin slices, fine julienne or tiny dicing like brunoise.  It is a great addition to your kitchen tools and will last a long time as long as you are careful about using, cleaning and storing it.This T-fal is quite sharp and performs very well at the tasks it is suited for. I have mixed feelings about the bolster feature that keeps the blade raised off the counter about 1/2". It does keep what is on the knife off your counter and cutting board and that is nice, but it also makes it easier to bump into the knife and either knock it off the counter or cut yourself.  I have to be more careful where I set the knife down and make sure the sharp edge of the blade is facing away from me. The large bolster also prevents a traditional "pinch grip" on the knife where your thumb and forefinger grip the blade for more vertical stability but on a knife of this size and limited function it isn't as critical as when using a traditional 8" or 10" chef's knife.This T-fal knife is a nice price point because it is inevitable that eventually something will happen to chip or break a ceramic knife no matter how much you pay for it.  I like that for the price they include a sheath because it is a must-have unless you can keep the knife in a block.In the Care and Use instructions it states "Never re-sharpen".  Some manufactures like Kyrocera will let you send in your knife for sharpening or they offer a small battery operated sharpener designed for their knives. But don't expect if you pay twice the price for a ceramic knife like the Kyrocera it will be any less fragile. I worked in a kitchenware store that sold Kyrocera knives and heard plenty of complaints about fragility. I prefer not to worry about sharpening a ceramic knife; just take good care of it and replace when needed so something like this T-fal is perfect.You must use a softer cutting surface like wood or plastic but you should be doing that anyway for your steel knives to help keep the edge longer.The T-fal is dishwasher safe but that is risky unless you make sure the knife won't come in contact with anything else during the cycle. It is best to hand wash and put away any knife as soon as you're done using it.This review is of the T-fal 6" Chefs Knife.

When comparing this Apple certified Mediabridge cable with Apple's  OEM cable the Apple cable seems so thin and delicate. And I never did like Apple's tiny high gloss connector mold that was always hard to get a grip on when unplugging from my devices. I have been using Belkin cables as a replacement when I had an opportunity to try this 6ft Mediabridge cable.The Mediabridge cable is very well made and I appreciate they manufacture them with a thicker gauge wire for faster charging. The connector ends are longer and easy to grip but still thin enough I have no problems using them with my cases.  And I love Mediabridge's easy to open and recycle cardboard packaging.Great cable, great price, great packaging. Win-win-win.This cable was provided to me at no charge for an unbiased review.

I found these comfortable to wear and the yellow lenses are great for outside or a very well lit area indoors. The lenses are distortion free, nothing is more annoying than bad lenses that blur vision and give you a headache. If you wear corrective glasses there isn't enough room to wear them under these.The soft vented gasket around the lenses is a great feature and helps keep sweat and small debris out of your eyes. The gasket also helps prevent fogging when using with a dust mask.I appreciate the included soft bag for storing them when not in use to keep them clean and unscratched.

I love spicy oriental scents and anything with musk, patchouli and sandalwood gets my attention. Once I smelled this it was instantly familiar as many men must use this as their signature scent.Most likely because I don't like the scent of lavender and myrrh those mid-level scents stand out to me in this cologne; though as you wear it more of the musk, patchouli and sandalwood notes come out.For an eau de toilette this is still a very intense scent and should be used with restraint or it can easily become overpowering. I prefer a level of cologne where you just get an intriguing whiff and you want to get closer to smell more of it. I would recommend spraying the air in front of you and walking through it for just the right amount. The scent will linger on the skin for hours.

Whats not to love about this classic assortment? If you're wondering this big bag had about 224 bars.I'm confused on the pricing of this 66.7 oz bag though. Generally the larger the quantity the smaller the price per oz. At the current price for this bag it is $0.45 per ounce.  You can buy the same chocolates in a 40 oz. bag Hershey's Miniatures Assortment, 40-Ounce Bag for $0.23 per oz. Or three 19.75 oz. bags; (59.25 oz.)Hershey's Miniatures Assortment, 19.75-Ounce Bag (Pack of 3) for $0.27 per oz.**Note Since them Amazon's listing in the smaller bags are not available and the others sellers prices are similar to the $0.45 per oz. this bag is priced. *** And since I wrote the Note the smaller bags are back and less than $.30 per oz so it is worth comparison shopping since prices fluctuate so frequently on Amazon.So 5 stars for the candy, minus 2 stars for the value of this particular package.

I was blown away by the sound quality of these headphones; clear rich mid and high tones and good bass. I love the comfort of the smaller size and neck band; for me they are much more comfortable to wear than a full over the ear type. I always have problems with full size headphones, they are uncomfortable with even small earrings and the headband always slips when I'm moving around.The Cadence sits just above the bottom of my earlobe so they don't cause problems with earrings. They also don't interfere with putting on and removing my reading or sunglasses. I don't even notice the neckband when I'm wearing these and I had no problem with the headphones sliding off my ears when working out, gardening or doing housework.  The headphones also do a good job keeping the sound contained so you can use these at a moderate level around others without disturbing them.The multifunction button used to power on/off /pair and answer/hang up calls can also be used to access Siri on the iPhone if you press it once when no call is coming in.  When a call is coming in the music cuts off just before the phone starts ringing and there is a voice Caller ID that will announce the number or contact. The voice quality is good on both ends.Also included is a nice 4 1/2" X 5 1/2" x 1 3/4" firm shell case with two interior mesh pockets to hold the headphones and charging cable. I also like the simple cardboard packaging with a slipcover that Mediabridge uses for their products. You can open it without worrying about taking off a finger.The only thing I don't like about these headphones is the bright blue led light on the right earpiece that blinks three times every few seconds when they are connected to a Bluetooth device. It makes me self-conscious using around others because the light calls attention to the headphones and is a distraction.These headphones were sent to me at no cost for the purpose of an unbiased review.

I am very pleased with the performance of this 5 port USB charger. It is compact; just 3" x 3" X 1 3/8" and has a heavy-weight 45" detachable power cord. It is solid and well-constructed with an attractive glossy black and matte grey case. With 8 amps there is plenty of power available for charging multiple devices at the same time.A great feature that gives me peace of mind is the safety overload protection that switches off the charger for over current, over voltage, over temperature and overload.  Overall I am very impressed with the quality, features and value of this charger and wouldn't hesitate to purchase or recommend to my friends.This charger was sent to me at no cost for the purpose of an unbiased review.

This 4 port USB charger is solid and well-constructed with an attractive glossy black and matte grey case.It is thoughtfully designed with a folding plug and the convenient choice to orient the USB ports up or down.  The overload protection feature that switches off the charger for over current, over voltage, over temperature and overload gives me peace of mind that I don't need to be concerned with overheating when charging multiple devices.I am very impressed with the quality, features and value of this charger and wouldn't hesitate to purchase or recommend to my friends.This charger was sent to me at no cost for the purpose of an unbiased review.

This is ruggedly designed for wet and outdoor use. It comes with heavy-weight charging cable and 3.5mm jack cables for connecting a device without Bluetooth. A nice feature, both cables have Velcro cable ties attached.The sturdy detachable silicone strap is heavy-weight and securely attaches with 4 buttons.It is completely waterproof when not using with the optional 3.5mm jack that requires the back cover to be open when using. If it is has been submerged and water covered the speaker grill you do need to shake it off to hear the sound clearly again. If it gets dirty or sandy you can just rinse it off and it will be good as new.The sound from the speaker is OK, very midrange and thin but still very listenable. There are 4 different equalizer presets. The default is "Flat" and yes it is flat but I found the other presets sounded odd and out of balance.Using a wall charger (not included) it takes about 2 1/2 hours to fully charge. Pairing was easy enough and after the initial pairing it will re-connect the your device automatically.As well designed as the speaker is the layout of the instructions are not.
