I bought four of these, one for each of my children. Iâm secretly bringing the book to each of their teachers at the end of each year so they can write a little blurb about them. I started this in Kindergarten and expect to do this all the way through high school. The finished version will be one of their graduation gifts. I canât wait to see the looks on their faces.

My son wanted a full Eagles uniform and gear for Christmas and of course, this is the best alternative to the real thing.The top and bottom are OK but the shoulder âpadsâ are tiny and the helmet is way too big. Heâs six so he doesnât care that much but over all, this kit could have been a tad better. Iâd gladly pay a more for bigger shoulder pads and additional padding to be added in the helmet. Lastly, we didnât bother ironing on the numbers but we did put the number stickers on his helmet.

Alright, I admit I'm too lazy to make animal cookies. After all, my kids will love cookies of any shape anyway!We do let the kids use cookie cutters for their Play-Doh, which work perfectly. In fact, we bought this along with small tubs of Play-Doh to give away as party favors (3 shapes and 3 mini-tubs fit nicely in a party favor bag).

Overall, the kids have a blast with it since they think they're helping. The reality is, even my oldest, who is 6, is making more of a mess than actually helping when I'm shoveling.At the end of the day, it's a nice play shovel. It's lightweight but if used on anything other than fluffy snow, I fear the plastic would crack since it does not feel durable. It gets 4 stars for being a decent, value toy.

I bought this for my daughter's 2nd birthday and she loves it! She's used to hand-me-down stuff from her older siblings so she's just starting to get her own toys. As soon as she tore off the wrapping paper, she lit up right away. And as soon as she got Minnie working, she said "Daddy, Minnie's talking to me!", which of course put a smile on my face for hours.Several months later, she still plays with this almost daily, which is saying a lot since my house looks like a daycare center! Got much more out of this than any other talking doll we have (e.g. we also have two Spider-man, a Hulk, and an Elmo).

I bought this so I can walk around with my SLR with more confidence. I have a Nikon D5100, a Tamron 18-270 lens, and a hand strap that adds height to the bottom of the camera. As a result, my day holster options are limited since I'm not using a kit lens and my camera is higher than norm.The measurements provided for this case are exact and my gear setup fits. It doesn't fit my camera perfectly (it's a little snug) but it's close enough. The pocket inside is pointless since anything you put in it will fall out. Not only will I use it to carry my camera with my shoulder strap, but I will also use it to store my camera in a carry-on when I travel instead bringing my entire camera bag.Overall, it's a well-made case that suits my needs.

I used to crawl around my flowerbeds using small hand tools to loosen weeds and pull them by hand. Some of these weeds were sharp (thistle) and had really deep roots. I got tired of the hours this would take so I looked around for a better solution.Glad to say that I found this Fiskars weed tool! It works as advertised. I simply step on the tool into the weed, tilt the handle toward me, and the weed pops out of the ground with its roots. No bending over (literally and figuratively) and no strength involved.Just a final note, you will still need to spray weed control. The tool is great for removing weeds but many will grow back quickly without spraying.

I've always been a Sennheiser fan but I also own about 20 different earbuds/headsets across 10 different brands. The quest for the perfect earbuds for running has ended. At the same time, the quests for the perfect earbuds for the plane, at work, and just about anything else have also ended. These MEElectronics M6 earbuds are amazing! After listening to them, I would pay $100 if that was the going price.PROS- Fits perfectly out of the box (six pairs of ear pieces to ensure find one that you can get a tight seal with)- Very good highs, mids, and lows -- if you can't hear/feel the bass, then try a different ear piece to get that seal- Amazingly comfortable even though this is deep in my ear canal- Does not move at all during running; I can turn my head, do jumping jacks, etc... they stay in place- Isolates from other noises -- no active noise cancelling but it will block noise, including your own voice when you speak- Cord management is well thought-out; not only does it have a clip but it also has tightener where the left/right wires come togetherCONS- Since a tight seal is necessary, I can hear the sound of the cords rubbing against my body when I'm running; in order to minimize that, I need to hang the cord in the front and not the backOVERALLI really wish I bought these sooner. I'm glad I found a set of earbuds that are no longer 'just good enough' but actually motivates me to put them on and go for a run! The best $20 I've ever spent.

I live in a suburban area so I know the range will likely be a few miles at most. I bought these to use around the house and pool and for those purposes these work great. These Midlands are probably a little overkill in features for what I need them for but I definitely wanted rechargeable batteries and some water resistance. Here's what I found after three months of use:PROS- Great reception (only used under 100 yards)- Been using it with wet hands around the pool with no problem- Battery life is excellent; will last for several weeks at a timeCONS- Battery indicator not accurate; will go from "full battery" picture to no life left within 5 seconds- Battery got loose once and would not power up; only worked again when I swapped batteries from one to the other (strange but I didn't have time to troubleshoot)OVERALL- Works great; hoping battery issues are simply annoying and won't impact long-term usage

I run about 20 miles a week and am always looking for a comfortable running shoe. The Saucony Grid Crossfire feels great and the mesh allows my feet to breathe. They are very soft all over yet incredibly light even thought it's not a minimalist shoe.The only thing to watch out for is that Saucony generally has a narrow toe box, the Grid Crossfire included. I needed to buy a half size up for them to fit comfortably.

I bought this bag to use for my pool toys (e.g. small floats, body boards). This works great for what I need it for. Seems very durable and the mesh is great for drying things out. Drawstring helps keep everything in too since it stays outside.Small pool toys still need to go in a plastic container since the bag is too big. Also, I wish there was a bigger version so I could put larger floats in it.

I bought this for my 5yo and although he can't fully read everything in this book yet, the picture clues can get him pretty close. This book is extremely colorful and incredibly comprehensive. This is an excellent supporting book to any Star Wars library.

Got this since my kids had trouble working the regular soap dispensers. They would bring the soap down to the floor in order to pump it. After a little research I settled on this simplehuman sensor pump and it works great. Here are my initial thoughts:PROS- Works flawlessly, no leaks- Looks elegant, neither cheap nor clunky- Almost silent operationCONS- Wish it also is available in brushed nickel in this size (8 oz)OVERALLI have no doubts that this is the best sensor soap pump in the market today. I'm going to be a few more for other areas of the house.

I've always used cheapie goggles since I assumed all goggles are close enough. Boy was I wrong!I just started training for a triathlon so I figured it's time to invest in something that may be better than what I've been using. After some research, I settled on these Aqua Sphere Kaiman goggles and these are amazing. Here are my thoughts:PROS- So comfortable!- Don't leak- Incredible visibility- Looks good on me ;)CONS- NoneOVERALLEven though these are under $20, I'm not sure how much better a goggle can get. I'm going to buy a few small sizes for my kids. Do yourself a favor and get a case for this too. I bought this Speedo Hard Goggle Case and it fits perfectly!

I wanted something that fit my Aqua Sphere Kaiman Swim Goggle and this case is perfect! Here are my thoughts:PROS- Fits my goggles like a glove- Two air holes on bottom help with draining/drying- Clip is helpful to hang outside of swim bagCONS- The zipper is OK but you pull the clip to use the zipper; doesn't seem like it would last- Advertised as a hard case but it's really just cardboard so your goggles can still get crushed in the wrong circumstancesOVERALLGlad I bought this and would definitely purchase again for another set of goggles in the future.

I genreally love AmazonBasics products but I regret buying this case. Although it provides adequate protection, it's just not a very efficient case. The main area for the camera feels somewhat snug but the front pocket, the top flap, and the sides are loose fitting and it makes the case feel really unnecessarily big.I'm sure I'll find a use for this someday (providing protection in a suitcase?) but I won't be using this as a carry-around case.
My boys love these shorts. I bought a couple pairs because it is so hard to find stars & stripes bathing suites. My son wears these every day to camp, they are holding up beautifully.

Fine Art Photography GuideThis book will give you the facts on how to earn art gallery representation. The author has interviewed numerous high level galleries. She presents the most common roads to success such as portfolio reviews. She also profiles several currently famous and gallery represented photographers and explains how they reached stardom.I learned so much by reading this book. For instance, one of the galleries said that some photographers are overdramatic when they show up with white gloves for their artwork. Fine art galleries know how to handle artwork, and donât need to be handed white gloves. I found that funny because I saw a famous fine art photographer do a presentation at Imaging USA, and he specifically recommended taking two sets of white gloves, one for the photographer and one for the curator. Myth officially debunked.I bought both the paperback and the Kindle version so I could easily reference it when traveling, but I also wanted a hard copy I could highlight and dog-ear. This is my new favorite reference book.It is also a great inspiration to get out of my comfort zone, try some of these approaches, build several bodies of work, and hopefully hang on the walls of the most beloved galleries.I will recommend it to all my photography guild friends.

This product caused me significant sinus and nasal inflammation and congestion. I took if for over a month before I figured out that it was the cause of my problems. I didnât put 2 & 2 together because we were traveling when my congestion started, plus my son had just had a cold and I thought it was environmental, or a simple cold. Once I stopped taking this supplement, my nasal and sinus congestion cleared up immediately. I switched to another companyâs Vitamin D3 with no unpleasant side effects. Look at the ingredients for this product carefully. If you do decide to take it, pay attention to any changes in your health.

This is without a doubt my favorite big camera bad. I've heard other photographers say "I've never met a camera bag I didn't like." Well I have, most of them as a matter of fact. I tried a less expensive brand once, and it wasn't worth the money I saved. This bag is sturdy, it can hold 2 camera bodies, several lenses, my speed light, and misc hard drives, and it's still okay to take as a carryon. It is wonderful!

My son absolutely loves his Pokewalker! It communicates with one of his 3Ds Pokemon games, and he never leaves the house without it. He keeps it inside of a Pikachu sweatband he wears on his wrist. Definitely one of his most loved toys.

I use this device to quickly transfer images between my computer & my iPhone. It isn't perfect, it's slow for instance, but it is faster than going to my tower that has iTunes and syncing, or e-mailing them to myself. I also use it as a quick way to give my boys friends images that I have taken of them. They just pop this device into their phone, download the app, and select which pictures they want. No more burning disks!I keep one at the office and one at home.

This book is so inspiring. Scott Kelby has the ability to make the complicated simple. In this book he used a formula that I love! Every two pages he starts with a behind the scenes shot, then he gives a brief description of where they are, sometimes why, and any light modifiers or other gear needed.Next paragraph he gives you his actual camera settings, even if they weren't ideal, and he explains why he selected them, including his lens.Next page he shows you the final image, which is absolutely beautiful, especially now that you've seen the behind the scenes shot.Third paragraph (of the 2 page spread) he tells you his thought process on the whole image and capture, like why he would put a second diffuser in front of a softbox.Fourth paragraph he touches on any special retouching.I'm going to take the hot-shoe chapter, and work through every example like a workbook. See if I can recreate the essence of what he's teaching but with my locations.He has a chapter on:* Natural light portraits* One light setups* Two or more lights* Hot-shoe flash* Weddings (ugh, not my thing but still worth reading and studying)* Travel* Landscapes & nature* Other stuff (like product photography)* Post productionHe is also a talented photographer himself. Now that may sound like a requirement to be a photography author, but it is not. Many writers have a lot of technical complicated knowledge, but no artistic vision. This writer has really studied the craft and acquired the skills both technical and has a photographers eye.He his hands down my favorite photography how-to author because he makes everything look easy, and I think to myself, "I can do that!" And you know what, I usually go out there and do get it right with his help.I have gone from a mom photographer to recently making the list of Top 10 Indiana Photographers, and I attribute a ton of my success to his books, seminars, and podcasts. Thank you Mr. Kelby!!!If you haven't read his other books, Scott Kelby's Digital Photography Boxed Set, Parts 1, 2, 3, and 4, Updated Edition, I recommend you do so. Whenever anyone asks me where to start, this is where I point them.

I thoroughly enjoyed reading this short story about the purpose of life! The mystical nature of it reminded me of The Alchemist.It starts with Davita realizing that, although she has died, her life is not really overâ¦yet. Simoni greets her and tells her she can choose between life and death, but she only has an hour to make her choice. Talk about pressure! Davita asks Simoni various questions about life, and I found myself wondering what I would want to know if I could have a Q&A session with an all-knowing being. That is one of the things I liked about the book; it makes you think about your own life.After Davita asks about things like happiness, religion, childhood, and other things she never completely figured out, she eventually asks about the purpose of life. After discovering her purpose and the five practices to help her fulfill that purpose, Davita is in a better position to make her decision. The story has an interesting twist near the end. I donât want to give anything away, but I will say that Simoni doesnât exactly make Davitaâs decision easy!

I invested in this memory card right before a big trip to Hawaii. It was so nice to look down and see there was plenty of memory on my card to take additional pictures. I did not want to be changing memory cards on the beach, or in a helicopter. I don't think I would have splurged under normal circumstances, but for this trip, my peace of mind was worth it.

My boys absolutely love Minecraft, and when this book arrived they were ecstatic! They dove into it right away. Yes, there were things they already knew, but there were some things they did not. I ended up buying copies for a couple of their closest Minecraft buddies.

This book was a quick read, and it follows the clean, concise, visual, to the point pattern set out in other NAPP (National Association of Photoshop Professionals) books. There are images to demonstrate practically everything he describes. His instructions are clear, and thankfully lack the ad nauseam detail that bores me to tears. He tells you what he's doing, and shows you, including before and after. That's what I need.While I found the whole book valuable, my two favorite chapters were Chapter 2, the 26 Piece Tool Set, and Chapter 7, A Dream Within a Dream. In Chapter 2 there is a subsection where he takes a plain brown graphic, sort of fleur de lis-ish, and with layer style turns it into a dramatic, metallic, three-dimensional image (without using real 3D techniques for CS5 Extended). It was a very impressive transformation.Chapter 7 is about 3D, which requires Adobe Photoshop Extended CS5, and given the fact it is written by Corey Barker, the Photoshop TV (podcast) 3D guy of course it's great. He explains in the book that he also has a video demonstrating the topic on-line; I personally like the print version. I've see him demo 3D numerous times on the podcast, and seeing it is print, where I can internalize at my speed what he is doing is more concrete. I can then refer to it when I'm actually in front of the computer, turning my company logo into a cool 3D image.He also utilizes the define brush command, which granted, I've done, but really rarely use. He refers to it a couple of times in the book, to again create these  3D type effects, (again without using real 3D techniques for CS5 Extended) like lightening, or a blood splat, and I think to myself, "Now how can I work in lightening?" Because it looks so great. From the Photoshop 3D guy, 3D effects without CS5 extended.

I just ordered my second copy of this book because I want to have one at work, and one at home. As I was reading it, I felt like I was highlighting every page. There was so much useful information, it was almost overwhelming. I could hardly wait to finish and get to my computer to try out my new skills.I have been using their complete collection, including the new Color Efex Pro 4, and was very happy with it. But now I know so much more about each program and the submenus. I also have a much better grasp of the control points, and when to use each program. It's so good, I (factiously) wish no one else would ever read it.Here are some examples of why it is so great from chapter 9 on Silver Efex Pro 2:* Find more Nik Software presets at [...]* The brightness control slider controls the overall brightness in the image, whereas the highlights, midtones, and shadows sliders only control the brightness in their respective tone range* Dynamic brightness (available only in Silver Efex Pro 2) uses software to decide how much brightness to apply to each area of the image, and can be less muddy, say than decreasing the brightness with the brightness slider* Soft contrast is another slider unique to Silver Efex Pro 2, and it seeks to "emulate the look and feel of film noir movies, with dark moody contrasts and soft transition."* Structure applies contrast only in areas of the image that are not an edge.* Selective colorization is also available only in Silver Efex Pro, and people tend to have strong opinions about its use, usually negative ones.* The color filters seek to emulate glass filters. Landscape and portrait photographers often use a red filter to "darken skies (which are actually cyan, not blue) and increase separation between the clouds and sky." The same filter also lightens the skin, and reduces appearance of blemishes.* The Color Sensitivity section allows you to further darken skies by reducing blue and cyan, and you can also target skin tones or any other color in your image* The Silver Hue and Strength sliders allow you to change what would be black to a specific color. They are called that because the replace silver from the film days.* The Vignette and Burn Edges both darken the edges, but the Burn Edges is preferable if you have some edges you would like to darken more than others.* In the Loup and Histogram section is the Zone System Map, based on the work pioneered by Ansel Adams. Hovering over one of the 11 zones causes color hatch mark on the image so you can see which sections of your image are in that zone. Zones 0 and 10 are pure black and pure white respectively.* The History Browser is also exclusive to Silver Efex Pro and relatively newAnyone that uses Nik software absolutely must have this book. And of course, if you don't already have Nik Software Creative Efex Bundle Consists of HDR Efex Pro ,Color Efex Pro 3.0 and Silver Efex Pro 2 - FREE UPGRADE TO COLOR EFEX PRO 4.0 this is a must have for the serious photographer

This is a very well done, visual, and detailed, book. He shows and tells everything. There are photos for every aspect of the shot, from every angle, including from the ceiling looking down, so you can really envision how the set was constructed, how close the lights were to the model and each other.He shows you the back of the camera, his exact settings including: aperture priority, ISO, f-stop, shutter speed, lens and focal length. He explains, and shows you where he focused his lights, what light modifiers he used, his power settings, and how to adapt that to your lights.On the retouching, he takes you step-by-step through the camera raw and photo process. Each step is accompanied by a supporting photo of the screen, I would say screen grab, but it looks to be higher quality. He includes keyboard shortcuts and explains why he is making a particular adjustment. For instance, he takes the recovery slider to the point where the model's face is properly exposed, but doesn't worry about the reflection on metal, or the light bulbs being blown out.He demonstrates many different photographic/ lighting looks, and they are all very different:* A classic high key beauty shot* An edgy rock-n-roll shot, this one had some cool photoshop techniques I hadn't seen, and am looking forward to trying* A dramatic beauty shot, with lots of contrast and shadows* Three light lens flare. I would call this one a slightly over-exposed with cool image in sunglasses shot.* Ring light with another cool sunglasses effect* 3-light sports setup (masculine edgy lighting)* 1-light full-length fashion shot, to name just a fewI like the fact that he explains how you can do this without spending a fortune, and that he includes several male shots, and doesn't limit himself to just polished female model beauty shots.He even includes a separate chapter where he explains how to do all the exact same shots with speedlights.He includes a gear guide that shows the exact tools he used in the book with pictures and descriptions, right up to the adapter rings and transmitters.Kelby salts the book with his usual off the cuff humor, which I enjoy. The book, amazingly, moves very quickly, is an easy read, and will be an excellent reference book. He has the uncanny ability to make everything seem easy. And, if you follow his instructions, it probably will be.

Our boys were so excited when these cases arrived just before our big trip to Europe. They scooted all around the house on them, and were also enthusiastic to pack their treasures for themselves. On the aircraft, they fit easily under the seat in front of us, or in the overhead storage area.The only thing I'm not so excited about is the latches on the side. My husband and I both found them difficult to use, and determine if they were locked on unlocked. But I would say the fact that the children love them so much greatly outweighs that negative.

I know these memory cards are expensive, but memory cards are not an area where I am willing to cut corners. I need my camera to be fast for numerous reasons. When I shoot HDR, I'm really testing the buffer. Or when I'm shooting an event, I do not want my buffer to get full and prevent me from getting that great shot. I am super careful about making sure I've downloaded my images so that I don't accidentally format I card with data on it, and that does require an extra set of cards. I invested in one of those digital suitcases to hold my images, and I just haven't become comfortable with it yet. I trust my memory cards more.Bottom line, my images are worth the investment in awesome memory cards.

This book came Highly Recommended by my photography mentor. As a photographer, we look for people like us to be assistants and photo editors. Well the person you need sitting behind the computer all day is not the same type of personality as you need behind the camera going out in the world and connecting with people. If a person is happy sitting behind a computer all day, you need someone who doesn't require constant human contact. Big difference from the extroverted photographers I know.This book reminds me of the carpenter's moto, measure twice, cut once. The book's point is figure out what the job description is, in detail, spend you time finding the right person, so you don't have to fire them. Get the right person in the beginning.There are forms on the disk, and that is actually why I didn't give it 5 stars, I think including them on the disk is a plus, but I would have liked to have seen them in the book too, so that I didn't have to go to my computer (which I spend wayyyyy too much time on anyway), and I could continue reading the book in bed. Then, later I could download the forms.Other than that, I thought the book had a great message, and material to support you search for the best employee possible.

When I first saw this 3TB hard drive at the Apple store I was so excited! A complete nerd moment, and then when I found it here on Amazon I was even happier.I've tried the 3TB Western Digital, and the 3 TB Passport, and I really dislike them both. They cause problems at boot-up, so I have to remember to unplug them before I turn my computer on, and then plug them back in after I boot up. They disconnect all the time, and I haven't even touched them, it drives me insane! I am neurotic about backing up, I even rotate my backups off-site. With my previous backups, I was really nervous moving them because the boxes say they shouldn't be used as a portable hard drive. When I asked about that at the store the gentleman said the disks move even when they aren't plugged in, great, so how are you supposed to rotate them, and get them off-site?Well you don't have to worry about that with this hard drive. It has never caused my computer to lock-up when I boot-up, it has never dismounted, and I feel safe rotating it to my off-site back up. I love this hard-drive!

I love this book. Combining images, and making it look believable is hard, tedious work. In this book Matt Kloskowski lays out exactly how he does it, and actually makes it sound easy, hopefully I'll get to the point where it is.Some of it was familiar from watching Photoshop User TV, but much of it was new. In one example he explained how he kept track (on his phone) his lens, and focal length, distance from the subject, and how high the camera was from the ground when he photographed his main subject. He then replicated all of this when he photographed the background so the subject would look right when put in that atmosphere.He covers the shadows (super important to making it look real), the filters, the clipping masks, layer blend modes, and a couple of ways to get rid of that nasty fringe quickly to name just a few of his helpful tips. This is a book that I will keep right next to my computer and refer to any time I am doing a composite.If you like this book, I also recommend his earlier book Layers: The Complete Guide to Photoshop's Most Powerful Feature (2nd Edition) which was absolutely wonderful!

I love this program. If you are new to HDR, I recommend you read The HDR Book: Unlocking the Pros' Hottest Post-Processing Techniques. In the book, RC discussed three software programs to create HDR images, and explains that the Nik version is his favorite. I agree! I've tried using Photoshop to do HDR, and Nik does an immensely better job.The program comes with presets that you will see on the left hand side. They are a great starting point. If they need adjusting, you can fine tune with the sliders on the right, in particular I go to method and strength.I've read on Flickr that HDR is addictive and I totally agree. With it you can get images that you just can't get in any other way, at least not without spending days in the digital dark room doing tons of complicated masking.If you like this program, I also recommend Nik Software Color Efex Pro 2.0 Standard Edition, 19 Filters, Plug-in Software for Macintosh & Windows. Free upgrade to Color Efex Pro 3.0 Standar which I use all the time. I in particular like the filters Tonal Contrast, and Sunshine. Nik has a podcast which I also like, it will give you some good ideas, inspire you, and lead you to some great artists.
1:08 MinsThis is a brief video showing you our Lego Lightening McQueen, and another set LEGO Cars Tokyo Pit Stop 8206. They are both easy to assemble, and my son loves them!

I have been wanting to do a good candida cleanse for a while now so when I had the opportunity to review this product I jumped at the chance. I was a bit afraid that I would have stomach cramping and pain but I am glad to report that there has been no pain while doing my cleanse with this product. My energy levels are higher and I sleep better as well.  I received this product for purposes of my honest and unbiased review.
I am getting married in Feb. and I am so excited that these were provided to me. I am looking forward to sticking them on the bottom of my shoes and wearing them for our wedding in the garden.

I really wanted to change my lifestyle as I have become lazy in my diet. I have gained about 10 lbs and wanted to start my lifestyle change by doing a good colon cleanse. This is a very comfortable chin strap. It fits easily on the face and I really like the slots for the ears to comfortable fit through. My only issue with this product is that it has a terrible smell! We had to hand wash it 2x before we could get the smell out of the material. The large strip of Velcro keeps the strap from coming undone while sleeping. The material is absorbing and soft with extra padding placed on the chin portion of the strap. This product was received for the purpose of inspection and for an unbiased review.

My son has joined a scouting troop this year and he had to have rain gear for their camping trips. This is nice and large and fits him well. I like how long it is too. It is well made and although it wont last forever it will work for a while. I received this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I feel so much stronger with Carnitine after my workout. I can tell that they work very well and are easy to swallow. They don't upset my stomach at all. This product helps me to recover faster as well.  I received this item in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

As I have gotten older my knees have started to make noises when i go up and down the stairs. I am thankful for this strap. This is a very comfortable chin strap. It fits easily on the face and I really like the slots for the ears to comfortable fit through. My only issue with this product is that it has a terrible smell! Having a mosquito net for the stroller is very important when you live in the north. The mosquito's here are like birds and they are like vultures for blood. I gave this to my boyfriend for a gift and he really likes it. He used it and loved it. I like how easy it is to use it and that it is easily washable. It is a unique gift for a man. They arent always easy to shop for but this was perfect. I received this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

It is easy to apply and begins to work very quickly. It also does not irritate my eyes.  It is really high quality and i like how easily the serum goes on with the wand. SO PRETTY! My boyfriend and I are celebrating our 1 year together and I bought a new dress and shoes. I wanted a simple yet stunning pair of earrings to go along with the dress and these were perfect! I love them. They are comfortable. They are so glitzy and glamorous without the expensive price tag. This is a great, high quality Tribulus product. It really does help to boost workout energy and increases the effectiveness of my workouts.  I love how the bottle looks and how easy the capsules are to swallow. I am prone to UTI's and have been told that tribulus can help with reduce them. I look forward to continuing my workouts with the extra energy that tribulus gives me. I received this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

My dad is older and he has been getting horrible white flakes on his eyebrows. It is gross. I wanted to moisturize and prevent those nasty flakes and I read that black castor oil can help and be safe while treating it. These K-cups are great. The fit perfectly and I love that I can use my own coffee in the morning. It is way less expensive to use my own purchased coffee then it is to use the premade k-cups. I received this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I make my own lotions and lip balms. I wanted to add grapefruit seed oil to my potions in order to increase moisture and exfoliation. This is a great bottle. Very well made and solid. The brown glass is very natural. The spray works awesome. I use it in my bathroom for the cleaning items that I made from scratch for my home. I received this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Well built and sturdy. Great casing. Good clear view through the view finder. Easy to mount and simple to use. I received this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Garcinia Cambogia really is the key to fast weight loss! It works effectively to block fat production. My mother has lost 3 inches using garcinia and she is post menopausal which makes weight loss very difficult! This great product is totally natural without fillers and chemicals. The capsules are vegetarian as well which I really like since I try to eat a vegetarian diet. This product works well and is easy to swallow. I could smell the scent before opening up the box.  Have purchased these with the handles before; not the rolls.  I like these bags because they are thick enough that you won't put a fingernail through when you pick up the warm poop.  Price is not a steal, but reasonable.

I purchased this exact leash in turquoise/grey from a local Home Goods store.  I can say that I've had it for about 6 months now, and am ready to replace.  Why?  If you wash it, it gets a little eaten up.  Also, it stretches out after a few months of use.  So mine is now twice as long as it was before.  I still use it, but looking for another one that will hold up better and look newer.

Bought this for my Dragon E70 tablet.  Fits like a glove.  Clicks in place. Camera visible with no blockage.  Gorgeous light blue/green color.  The folding/stand actually works; unlike some other covers.  Could not be happier.

I really need another pair of shoes to walk my pooch and I thought this was it.  It's not.  I received today and was so excited to try them on.  They were packaged nicely and look/feel expensive.  However, I have wide feet and the shoe cuts into the top of my foot, while at the same time "pouching out" at the sides.I am keeping because I am tired of returning shoes.  I will bring to the shoe repair and see if they can stretch them at the top without stretching out the sides.I have to say that the sole of my feet felt tremendous; very comfy and cushy with arch support.  But that doesn't matter if the top of your feet are in pain.

I bought this to replace an ASUS Fonepad that had too many issues after only 5 months.  I've had this for a few days; charged it for 10 hours before using, as per instructions.  Here are my pros and cons so far.PROS:PriceEasy to set up and figure outEasy Access to Play StoreSimilar settings as other tablets so easy to useDual SIMReboot FeatureQuick startFlash for Camera (I downloaded FLASHLIGHT app and I can now use flash as flashlight)FM Radio (wish they had AM as well)CONS:Audio could be betterCamera Zoom degrades the image so much that it looks washed out, grainyCan't see screen outside - too much glare (may be issue with all screens?)Manual does not tell you how to insert SIM or SD cardOnly Uses Large SIM Cards - not micro one
As described.  About 1 3/4" in length.  Took way too long to get, so be sure to ask about estimate before ordering.

These shoes are so pretty.  Excellent construction.  Perfect heel height.  High quality.  So why did I return?  I purchased the 10M.  I have wide feet.  These shoes were way too narrow for me.  I had to use a finger as a shoe horn in order to get the front of the shoes on without it folding, causing even greater discomfort.The inside of the shoe is cushioned and extremely comfortable.  If the shoe was wider, I would have kept.  But no way would I keep a pair of shoes "hoping" they will stretch and not kill my feet.

Seriously, $100 for a bag of raw dog food?I purchased the PORK variety in the 2lb version from Global Pet in Culver City for $30.  I was hesitant to spend so much.  But the 2lb bag gives you about 6lb of food after rehydration.You have to plan ahead to  feed this to your dog.  It takes equal parts food and water.  After that you need to let it sit and soak for 20 minutes before serving.THE TASTE: My pooch didn't go nuts over it, but it was new to him.  After about 15 minutes, he ate it.  So I'm satisfied.  I alternate between this and a few varieties of Stella and Chewy's.THE LOOK OF IT:  Looks pretty good.  You see the chunks of meat, veggies and feel like you are giving your dog something healthy.INGREDIENTS:  Has about the same types of ingredients as Stella and Chewy's.  It is also made in the USA.  I'm going to check to see if it is sourced here as well.

But the 2lb bag gives you about 6lb of food after rehydration.You have to plan ahead to  feed this to your dog.  It takes equal parts food and water.  After that you need to let it sit and soak for 20 minutes before serving.THE TASTE: My pooch didn't go nuts over it, but it was new to him.  After about 15 minutes, he ate it.  So I'm satisfied.  I alternate between this and a few varieties of Stella and Chewy's.THE LOOK OF IT:  Looks pretty good.  You see the chunks of meat, veggies and feel like you are giving your dog something healthy.INGREDIENTS:  Has about the same types of ingredients as Stella and Chewy's.  It is also made in the USA.  I'm going to check to see if it is sourced here as well.

Purchased from another website.  I wish I would have paid more attention to the window that exposes the food.  I assumed that there would be chunks of meat and veggies.  But all you'll receive is POWDER.  My dog ate it after I added water to it, but only after figuring out nothing else was coming.  Then early morning he pooped in the house!  Mind you, he has NEVER done this before.  It was such a big pile I was shocked.  With raw food, his poops are the size of 2-3 tablespoons full, not a cup full like this.  That tells me that his body does not recognize this as "raw."The website I purchased this from said they take refunds, but ignored my email request for a RMA number.  I then contacted the Addiction company  on their website and asked about a satisfaction guarantee, or refund.  They IGNORED my email as well.A company that supposedly cares what they feed your dog but ignores their customers, tells me not to trust their product.

Just received yesterday and connected.  Because I have an older TV without an HDMI input, I chose this model.  Connection was simple.  Only issue is that my TV/monitor has only one yellow input and it is taken by my cable box.  This comes with a red, white, yellow cord.  I plugged the yellow into a green socket because that is all I have.  The screen  is grainy and black and white; but I can view.  If I remove my cable box cord and plug into the yellow input, then it is in color, but no volume.  I'll have to figure this out.

The cap is stretchable and looks like fishnet stockings.  Received two for the price.  The elastic band fits nicely around the head and fits snuggly.  The only issue I have is that it is made for a person with thick hair.  If you don't have it, you will have extra cap at the crown of your head.  It's a little hard to describe, but it's enough to put a rubber band around.  So in other words, it will not lay flat on the top of your head.  Even putting on a wig head, the extra material is there - - so the picture shown on the package is misleading.

I wanted to give my dog a variety of raw foods.  THIS IS NOT THE SAME AS RAW.  How do I know this?  When you feed your dog raw, the body uses most of that food.  The waste that comes out is very minimum, no matter the size of the dog.  I am used to picking up about 2-3 tablespoons full of waste when my dog poops.  Also, the smell is not as strong with real raw.I mixed this with warm water, then warm goats milk.  My dog did not want either.  But finally, around midnight, when he realized he was not getting anything else, he ate this.  I woke up to a PILE OF POOP in the kitchen.  Now mind you, my dog has NEVER pooped in the house.  From day one when I got him from animal control; not a single poop in the house ... now this.Real raw does not react this way.  This brand has been pulverized to DUST and is unappetizing to a dog who is used to real raw food.  There are NO CHUNKS OF MEAT, NO BITS OF VEGGIES ... simply dust.Hoping I can return.  Purchased outside of Amazon.

I am hoping that my pooch will come to like this, as it was an expensive purchase.  I bought from another website.  Surprised that it was mostly crumbs; with very few chunks.  My dog is used to raw, but the texture is so unappetizing.  It suggests you mix with equal parts warm water.  I tried that and also used warm goats milk; as my dog has stomach issues.  He justs sniffs the food and walks away. I leave it in the dish and he nibbles on it when he gets so hungry he'll eat anything. I even put in a Stella and Chewy patty, breaking it up and mixing it in.  He sifts through Addiction and eats the Stella pieces.I am hoping that things change, but not expecting it to.I wonder if the company takes returns, as I did not buy on Amazon.

Purchased for my new Canon Pixma MG5600. It was the closest one I could find in dimensions.  However, like all the other covers, it is way too tall.  It rises about 10-12" when my printer is only 6" tall.  I know it's only plastic and I can cut it.  But I would lose the blue finishing along the edges by doing so.  That would also look tacky.Why in the heck won't these companies make covers for modern printers? All the covers are for behemoth laser printers of the 90's.  No one has a printer that is 12-16" tall any more; unless you have one for a large company.  But Amazon is for individuals.  This should not be too much to ask.

Do not buy if you are looking to make your own wigs using a crochet hook.  The netting is NOT mesh, so you struggle to get the crochet hook through.  It snags, splits.  In other words, had to toss.  This will work as just a head wrap if you are looking to keep your hair down while under a protective style or wig.  Otherwise, skip it.

Just used to wash my pooch in the kitchen sink. Had a bit of a problem attaching the plastic piece to the metal one.  But finally did. Will not look forward to disconnecting and reattaching again. I love the blue switch to turn the water off and on. The flow of water is also acceptable.  No leaks or squirts coming from the attachments.  Makes bath time so much easier.  Bought a cheaper hose on Amazon for around $7, but had to toss as the rubber connector was too small for a standard USA sink.Note: instructions mention 2 size washers when it only comes with one. But you only need one. Also, remember to shut the water off at the source before disconnecting the hose!>>> Also, the other reviewer was correct.  When you shut off the water with the blue flip, then turn back on; the water temperature changes.  Mine went from warm to cold.  My dog wanted to jump out of the sink.  So now I test on my hand first and wait for it to get warm before using on my dog.
It's a styro head.  What can I say? Use it to hold a few of my hats.  Lightweight.  Arrived in great condition; packaged in bubble wrap.  Stands erect without a slant.  Holds about 4 of my caps/hats.

Not expecting it to be such a LARGE/THICK book.  About 2 1/4" thick; around 9x12 in length/height.  Just thought you might want to know how substantial it is.  As far as the information inside ... very interesting reading and the layout makes for easy access to all the information.  I purchased for research, but find it also an entertaining read.  Describes the criminal from what they looked like, when born/died, what their crimes were ... then goes into more details about how they got started and further crimes committed.  Love this book.

I purchased this to make a custom hairpiece for special occasions.  Just get a weave cap, hair, pull through the latch hook and tighten.  Works exactly as I expected it would and how it is demonstrated in youtube videos.  I DID NOT get an extra needle as pictured.

UPDATE: The scroll mechanism has broken and cannot be fixed.  It refuses to scroll after one month of use.  I am returning to Amazon and buying another brand.---------------------Very odd shaped mouse.  Only purchased because I needed to replace a functioning mouse that had "click" issues.  I have a mouse pad that has a gelled wrist  support, and this works well with it.  I rest my wrist on the gelled support and my hand naturally wraps around the mouse.It may take a few days to get used to.  The right-clicking feature is a bit awkward, but functions.  And yes, you do have to apply a bit more pressure to click, than other mouses.  But I like it.  So far so good.I use with my MacBook Pro.

I purchased this from another website for a better price.  This is the first time I have fed my dog an Addiction food.  He usually eats Stella & Chewy, Raw Meat and sometimes Primal raw.I did not know what to expect with this food; if he would eat it or not.  I do not mix with other food and DO NOT ADD HOT WATER!  That totally defeats the benefits of raw.He wasn't sure at first because it's consistency is different than what he's used to, but gradually came to like it.  I rotate it with the other raw foods.  My pooch has inactive stomach, so getting him something he will eat and enjoy is important.

Received a few days ago.  Love the white printer for a change.Setup was okay; not overly complicated, but a bit of questions did arise.  Trying to do a test print, I kept getting the ERROR about Printer tray not open; or something like that.  That was so frustrating as I had the paper loaded, aligned properly, yet still the error!  I finally figured out that I needed to flip down the slider which catches the printed page.  Finally it worked!I have a MacBook Pro and did not use the CD to install.  I manually connected the wifi.PRINT QUALITY: I have only used regular paper to print black and white and color images.  The color images are okay.  Nothing special or stunning.  Perhaps if I play with it and adjust printing quality and us photo paper; I'll probably get a better print.The black and white text print is a bit light; but readable.I have not used the cloud printing or scanning yet.  I do scan allot and hope it works easily.

So excited to receive this as I chipped a front, lower tooth (inside of the tooth, not outside) and needed a temporary solution until I can get an appointment with my dentist.Perhaps if you have a missing filling, this will do the trick.  But for my purposes; it did not hold up.  My lower front tooth (flat ones) got chipped in the inside.  I rolled up a little bit of this as per instructions (which I had to read with a powerful magnifying glass as the print is probably a 1 font!) pushed it in the tooth; patted down with a damp q-tip, then went to bed.  It says you should not eat for 2-3 hours; so doing it just before bedtime gave it 8 hours to harden.When I awoke and brushed my tooth gently with an electric toothbrush, IT CAME OUT.  Even if I used a hand brush, I believe I would have had the same result.I replaced it the next night and avoided the tooth with the brush, but some of the material has loosened after eating.Maybe this was not made for my particular type of chip.  You may have better results if it is for a missing filling.

These are the first perm rollers that I have purchased.  Love the stretch cord that snugly hold the hair.  I received 48 (I believe) for one small, fabulous price.  May order in a larger roll size in the future.  These are sturdy and will hold up.

I've purchased this brand before from Target.  I thought I was ordering the same sized one.  I usually get the 8 1/2x11 size as I'm old-school and prefer to write my appointments, TO DO WORK LIST, than type in a phone.When I received this I was shocked to see that it was quite smaller than expected.  This is 6x8.  Must have missed that in the description?  In any case, I'm using it (writing smaller) .  This will work fine.

This movie had to be made.  We are all colors of the rainbow when it comes to black and brown skin.  My darker skinned younger sister has always had a rougher time than me; always wondering if it had to do with her darker complexion.  I believe that is part of it.Thank God for Lupita  N'yong' for showing an intense beauty both skin deep and from inside.  Too bad she is an anomaly.This movie encapsulated all the tears, pain, ups and downs of darker-skinned women.  Highly recommend.

I had these heater for a year.  Have no idea where it went.  I purge many items every time I move, so this may have been a casualty.  Too bad as I now have to buy another one.  It heats up my combo living room-dining room quite nicely.  Also like the sound it makes; helps me fall asleep.I am trying to remember if it lasted over a year.  I believe so.  But that would be it.  Not a long-lasting heater you can pass down to other family members.  But for it's short life expectancy; it works well.

I purchased mine as soon as the upgrade was released; sometime late 2012, early 2013.  At first I loved it.  It could do no wrong.  Used it for home business as well as writing assignments.Wanted something I could travel with.  So that left out the iMac.  I bought this, attached it to a large monitor, and I now had the best of both worlds.PROS:Allot of slots to attach accessories to (I attach external speaker, monitor, hard drive)thunderboltNot too heavy to carry aroundCame with quite a bit of s-wareSharp screenCONS:After a few years, crashes or freezes quite a bit.  Have to power off, back on.Audio isn't as loud as I'd like it to be; especially if you are watching a movieMac Mail program a bit annoying with messages about certificates when you are downloading - despite fixing previouslyNo longer impenetrable to hackers.  Actually got a virus just from downloading (not opening) an email

I've had this machine for about a year and a half.  Paid under $80 for it at local supply store.  I run a home business and print allot of documents.  This machine has held up well until now.  The wifi connector is straightforward.  It is small and compact; which I need with limited space.  I take photos from my camera's SD card, then place in the slot.  Finds it right away on my Mac.  Simply drag and drop images to my desktop.However, there are a few negatives ...It does not take generic brand ink cartridges.  I have had to toss some cartridges because they were not recognized.  Also, I'm now getting an error message that comes up when I want to print a b&w document that says "Need to load paper," when in fact it has plenty of paper.  Also the color feature stopped working.  I recalibrated, cleaned the nozzles, fresh color cartridges; yet all my images come out RED.Very frustrating.  Going to toss.

I am someone who tends to run dry -- my eyes and nose particularly at night become quite dry and I'm rather uncomfortable in the morning.  I've found that running a humidifier at night really helps decrease my discomfort.I've been using humidifiers for a long time.  For such simple technology it is astounding how they have evolved.  Yet again I am surprised at how quite this one is.  The motor has a very soft low frequency hum.  Unlike other humidifiers I have owned this one does not gurgle as much (might be in part due to the instructions reminding me to put water in the base to avoid air bubbles).The tank is large enough that I only need to change it about once a week (in general I have it on low all day long).

Phone case with a place to stash a card or ID.  A good solution for when wanting to travel light.  As a general place to keep a credit card I'm not so sure about it...  However for those times when wanting a few items as possible it is an inventive idea  without adding any extra bulk to the case.The case itself is stylish and does appear to add the protection from nicks and scratches.  I love the BOLD color.  Phone stand out in the bottom of my purse or on my cluttered desk.

This is a CASE!.  My husband got an OtterBox case similar to this for his Galaxy S5 about 2 years ago and has love this.  Now that we are moving to the Note 5 he is thrilled to have a case like this.  For such a large phone this case definitely adds extra bulk however;  he likes the extra protection this case give to his phone he also likes the fact that the case and the screen protector are integratedWhile he does not use the holster often it is a nice feature that can easily clip on when wanting to use it.  And easy to toss in the glove box when it is not needed.  .

This is an excellent low profile case for a phone that has more than enough bulk. My phone typically is either in my purse, on my desk, or somewhere in the house.  I don't need a whole lot of protection for my phone so this is an excellent case for me.  Adds extra protection but does not add excess bulk.  My husband who is often on worksites or out and about (golfing, camping, hiking, etc)  needs more protection and is willing to have the extra bulk a case like Otter Box offers.  But for me this Verus case is perfect

I'm impressed.  As someone who sometimes has sensitive information on my phone this is another layer of precaution I can take to help protect the information I access.Did not have as much problems with air bubbles as I have with other screen protectors (I suspect this is due to the thickness of this protector.Even though it is definitely thicker than a traditional screen protector does not impact the touch functionality of the phone.

Not all coughs need Western medicine yet some may still need some soothing...  When given the option I prefer to first use homeopathic remedies such as this for day to day minor symptoms.  While I do like that this is a homeopathic product what I like even more is what is not in it -- Sugars, dyes or artificial flavors.  Also since it does not contain many common western  medicines I feel safe switching (or ADDING)  a "traditional" medicine if needed.

When given the option I prefer to first use homeopathic remedies such as this for day to day allergy symptoms.  While I do like that this is a homeopathic product what I like even more is what is not in it -- Sugars, dyes or artificial flavors. âWhen the chronicler Matthew Paris reflected on the fate of Johnâs soul twenty years after his death, he famously declared that âEngland reeks with Johnâs filthy deeds; the foulness of Hell is defiled by John.âââNo clause of the charter mentions or was intended to promote anything that we would today consider âdemocraticâ; indeed, the idea of democracy was alien and would quite possibly have been offensive to the wealthy, oligarchical, and largely  self- interested barons who opposed King John in 1215. ââMagna Cartaâ by Dan Jones continues his stories on the Plantagenets with this non- fiction book on King John and the Magna Carta. Mr. Jones writes in a way that immerses you into the past and makes it come alive.Even though the Magna Carta is looked up to around the world as a tool of democracy, Mr. Jones points out that it was not that way at all. It was so the rich barons and the church would not have to pay exorbitant taxes to the monarch.Another great tidbit I learned is that the original Magna Carta was not successful and King John after being forced to sign it continued his war with the Barons. The Pope at the time Innocent, condemned it. The barons decided the French King Louis would be a better King and joined him in trying to take over the country. King John died before the war ended and his young son took over as Henry III.  William Marshall took over as regent and was able to get the barons back on the young kingâs side. I think William Marshall was the real hero of this book and one who was steadfast in his support.I really enjoyed this book about King John and his reign. There is a lot of pre-John information and loads of stories on the Magna Carta today around the world.I recommend this book to anyone who loves history and the true stories of  governments and how they evolved.I received this book from the Penguin First to Read program for an honest review.

âWe all make mistakes, but starting the Third World War would have been a rather large one. To this day, I still maintain it was not entirely my fault. But Iâm getting ahead of myself.âI have never read any of Frederick Forsythâs books but I think I have seen all the movies based on them. Having read this delightful biography I have started searching for his books to read.Mr. Forsyth has lived a life that is exciting and intriguing. The adventures he admits to and the people he has met in his life make me wonder if being a journalist was a cover for some Intelligence work. I wouldnât be surprised at all.He came from a middle class family, but his parentâs wanted him to have a well rounded education so as a boy he was sent to France to stay with a friend. By the time he got back he was able to speak fluent French and not the French taught in schools. He knew the slang and this was able to help him when he joined the RAF as the youngest pilot at age 19.He participated in wars, espionage and journalism. When he decided he really wanted to be his own man, he proposed writing a book, which became âThe Day of the Jackalâ. The publisher liked his manuscript and signed him for three more books. The rest is history.I enjoyed his story very much and found him to be self-depreciating and full of humorous stories of his own foibles in this world. Itâs refreshing to read a biography that isnât written as a canonization attempt.I highly recommend âThe Outsiderâ by Frederick Forsyth to anyone who enjoys his books and to anyone who loves a good biography warts and all.I received this book as part of the Penguin Books First to Read program.

âAlong the way, Iâll hope to convince you of a simple claim: in an increasingly complex, unpredictable world, what matters most isnât IQ, willpower, or confidence in what we know. Itâs how we deal with what we donât understand.ââBelief,â Flannery OâConnor once wrote, âis the engine that makes perception operate.âThe premise of this book is that while having knowledge and ability are important the most important thing is to have a thirst for more information. We must never think we know it all or we are a dead race. We must continue to strive and hunger for more breakthroughs in science, humanity and even political thinking.Just because it seems that we are doomed to repeat history doesnât mean that eventually real change can occur.I especially enjoyed the chapter on the Hand to Hand schools in Israel. There are several branches and these schools strive for diversity. They have Jews and Arabs enrolled and the students are taught Hebrew and Arabic. In a country where marrying outside your religion is not allowed this is a remarkable school.I also liked the story about Chekhov who wanted you to imagine your own endings to his stories because that is what he was trying to do. Broaden your outlook and you will continue to grow all your life.The author writes engagingly and what I was afraid would turn out to be a dry story instead got me thinking and agreeing with him along the way.I enjoyed this book and recommend it to anyone who thinks we know all we will know, or who simply wants to learn all they can. In other words, everyone will benefit.I received an advanced copy from the First to Read program from Penguin books for an honest review.

âI sincerely believeâ¦that banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies.â Thomas JeffersonThe above quotes show why it took so long for America to have a central banking system. No one wanted to tackle the problem and this book explains the reasons behind the establishment of a banking system that would regulate and establish rules for printing money and creating credit.This is a very dry book and I found it hard to follow sometimes, but I also understand that the Federal Reserve does work and we need it to continue to be a world power and a nation that other nations look up to.This book is great for anyone interested in the history of the banking industry especially the governmentâs involvement in it. I was amazed that we had such a mickey mouse system for so many years. The Federal Reserve did not come into being until 1913. Before that, the government was run haphazardly and there were many financial panics many times saved by J.P. Morgan.There has never been a love of the banking system and many people fear them. I believe they are a necessary evil.I received this book from the Penguin First to Read Program for an honest review.

Rape. Execution. Blackmail. Prostitution. Comedy, thy name is Shakespeare!William Shakespeare's late-period comedy, written and staged around 1604, presents serious themes under the flimsiest gauze of humor, yet the humor oddly finds way of prevailing. With its themes of political corruption and sexual desire, "Measure For Measure" has a decidedly modern quality to it that gives the play more resonance today than it perhaps had when Shakespeare first wrote it.In Vienna, a duke of a decidedly pious bent leaves his city in the hands of a zealous lieutenant, Angelo. Angelo decides it's good to be duke, not only when passing death sentences to punish non-marital relations that offend his morality, but when offering clemency to the virgin sister of one of those criminals in exchange for a night of sin. Isabella must decide what is more precious, her brother's life or her own soul? And who is this strange friar with all the questions?Actually, you know pretty early on that the friar is the duke in disguise, perhaps the only card in this particular deck Shakespeare reveals early on. Most of the time, "Measure For Measure" has a way of surprising you, both with its sharp humor and uncomfortable subject matter. Take this reflection on the nature of death:"Thy best of rest is sleep,And that thou oft provok'st; yet grossly fear'st/Thy death, which is no more. Thou art not thyself;For thou exists on many a thousand grains/That issue out of dust. (III.i.17-20)Funny? No, unless you think of the context, which is a pretend holy man offering what he imagines is succor to a condemned man, in which case it is pretty funny, in a black-humored way. "Measure For Measure" has a lot of black humor, and even more context-driven humor, as when we watch the Duke in his disguise hear himself described as a lech by a nobleman who can't stop himself from talking until it's well past too late.The main focus of the story, on Isabella and her devil's bargain with Angelo, is less a comedy than a satisfying dramatic treatment of true faith coming into conflict with false piety, with a good deal of exploration on the subject of love as grace or folly. One way "Measure For Measure" is a modern play is the way it plays this matter as ambiguously as it does, with no clear answers given, however satisfying many (including me) find the ending to be.My Signet edition comes with a useful if tendentious essay by G. Wilson Knight on "Measure For Measure's" Christian message, one I would agree with more if Knight didn't see the Duke as so much of a God figure. The themes of forgiveness and mercy certainly derive from the Gospels (where the title comes from), but the play is at times too dark and at others too determinedly silly to bear this point too strongly.I found it a great play, enjoyable as a comedy and gripping as a story, with some of Shakespeare's finest lines. It may be known best today for its title, but take it from me, there's a great deal more going on here than what's on the cover.

The usual Edgar Rice Burroughs formula of solitary men carving a path through an exotic location is in play in this satisfying fantasy-adventure set in ancient Cambodia.Gordon King is a young American doctor who comes to the Cambodian jungle in search of exotic illnesses to cure. King suffers himself from wanderlust; trekking deep into the jungle, disregarding the warnings of his guide, he finds himself lost not only in space but time, to a place somewhere in Earth's past where peoples from walled cities do battle on elephants and a fearsome leper king lusts after a woman named Fou-tan whom King desires for his own."It is hard to know where dreams end and reality begins," King utters at one point, trying to make sense of his new situation.That's pretty much all you know about King's situation, and all you need to. Burroughs wrote this story, originally for a pulp magazine in 1931 and later known by the title of its first novelization, "Jungle Girl," as an apparent exercise in boiling down his approach to fantasy fiction in one fell swoop, rather than a series like "Tarzan" or "John Carter, Warlord Of Mars." King is a lot like John Carter, a very capable fighter both brave and crafty, except he is thrown back in time rather than out in space.It's not a great story, rife as it is with repetition and coincidence, but Burroughs does keep things moving forward. King's standoff with the leper king, Lodivarman, bristles with energy and menace, as do his encounters with a jealous lord in another city-state later on. Various twists and turns, including some exploration of secret passages, manage to keep one in suspense even if the final outcome is never in doubt.I don't think Burroughs studied up much on Cambodia before he wrote this, as his references to such things as "howdahs," "apsaras" and "mahouts" definitely suggests India, as does the widespread worship of Shiva. This didn't bother me, though; at least not nearly as much as the constant tiger attacks King must fend off, four in all. None, by the way, are referred to simply as a "tiger;" rather, it's "My Lord the Tiger," an affectation in speech used by everyone in the book which soon wears out its welcome.One thing I liked about the book is how most of the characters in it manage to be likeable in sometimes offbeat ways. When King kills a member of a war party only to be captured by his comrades, they actually compliment King on his skill and show themselves to be just men doing a job, rather than cold-blooded adversaries. This sort of sympathetic treatment of the novelâs various red-shirts throughout adds a strain of humor as well as empathy to what otherwise might have been a dry book.Overall, I found "The Land Of Hidden Men" an easy read and Burroughs' way with storycraft rather engaging, despite some thinness in the plot and in the lead characters. Clearly Burroughs was an author who could take a familiar idea and breathe something fresh into it, enough to pass one's time if not to be remembered long after.

The world of broadcast sports changed utterly on September 7, 1979, when a rough beast slouched towards Bristol, Connecticut to be born. For going on four decades, ESPN has defined how sports is processed by television viewers. Its legacy is pondered by hundreds who contributed to the network's rise in this 2011 oral history.Less a finely shaped cultural history than a compendium of colorful complaint, "Those Guys Have All The Fun" is a lot like the network itself: Fun for a while, then repetitive and more than a bit obnoxious. Writers James Andrew Miller and Tom Shales are more interested in spending time with the stars than using that access to tell engaging stories.The one strong takeaway you get from reading "Those Guys..." is that while ESPN may look like a fun place to work, the reality is that of a hard-nosed testing ground with a high body count."ESPN is really a mentality, and unlike any other place I've ever seen," says ESPN executive producer Michael Mandt. "As soon as you start out, you have to make it, either you're good enough or you don't have a job."That the testosterone flows thick at the male-dominated network is no surprise; that it once extended to routine sexual harassment and even airings of the Playboy Channel in common offices will no doubt surprise and offend many readers. More subtly upsetting is how Mandt's quote of Darwinian certitude is borne out by the ruthless testimony of others who worked at the network. Most pride themselves on careers they personally helped end, one way or another.Even the seemingly pleasant SportsCenter anchor Chris Berman is exposed in "Those Guys" as a brittle egomaniac, unable to get along with those who fail to proffer the proper respect. Others snipe about how they pushed out someone who didn't fit with the elbow-heavy Bristol culture. Themes of egos amok and games-playing of a kind that has nothing to do with sports are ever-present, and offer a classic example of why visiting the kitchen of your favorite restaurant may not be a good idea.While the content is a bit monotonous and dry when you get beyond the blood trails, "These Guys" really suffers as a structural exercise. Nearly 750 pages of text is broken up into just seven chapters, with long sections of narrative focusing as much on personality clashes as management decisions in a fashion that sometimes breaks off roughly from one subject to the other. The worst mistake the authors make is in giving their interviews such length to explain their viewpoint, which seldom makes them likable but too often drains reader interest a page or so in.As someone who has watched ESPN most of my life, and even visited the place and talked to people there, I didn't feel like "Those Guys" told me anything I didn't know. A solid book as much in terms of bulk as information, it does sate the hungry appetite regarding what ESPN is all about. After reading it, you may find it harder to care about those four letters than you ever imagined.

Graham Greene was deep in another book project and popping pills for the only time in his life when he dashed off this soporific spy tale in order to make some money on the side. If "The Confidential Agent" doesn't read like a labor of love, that's because it wasn't one.What it is is hard to say. The story concerns a character called "D.," who represents the government of an unnamed nation trying to put down a rebellion. To that end, he journeys to England to sign a deal with coal-mining concerns in order to prevent rebels from doing the same. The rebels have their own agent in England. A cat-and-mouse game ensues.At the root of Greene's 1939 novel is a meditation on war and peace, as seen by someone who only can imagine the former. Travelling to England, the battle-ravaged D. imagines himself carrying the contagion of war to a nation which has only known peace for 20 years."Wherever D. was, there was the war," Greene writes. "He could never understand that people were not aware of it."As the novel progresses, we discover D. has a point. Bad things tend to happen to those with whom he associates. The problem with "Confidential Agent" is twofold. Greene never makes the situations seem plausible, and he never makes you care.The central character who emerges in the narrative, other than D. himself, is spoiled rich girl Rose Cullen, a 20-year-old who falls in love with the middle-aged D. after meeting him while the two wait for a train. That may seem implausible enough, but not as much as the subsequent discovery that Rose happens to be the daughter of the British lord with whom D. hopes to sign that coal contract. D. seems an especially unlikely recipient for her affections, being fairly dour and lethargic, but he also manages to win the romantic affections of a 14-year-old hotel maid, whom D. isnât so much in love with but wants to protect.The more the story goes on, the more coincidences pile up. He keeps meeting the same people over and over, no matter where he goes. There's a modest sense of paranoia in the way the usual suspects keep cropping up which is faintly stirring, but since D. takes it all in stride, so do you. He's a character that can't even get energized at the possibility of his own execution. If he can't seem to care, why should you?Greene seems to be using the Spanish Civil War as the basis for D.'s situation (he would be serving the Loyalist, anti-Franco side), though it's a mystery why he doesn't name the country or use presumably Spanish names for his lead character and others he knows from the old country. Greene didn't name the key characters in the novel he wrote in tandem with "Confidential Agent," "The Power And The Glory," though at least there he named the country.Greene wrote later that he was using Benzedrine for the only time of his life, and consciously aiming for a popular success, when he wrote this. It's easy to see the former, and hard to imagine a less likely stab at the latter. What action there is is very confusing, especially as all experiences are channeled through D.'s detached perspective. Long sections at love-pitching by D.'s two female admirers are long on passion and short on sensibility. We never have the slightest clue what drives their interest.The book has a nifty feeling to it, of continuous mystery, of London presented as a kind of subterranean pit of mild depravity, and of D. as a bringer of bad luck despite his decent intentions. But "Confidential Agent" never coheres into anything involving. It just runs on for a while, throws a few turns at the reader, before dropping you in a sudden jumble at the end.

A fair-minded yet highly critical account of Ronald Reagan's presidency, "President Reagan: The Role Of A Lifetime" presents the story of a man who manages some good things despite a disengaged and ideologically blinkered mindset.For some, the clear liberal perspective of Washington Post reporter Lou Cannon is enough to downgrade "The Role Of A Lifetime." It's their loss. Cannon does focus on the negative, for example giving over a fifth of his book to the ugly if cosmically insignificant Iran-Contra scandal, but his approach here and throughout is less biased than it is factual. Heâs not trying to tar Reagan with the Iran-Contra case as much as establish what he knew and understand how he could have let such a thing happen.While the two Iran-Contra chapters are overlong and repetitive, taking up a fifth of the bookâs 800-plus pages, they do get to the bookâs thesis in explaining how Reagan went ahead with an idea that seemed clever, even moral on the surface (using Israeli arms to free kidnapped Americans, and reaching out to Iranian moderates in the process) but fell apart because it was mishandled by subordinates Reagan trusted too blindly."On balance, Reagan was a strong man, but an extraordinarily weak manager," Cannon writes. "He restored public confidence in the presidency without mastering the difficult art of wielding presidential power."Essentially thatâs the message of âThe Role Of A Lifetime,â that Reagan was less a leader than a showman propped up by his entourage, reading off index cards while conducting high-level talks and telling funny stories when he lost focus. Cannon does have positive things to say about Reagan, too. It's just that the positives always come with caveats. Factually accurate caveats, but matters of interpretation, too.Published in 1991, when Reagan was still alive and his legacy less than it has become since his death, "Role Of A Lifetime" is not a conventional biography or even history. It's a set of long essays, each encompassing a different aspect of Reagan as man and as president. Most focus on the problem points, such as a bungled trip to a cemetery in Germany where SS troops were buried and a peacekeeping mission in Lebanon which left 241 Marines dead and Reagan in retreat.Cannon is not a relentless faultfinder. He credits Reaganâs economic policies for whipping inflation and helping Americans across the board earn more, even at the cost of a higher national debt. Most notably, Cannon makes a strong case for Reagan's anti-nuclear vision informing the way he negotiated with Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev, firmly but flexibly enough to reap world-changing results.Whether you share Cannonâs view of Reaganâs legacy, or whether you think he was a great president no matter what Cannon says to the contrary, âThe Role Of A Lifetimeâ puts the case against on paper in such a way you will learn from it and be entertained, maybe even inspired by a man whom you didnât think youâd ever like.

Weak in execution, flailing in resolution, and unengaging overall, "The Afghan" is an example of a thriller in which the author forgets such key ingredients as believability and suspense.A laptop taken from al-Qaeda's finance leader suggests a plot is in motion to rival the destruction of the World Trade Center; the challenge is finding it out before it becomes another milestone of terror. To gain intelligence, a British soldier who grew up in Iraq is given the identity of a captured Taliban leader and sent to Afghanistan to infiltrate the terrorists behind the operation. Can Mike Martin discover the nature of their operation before the terrorists discover this spy in their midst?Frederick Forsyth has been writing smart thrillers in which desperate people play for high stakes since the early 1970s; his prior novel before this 2006 effort also dealt with the realities of 9/11, and did so effectively. So I can't really understand why "The Afghan" fails so dismally, except maybe he's been at it so long now heâs become prone to shortcuts. Everything about "The Afghan" suggests a novelist in a hurry.Other reviewers point up the amazing and ridiculous coincidences that pile up in this book, as well as the odd research gaffes and the basic idiocy of the situation surrounding Martin's infiltration. They make great points, and rather than dance around spoiler alerts in echoing them, I'd like to call attention to problems I had in the way Forsyth delivers his story, which was where I think he really fails to live up to his reputation.The focus on scene-setting is entirely too heavy, with lengthy descriptions of places and people that have little bearing on the plot.
