DO wait the hour suggestedts before sticking your pens, pencils, whatever on the sticky pad or you'll find those items have moved /vanished.

I was provided a free copy of the book in exchange for an honest review.Inside Game by Collette West is the latest story that takes us inside the world of the New York Kings. This time around, superstar Drake Shultz has been popped for PEDs. As a result the team forces him to work with a professional who can help him with his condition. Eva Sloane is the sexy substance abuse counselor who comes into his life and from there the sparks fly.I really enjoyed this story. The dynamics between the bad boy and good girl were exciting, but the story delves deeper into the problems we all face when avoiding issues from our past and the consequences they can have in our future. Overall this was an engaging love story filled with heat, laughs, and a few tears that kept me invested through the end. Five stars for another quality writing effort from the author!

What a terrific case. My Samsung Galaxy S6 fit perfectly into the Fascination case. It's a little on the bulky side, but it provides superior protection, which is excellent for me as I have a tendency to punish my phones. I've tested it on several various situations such as dropping it on the ground and soaking in water and each time its made it through unscathed. The design itself is bright and attractive.The thing I really liked about this product is the Touch Pen that comes with it. It minimizes my need to use my fingers and makes everything easier to navigate.Five stars for a a great product that delivers in all areas.

I was provided a free version of this product in exchange for an honest review. I've tested a number of selfie sticks overs the years. The PerfectDay Foldable QuickSnap Pro 3 in 1 version is one of the best that I have tried. First of all, it's very easy to get set up. I synced it with my Samsung Galaxy 6 and I was all set to take great pictures. My phone locked into place securely and from there your biggest concern is taking the winning shot. Secondly, the QuickSnap has a perfect range to get quality pictures with the added bonus of being able to adjust the head by up to 270 degrees. This give you a superior chance to get pics from just about every angle. I also appreciate that it folds back up easily and can be easily tucked away for lightweight and non-bulky transport. Overall, this is a well-made product that is capable of helping you to really capture some amazing pictures, especially spontaneous group shots. Five stars for one of the best selfie sticks I have ever used.

We have a playful Akita German Shepherd mix who gets excited a little too easily. At the same time, we also live in a strict HOA that frowns on dogs that make too much noise. After some complaints, I had already been looking into different options that might help her curtail her excessive barking, when I came upon the Petiner Electronic No Bark Control Dog Training Collar.I'm thrilled to say that within the first week, we noticed a big difference. She's a good-sized dog, and the nice thing about the Petiner product is that it has an adjustable sensitivity range that fits dogs of varying sizes. The collar itself is also lightweight and not bulky, so it really doesn't add any additional strain on Shadow. Overall, this is a tremendous product not only for the quick results, but the value you receive with the price. Five stars!

If you are looking for a high-quality, yet low-cost unit that can display the power being pulled as you recharge your various devices. With two USB ports for simultaneous recharging, as well as the option to measure the various units in alternating display modes, this is a very handy gadget. Simply plug in your phone or tablet for a recharge and you can get excellent information about the charging process. For such a small and portable device, it really is a handy tool for measuring charge effectiveness. Five stars!

I was provided a free version of this product in exchange for an honest review. Over the years, I've tried out numerous so-called "selfie sticks". The PerfectDay QuickSnap version is one of the best that I have sampled. First of all, it's very easy to get set up. I synced it with my Samsung Galaxy 6 and I was all set to take great pictures. My phone locked into place securely and from there your biggest concern is taking the winning shot. With a telecscoping reach of 3.5 feet, this is a perfect range to get quality pictures. Plus the reaction time is very fast making it a snap to capture just the right moment. Overall, this is a well-made product that is capable of helping you to really capture some amazing pictures, especially spontaneous group shots. Five stars for one of the best selfie sticks I have ever used.

I was provided a free product in exchange for an honest review. My son and I love to work out together in our garage. In the past we simply used one of our phones to play music during the workouts, but it was never really the most satisfactory option. The Roverbeats T3 model has been a tremendous upgrade! The product seamlessly connected with Samsung Galaxy 6 and immediately we were enjoying a highly-upgraded sound experience. While the product itself is small, the sound quality is high and it is easily portable to take with you on the go or move into different room as needed. Its also lightweight weighing only 6 ounces, so its pretty handy if you wants to pack it in a backpack or a purse for music on the go. I also like the fact that if I'm streaming music and a call comes in, I can take my calls from the device by using the built-in microphone. Finally, off of a single charge, I got a little over six hours of battery life from the product, which was more than enough. Overall, this is a small, but powerful product that will truly enhance your audio pleasure. Five stars!

Honestly, this is a VERY basic book about drop shipping. My biggest problem is that the presented information is much too general to be useful and lacks the specifics one would need to really get a business like this up and running. Just about everything you can find here is readily available for free on the Internet in better forms that give you a clear way to get started in this lucrative field. Not the worst book Ive seen on the subject, but nowhere near the best. Two stars.

In the first book of the Universe Eventual series, the authors deliver a well-written sci-fi story that sets the stage for an even larger epic. Set on the remote space colony of Stephen's Point, the story follows a pair of young protagonists,Theo and Selena, who will play important roles in both manning the crew of the Chimera and saving the dying colony. While each character has a unique journey that brings them to the Chimera, both face tests and trials along the way that help to flesh out why they are so important, even though both are seemingly misfits. With a strong sense of both plotting and character development, the writers keep you engaged throughout the story with excellent pacing, witty dialogue, and imaginative scenarios. I was thoroughly immersed in the story and invested in the characters who I wanted to see succeed. Perhaps the one drawback I had was with the storylines that the book would alternate between Theo and Selena, which didn't seem to be happening in the same real-time. However, that was only a minor quibble and one I understand the authors probably made to keep you engaged in both characters' drama. Overall though if you are a fan of YA science fiction, you will certainly enjoy this tale. Five stars for a fun and creative adventure set in outer space.

I love peanut brittle and quite simply this is the best I've ever tried! Made from all natural ingredients, the 939 Brittle product is both tasty and lovingly-packaged. In particular, I find it has just the right combination of sweetness and saltiness. My son loves it too. Makes a great gift for the holidays or a perfect treat to bring to parties or school events.. I would highly-recommend this brittle to anyone who loves snacks of this type. Five stars for a high-quality product!

I purchased the OXO Good Grips Magnetic All-Purpose Clips for my wife, who is a teacher. She always has a variety of school reminders, paperwork, artwork, bills, etc that often ends up strewn all over the kitchen or office. Now though, she can keep them neatly grouped in an easy to remember place like the fridge. The grips themselves are large and attractive ranging in a colorful assortment of blue, red, green, and yellow. They are powerful enough to clutch a good-sized amount of papers, bills, or documents in a single clip. However, as mentioned in several of the other reviews, the magnets are quite weak and if you try to use them to hold anything with any significant amount of weight, they will not stay in place very well. Overall, these are a decent product, but nothing to write home about.

As a disclaimer, I will first say I was provided a free month's sample of the HCF product in exchange for an honest review. With most types of supplements, it's easy to tell if you are getting results. For instance, with fat burners, you can clearly judge the results in a tangible way. When it comes to so-called "brain supplements" though, the results can often be more subjective, so I tend to fall on the skeptical side with these products.. The claims made by F & Q are that the HCF supplement naturally nourishes your brain and is different from other similar products which are basically glorified multivitamins. I'm not someone who suffers from depression or needs any kind of happiness boost, however, I do work in a stressful and demanding industry that often can leave you feeling dazed or frazzled after a hectic day. So being able to improve mental acuity and focus is something that would be extremely helpful. I took the supplements for a month and here is what I can honestly report. I do feel like I have been more focused with a heightened level of concentration since taking the supplement. Perhaps  a big part of this has been that I've slept better over this period of time which in turns leads to a feeling of overall refreshment and clarity. Therefore, I would have to conclude that HCF is a very helpful brain supplement. Since I can not 100% report that it delivers on all it claims is possible, i will refrain from providing a five star review. Still, an honest four star review for noticeable improvement in more restful sleep and mental clarity seems to fit. I will continue to evaluate this product in the coming months to see the long-term results.

The Hoard by Neil Grimmett is tense and detailed thriller that bounces between eras to tell the story of the consequences of a horrifying accident and the ramifications it has on those involved and various family members. Set in the world of the Royal Ordnance Factory, the story follows the lives of characters involved in a tragic explosion in 1951 and how it affects them decades later. Though the story is slow-moving and the pacing could use some work, Grimmett masterfully paints the picture of a grim and dangerous world of those who perform work of this nature with his descriptive language and ability to set the scene. The author is also skilled at evoking a creepy feeling of dread with the situations he places his characters within. I would highly recommend this book for fans of historical fiction who enjoy moody thrillers filled with intriguing characters and situations. I thoroughly enjoyed the story and have no problem offering a five star rating for quality storytelling.

My son is a hardcore basketball player. He plays constantly and often has problems with soreness in his legs. The muscle roller stick has been a godsend! Now after practice or games, he can use it to work on his legs and relieve any muscle issues before they occur. He also uses it at home to massage his legs and work out any kinks in his legs. This is a tremendous product. I would highly recommend this to anyone who is is an active athlete for preventive care and muscle relief. A very enthusiastic five stars!

This really is a nifty little supplement. Between promoting more restful sleep, to stress resistance, this really has been a great thing for my well-being. Iâm not as stressed out by the âsimple thingsâ that really shouldnât get to me anyway, it helps me sleep better, and I even feel like my memory is a little better. As an added bonus itâs a certified organic product â even better!

I've been looking everywhere for these eyelets! We don't have a whole lot of arts and crafts or scrapbooking stores around here, but the one place that does carry them charge outrageous prices. I knew I could find a better deal, which this is exactly. Well made and they look amazing.

If you are a fan of the GoT series, this is a must have volume for your collection.  It offers a lot of background information about the history of Westeros, as well as the various Houses and Kingdoms. In particular, I most enjoyed the in-depth history of House Targaryen and how they came to rule Westeros. Must of this information had previously been presented in the short stories, but I liked having it all in one cohesive volume. Overall, if you are looking to get more of your GoT fix, while waiting the agonizingly long wait for the future books to hopefully arrive, this is a great read. It will offer a lot more to flesh out the various backstories of your favorite characters and families, while also fleshing out the various rivalries that exist and how they came to be. Additionally, I really enjoyed the artwork, although it would have been a welcome addition to see much more of it included in a volume of this sort. Still, fives stars for shining more light into the World of Ice and Fire!
This is a very well-designed calendar with a combination of terrific character images, plus artistic use of the house sigils. I am very satisfied with this purchase!

Overall, this is an exceptional battery case for the IPhone 6 Plus. With a phone this big, it can burn through battery life quickly, but with the addition of the Trianium battery case, you can effectively double your battery life. To me, that is a huge asset! However, it's also important to have a durable case that offers some modicum of protection and this delivers on all counts. It feel solid and has even endured some "abuse" from its owner already and come through with flying colors. Sometimes when you slip your phone into a new battery case or protective sleeve, you run the risk of a poor fit that obscures access to buttons or the camera, but this is not an issue with the Trianium product. I would give this the highest possible recommendation for anyone who needs a superior battery case for their IPhone 6 Plus. Five stars!

The Gnomes of Night is an imaginative and entertaining story by Itzik Klein. The writing is solid, although there are some moments when the rhymes seem a bit forced. However, the story flows well and the artwork is colorful and engaging. Overall it's a fun story and reminds young readers about the importance of being responsible and cleaning up after themselves. I would recommend this story to parents of young children who want something entertaining and educational.
I was tired of using big patches that everyone noticed and took up a big area on my body. These are nice size and work just as great as the really expensive ones! Happy customer here.

One of the best books I have read all year. Not only does the author provide a look at the origins of Amazon and how it came to be one of the biggest and most influential companies in the world, but it also provides a glimpse into the origins of Jeff Bezos. I was fascinated to see what made him tick and impressed by the insight into his enduring vision for Amazon and how he handled the obstacles that stood in his way. I was particularly captivated by the ruthless tactics the company employed to both survive against the likes of Walmart, Apple, and the giants of the book publishing industry. This is a great read for anyone who wants to understand how "The Everything Store" was built and where this company plans to go in the coming years.

I was provided a free sample of this product for review. I had no previous experience with magnesium oil.  The product itself shipped quickly and came attractively packaged. The oil comes in a spray-on format and absorbs quickly into the skin. It doesn't leave an oily residue. As a former athlete, I do suffer from some joint pain and general body soreness. I tried to concentrate the spray in those problem areas on a daily basis. After one month, I have noticed some mild relief with the joint pain. I would recommend this product to anyone suffering from joint pain or aches who have tried other remedies without success. This may just provide the relief you are looking for!

I've used several of the NuNutrients products sand every time I have been happy with the purchase. The Cucumber Eye Cream is no different! This is a great product that has really helped with the dark circles and wrinkles around my eyes! I use it in the mornings before I go to work. It has a silky feeling and soaks right into my skin. I was pleasantly surprised that I could see results so quickly. There has been a noticeable reduction in the wrinkles on my face, plus my skin feels measurably smoother. I would highly recommend this to anyone who wants to reverse the hands of time! Five stars for a product that gets results from a company that always delivers.

Sadly, I have reached the age where the effects of time are starting to take their toll. I'm not going bald, but I am starting to notice a definite thinning of my hair, which as one time was fairly thick. I decided to try the NuNutrients product over the past month and the results have been pleasantly surprising. While I cannot state for a fact that this product will regrow lost hair, my hair feels fuller and thicker, and I notice much less lost hair in my tub. So any product that can help me combat the ravages of time is one I will continue to stock in my arsenal. Five stars for a noticeable improvement in the thickness of my hair over the course of one month.

I'm someone that has always been self-concious of my teeth. Unfortunately, years of drinking soda have taken their toll. I decided to try out the Shine Whitening system to see if I could get some results without having to resort to costly dental procedures. I used the first round of treatments for almost two weeks and I'm happy to say that I have seen some definite improvement. The tray itself is comfortable and easy to manage, while the gel does its work. I have heard that whitening systems can often result in tooth sensitivity or soreness, but so far I have experienced none of that. Overall, for the price and the quick results, I would rate this an excellent product that will help you improve your smile in a very reasonable time period. Five stars!

I was provided a sample of the product for an honest review. Though I'm not a huge tea fan, I have long heard of the benefits of Matcha as a nutritional superfood. As some of the reviewers have mentioned, when using this product as a tea, the flavor is on the bitter side and not the most useful way to enjoy it. Instead, the best uses of this product seem to be as a food additive or as a key ingredient in healthy smoothies. After using it for a few weeks, I do notice an uptick in my energy levels and metabolism. While I can't speak to the claims of increased memory and concentration, it seems to have been a positive supplement in all other regards. Going forward I will continue to make this a staple of my healthy supplement regimen.

I had long heard of the nutritional benefits of seaweed as a purported superfood, so I decided to try One Organic's Premium Roasted Seaweed. The pack comes in easy to use sheets of fifty. Overall, I was most surprised that the seaweed was surprisingly tasty, while at the same time possessing no fat, sodium, or sugar. This makes for a great and healthy snack. I don't eat sushi, but the seaweed sheets can easily be rolled into a full-fledged meal. In the end, I give this products high marks for being a quality food as a reasonable price. Five Stars!

For some, losing weight seems to come easily. In my case, that was not true. I work out a lot and have a voracious appetite. So I was hoping to find something that could help suppress my hunger pangs. Iâm happy to say my Garcina Cambogia tablets Crush did just that.In the few weeks I have been on the product, my snacking has certainly been curtailed and I donât find myself constantly longing for food. In two weeks, Iâm down about five pounds, which is exactly what I was hoping for! Additionally, I feel a noticeable improvement in my energy level, which helps with my workouts. Going forward, this will be a staple supplement in my battle to stay fit and toned. Five stars!

Terrible product and horrible customer service from Dymo. The product would not install correctly with my PC and Dymo's customer service was completely unhelpful in resolving my issue. I would avoid this product and any other products made by this company.
It is a good little read, got through it in about 35-40 mins. the part about the just start is wrong, there is a more detailed correction below. I wish it had a few more things in it. good overview.

This works great. fits my MP.45 great. all 4 mags, my speed loader, the pouch on the side fits my eyes and ears And a 100 box of ammo. i tried to stuff a 200 round box in there but it almost busted the seams, do not push it. but perfect for a quick trip to the range. great, going to get more. i received them, and my relatives swarmed leaving me with only 2 of the 12... so i need more.. these are great. i cut the very top seam off one and turned it into a top loader. it still works fine.

great product, i got the big can. I gave it a 4/5 because it did not include the tiny straw like dust off or canned air does for small areas, which it had the muzzle for, just does not include the straw... which is a bummer.

These are great, and let me tell you why.. the wood is better than the hardboard type stick... yes. but the tips are different. one is more conical, sort of pointy with a fine tip for getting into the slide rails or harder to reach spots. the other is the standard q-tip balloon style for oiling and so fourth. super versatile.

This book, is one of the worst I have read, and I read a lot of garbage.. It says "26 pages" but it is really 11 pages. NO IMAGES or diagrams of any kind. This is a fantastic little knife. small, strong, can be easily carried/ concealed. comes with a detachable belt loop and you can choose what side to put it on. It wool me some trial and error to figure out how the mounting holes work for a right handed person, but not difficult. strong knife, full tang and for its size, the blade is nice and tick, which means its decently strong. i would not use it to pry up stuff, but small game dressing or a small yet stylish carry blade.

This is what I use to clean my firearms. it works better than regular paper towels, get all the grease out of the tiny spots.

Wanted a handy sized flashlight for the tool bag that could stand up. This fits the bill perfectly. I wish it was a little brighter, but it does the job fine and has a good light pattern.  You can use it as a regular handheld too with the legs retracted and the head swiveled in-line. For the price, I recommend it.

I've had an Adidas Adizero cap in black for a while but wanted a white cap for those bright sunny days for a little better heat reflection and preferably with more vents for cooling. After much research I settled on this one and couldn't be happier. It is a nice and light material, and while it's tough to tell in the pictures here, the white part is totally separate from the gray mesh, allowing ventilation all around.

Bought a pair for Men's 11.5 Sperry Topsiders (on the product's advice of going upna size for half-sizes). Finally had enough of the original insoles that were all bunched up in the toes and ripped them out. I found these recommended elsewhere and purchased here with Prime. They are a perfect fit in a size 11.5. Feel pretty comfy and well-made and with activated charcoal on the bottom. Just a heads up, while my Topsiders might run a tad big (I normally wear a 12), I don't know about putting this set in a size 13.

This toy is a giant squeaker with a covering that somewhat resembles a pig. My dog loves this thing like no other toy I've ever seen her with. It goes everywhere, and for some reason the squeaker elicits an emotional response from her sometimes. We had one previously that was a gift and bought 2 more as backups because it was getting ratty and god forbid something happened to it.

Can't complain too much.  It fits the Kindle Paperwhite OK and provides adequate protection that I wanted it for. Easy to get in and out. It is a little loose, my only concern, but fulfills its purpose.

I don't normally write 1-star reviews, but this one deserves it for its poor product page. The product I received is a hard rubber plug (not plastic) and it has the Draw-Tite logo on the face (not blank). It is nothing like the only picture displayed.  Others allude to another product picture, but as of this purchase, there is only one misleading picture up.

What is there to say? It's a stainless measuring scoop. Measures well (?) I have a 4-cup coffee maker, so typically I use a single 2-tablespoon scoop of grounds for half the pot (for a good sized mug) and it works perfectly.  For the days I want to make 3-cups to fill a travel mug, the single tablespoon comes in handy. Simple and effective.

Comfortable, light, great ventilation. I got these to kick around during warm weather, where I wanted a closed toe, but boat shoes got too hot and sticky. These are performing terrifically and are a joy to wear. Haven't taken them totally into the water yet. Have always liked Ecco and they should hold up well if the brand means anything.

This is a nice case. Leather is supple, stand works easily, magnetic on/off, and at a good price. But as others have mentioned, in portrait, the cover will not fold flat behind the ipad. While not fatal to me, it is certainly annoying.

Satisfied with the digitizer. As noted, the tools are useless and there are no instructions on where to apply the adhesive. Could have also come with a home button, but thats no biggie. I pretty much did everything though with a spudger I already had, hair dryer, and toothpicks, and used my old digitizer as the guide for the adhesive. The upper right corner of my screen was shattered (where the guide I used had me start) so there really wasnt a clean way to disassemble it anyhow, just have to watch out for the wifi antenna and digitizer ribbon mainly. I used a free guide from iFixit which explains the DIY steps (35 of 'em), and was fairly spot on.Overall, no, it isn't gorilla glass and doesn't have the same exact feel, but for a quarter of the price it's pretty darn good.UPDATE: nearly two years later, the screen is holding up great. I put a screen protector on it pronto since it's plastic, but you can't tell the difference between the replacement and original screens.

I have included the model number in the title because there seems to be reviews for multiple units on this page and I want to help you avoid the confusion.Remember 10 years ago in the golden age of DSL? People were switching over in droves from their dial-up and ISDN services to the new DSL.Back when 2Wire still put out cutting edge product and the only way to do better was to buy a Belkin. Both companies have stagnated over the years and are notorious for churning out masses of junk. (2Wire is still cranking out 802.11g units!)Well...I don't hold out too much hope for 2Wire, but Belkin seems to have made a comeback to quality with this device.While this router works great with your older wireless N and G devices, it is ready to take you to the next level for gaming and media streaming over your network with the newer wireless AC protocol.I get a strong signal strength all over my house and I spend much less time with my video buffering than with my previous Linksys unit.Setup was quick and easy and for the price you can't do better in moving into the AC revolution.

I put the router model in the title because this page seems to mix reviews for several different units. Very confusing without some additional information.This is a decent router for your home network. If all you do is connect laptops, tablets, and phones to the internet for browsing then this will serve you very well. For G and N wireless networking this unit does exactly what it says it will do. However you should keep in mind that this is last year's tech. The AC protocol is what you are looking for if you game or share media over your network. Keep in mind your connected machines will also need to have AC adapters, either installed or attached in order to take full advantage.The main drawback of this perfectly capable device is the price. You can get the same features for much less. So the bottom line is, if you only do basic Internet surfing, look for something cheaper, and if you are looking for the cutting edge speed and tech, you also want to look elsewhere. So that said, I am not sure who the market would actually be for this device.

The size and number that come in a box makes it a great snak to toss in your pack. My primay concern with the product is the sugar content. Having said that, the serving size is appropriate for a cookie bar.Make no mistake, this is a semi-soft cookie bar. It has that subtle flavor quality that will remind you of a fig newton. Sort of a cakey cookie sort of thing, sweet but not overwelmingly so.I wouldn't buy this for "health reasons" but I do like it as a cookie bar. Fig bars are still a better value though, and probably every bit as healthy as these minus the protein that the soy brings. As a product, I feel like it either didn't live up to its goal as healthy or that the healthy is pushed forward in the marketing to throw you off the scent of it being a cookie bar.I like them. They are okay. If this were a stocking stuffer, I wouldn't throw it out. If there was somebody on my Christmas list that liked to eat junk food that claimed to be healthy (and there are a lot of those types) I would consider putting this under the tree. It will absolutely please the folks that like to pretend that they "eat clean" without the pain or boredom of actually doing so.

This is a very beautiful piece value priced.Here is some advice for all jewelry you buy online: Read the size description and if you are unfamiliar with measurements, get your ruler out. When you buy online it's hard to tell the size that the picture represents. Getting a better picture in your mind before you purchase will save you from buying something you don't like and set a realistic expectation for what will be shipped.Second piece of advice: When you have a listing that shows a range in color or clarity, do not hesitate to use the free return offered if what you get doesn't look like the picture. That's why they offer it.The only drawback to this piece is the packaging. You might want to pick up a premium box separately if you are trying to make an impression. It comes in a plain black box. Inside the box is a black felt drawstring bag. It's sort of like the packaging you expect to find at the flea market, so by all means upgrade by buying a nice box elsewhere.The "room for improvement" piece here is the backing. It should have been a solid backing or a solid inlay of some other material. As it is you can see the shape and tiers from the back which is where you see why it is priced the way it is.All in all, for the money spent this is a great value and the perfect stocking stuffer for the beauty in your life.

Quick to install. Very convenient and cost efficient solution for a dry erase board.We have looked at and tried many alternatives. Most of our training rooms have a board backed dry erase board hung on the wall.We have also tried the paint on product, which was very unsatisfactory. Maybe the maintenance guys didn't "paint it on" right.While I wouldn't use this as a replacement for the classroom, it's a perfect dry erase board for my office.One problem is that there were no markers. So it isn't a complete kit, just a quick to install dry erase surface.Improvement ideas:* Include markers (sold separately)* Include a border (I think this would just make it look smarter where installed)* Include a stick-on-the-wall holder for markers (sold separately)The box is a little tricky. It shows both markers and a holder. But they are just telling you that you can buy them in addition to your shiny new dry erase surface.The real key is to follow the installation instructions that come with the product. They don't come right out and say it, but clearly you are going to want this mounted to as clean and SMOOTH of a surface as possible. They mention drywall in the documentation but if it is at all textured, I would think twice.All in all it is what it says it is and does what it says it will do. If you want to get fancy with it, that's going to be on you and your own ingenuity to accommodation markers and make it look like part of the environment that you are installing it in.

The first thing you will pick up about this book is that it isn't just a technical list of distilleries with some side bars on their history and an overview of their product line. This book gets into the heads of the people behind the distillery, their phillosophy and mission. I have visited the three Texas distilleries, most recently Garrison Brothers in Fredericksberg. Having read their entry in the book before the visit added depth and meaning to the tour of the facility and gave me a chance to formulate some questions before my arrival. If you are going to visit any of these places, I highly recommend you pick up a copy of this book before hand. And here is a great idea, have some of the employees, if not the founders sign you book in their section. You will find that it will greatly increase the sentemental value of your copy and really motivate you to go see more of these distilleries in action.One thing you walk away from this book with is an understanding that much of what is marketed as "craft" is all flowing out of a couple of huge distribution centers. So it really pays to go check out where your whiskey is purportedly made. On the other hand you start to appreciate the struggle that the authentic craft distillery is up against. It is very similar to the stories you read about the early craft beer innovators.You are going to pick up on some of the inside issues that you might not think about with bottle in hand. For example, a startup distillery making aged whiskey doesn't really have aged whiskey to sell for a long time. So they may be paying utility bills, employees, purchasing supplies for five years or more before their first sale is even possible! There are some ways around that. Selling to the novelty "white dog" crowd for example, while you wait for your real love to quietly age in an oak barrel.You also pick up on some of the things that make these places unique to themselves. Garrison Brothers for example have the benefit of the Texas sun. So they age their barrels in metal shipping containers that get aired out every other day. That high daytime temperature GREATLY accelerates the aging process without adding years of storage cost.If I were going to dock this book for a star it would be for how few distilleries were included. There are some great ones out there that didn't make the cut. But when I think about it, maybe I am wrong and THOSE places are among the crowd reselling whiskey under their own misleading label.In any event, adding more content would be more pages and a more expensive book. I am confident in my five star rating and I will keep my fingers crossed for a sequel.

This is a fast close shave. Not a fast close shave "for an electric" this gives you a comparable shave to a regular three blade stick razor.I will be honest. I have used an electric for some time. And in the past it has been a trade off. Convenience for quality. I love the convenience of shaving dry while waiting for my bus. But it wasn't always the best or smoothest shave. It's like you start your day every day about an hour away from 5 o'clock shadow.Specifically, I am talking about this unit:Philips Norelco 6948XL/41 Shaver 2100 (Packaging may vary)It's a $30 model and it shaves like it.The compromise is over. This model may be more expensive but it really shines in the shaving department.What makes it better?* Only half as loud as the Norelco 6948XL* Smooth close shave that feels like a razor* Half the shave time over the Norelco 6948XL* It does a great job of getting into those hard to reach places like under the jaw* Feels more comfortable against the faceThe comfort is huge. It took me a shave or two to get used to it, but it feels different than the Norelco 6948XL because all three heads have much greater maneuverability to get into places like under the jaw and around the Adam's apple. With the older unit you have to jam it in there with a constant pressure and really work it.The only thing I miss is the simple charging cable. This unit has a charging stand which is great and most people will prefer it, but I travel often and I appreciate the simplicity of a compact cable that just folds into a wrapped coil. They do make up for that though with the great travel bag. Even the bag is great quality. The zipper clasps are metal and there are compartments both pocket and mesh on the inside.This would be a great gift for the man in your life, or if you are like me and are going to always choose the convenience of electric, do yourself a huge favor and end the compromise.

There is a new wave of devices that are going to change the way we talk to our doctor and the way we think about our own health.Having real-time access to health markers along with a history of past benchmarks is going to allow us to fully realize the state of health over time. I think it is very likely that these types of devices are going to cause a conciousness shift making us all more health aware and promote better lifestyle choices.Unfortunately I can't use the most intriguing part of this device (yet) as there is no app for Android devices. This is on the way however.As for the device itself, it's the best home blood pressure devices I have tried.My typical experience is that home devices vary wildly from one reading to the next. Even if done back to back. I feel that most of the devices on the market are more like electronic mood rings. The first time you experience this you might wonder if you are dying with your readings going back and forth. It's not you, it's the machine. This unit however is very consistent.As for ease of use, it's pretty much a no-brainer. If you are thinking of getting this for your parrents, it won't confuse them. Luckily you don't need a smart phone for the basic features you would attribute to a traditional device.The price is a steal for the quality. I mean, this one WORKS so being priced competitively with devices that don't work, well you can go wrong there.Bottom line, the advantage of tracking your data over time, accurate readings, ease of use and value for your dollar, this is the unit you are looking for.If it came to market with an Android app I would have given it five stars, but that's a big blank for a huge piece of their potential market.

Cedar went on a round of antibiotics a year ago for a gut infection.The vet sent him home with some probiotics to put in his food after he was off the meds to rebuild his gut microbe count. It was only a week's worth. His stool since has fluctuated between normal and very infirm on a seemingly random basis, in spite of his food being fairly consistent.After two weeks on this product he has had a consistently firm stool which is a great indicator of gut health.More and more research points to the population of the microbiome as being linked to all facets of health. For that reason alone, I feel good about helping insure my companion's gut is healthy and well maintained.I am very pleased with the results Cedar got from this product and would absolutely recommend this product to others.

This is a much more cost effective liver support than what your vet will offer. If you are open to herbal remedies this might be something for you to try.My dog loves these. As he is getting older this is probably something he is going to continue to receive on a regular basis.The ingredient list of this product is quite impressive. I normally expect a canine remedy to have one to three potentially active ingredients. This one has 14.It may be a little early to completely summarize the tonic effect on Cedar but he certainly seems to have more energy while at the same time giving me a much less manic greeting upon my return home.The single drawback is the smell. YIKES! It stays on his breath for a couple of hours. But if you can get past that, this is certainly something to try with your older dog. Particularly if they have spent any time at all on commercial dog foods.

At $21 these are perfect "pet protectors" to keep paws off of your leather.These are not premium seat covers.These do not stretch at the appropriate strategic places to install with a "glove fit".These do not even look entirely what I would call "stylish".However, for a reasonably fitting product to protect your seats for a trip to Petsmart or the vet, these are great and competitively priced for the function for which I use them.This would also be a very economical way to cover stains on fabric seats as well.If you want a better quality product (and they are out there) then you are going to pay for it.This is a great example of "you get what you pay for" and for me, it offers exactly the utility I wanted and in a price range that is not painful.For every $10 up in price, I would subtract one star basically.

Wonder Woman is a multi-generational icon. Here you begin an understanding of her story, her impact on feminism, politicical thought, gender equality and more. Also in this book we get one of the best looks at where she came from. Where and how Wonder Woman was born and how she developed.Maybe this level of background is only interesting to a geek like me. But I dout it. I think anyone who has ever been touched by her stories and mythology, would enjoy exploring in greater detail her genesis and the complex factors that shaped her.The book has nearly 100 pages of notes and other back matter for those, like me, interested in deep trivia.To compliment this book, I also suggest:Wonder Woman Unbound: The Curious History of the World's Most Famous HeroineWonder Woman: The Story of the Amazon PrincessWonder Woman: The Complete HistoryThe present book is written from the point of view of an historian, by an actual historian.If you love history as much as you love comic books or Wonder Woman in particular, you are going to love this book.

Victoria Boutenko uses her latest book to continue the global phenomena she and her family started way back in 2004. Since then "green smoothie" has become a nearly household word. Certainly there had been previous advocates of blended greens and green salads, but Mrs. Boutenko's charm, style and approach really brought it to the mainstream consciousness.Now I don't know about you, but I really hate it when a book doesn't have a "look inside" option. I always feel better buying a book when I know more about what's inside.Here are my thoughts on the book and its various sections.The book is divided into three sections:1. A guide to your own retreat.This section is all about creating your own health retreat right at home. Way cheaper than traveling to a remote location. Everything you need is all laid out in a logical order. All of the planning has been done for you along with specific guidance and encouragement.2. Letters from our retreat participantsThis section is testimonials, examples and heart moving stories of healing and success. You could make an argument that this is a commercial, but why make a commercial for something you already purchased? I think the value here is that you get some of the interaction that you might see on an actual retreat.3. RecipesThis section is a little light compared to previous works, but the focus of the title is a retreat. If the book were called Green Smoothie Recipes, then I suppose that would be a bigger gripe. The recipes are broken out into the following catagories:* Sweet green smoothie recipes* Green soups* Green puddings* Soups and salads popular in my familyYou will probably want more variety than is offered here. I suggest:Green for Life: The Updated Classic on Green Smoothie NutritionGreen Smoothie Revolution: The Radical Leap Towards Natural HealthOverall this is a great book to have your own in-home retreat. You even get some aspects of the social group by being able to share their stories of healing.

The first question that comes to mind when one sees yet another "Goetia" on the market, is obviously, "Why should I consider this edition?"In this case the answer is a little too complex to sum up in a single tag-line.The first thing I want to make clear is, this isn't just the Goetia, as the title would suggest, but rather the entire Lemegeton! Further, it is based on the previously unpublished manuscript version compiled by Dr. Thomas Rudd. (Harley MS 6483)While Joseph Peterson's Lemegeton is clearly the definitive version, Skinner and Rankine use this book as an operating table on which to discect how this material was used by actual working magicians of the 16th and 17th centuries. The process, according to the authors, is one of dualism, where the magician controls base entities by use of their matching divine counterparts. That is a concept that is alluded to, but never fleshed out in the Lemegeton itself. This volume goes into a great deal of detail on the use of the 72 Names of the Shemhamphorash to bind and control the 72 "demons" of the Goetia. This concept is not only spelled out, there are illustrated in these pages, the actual double-sided seals as employed by Dr. Rudd and presumably his contemporaries.Other details that have not been previously published such as the proper use of the brass vessle and the breastplate, will be enough to get even armchair Goetic theorists off the fence, to make this purchase.Enochian magicians may be interested in seeing Dr. Rudd's verion of Dee's Tabula Sancta cum Tabulis Enochi.This massive 448 page work is heavily footnoted, and the student of Solomonic Magick will enjoy the ample back matter.The contents are broken down as follows:Front matter - 14 pages, including the introduction.History and origins - 43 pages of it.Evocation Methods - 24 pages exploring bindings, names, adversarial angels, invocations, equipment, and ceremony.The Manuscripts - 241 page treatment of Dr. Rudd's full Lemegeton, which he himself called the Goetia for reasons that escape me. It should be understood that in actuality the Goetia is just one of the books of the full Lemegeton.Appendices are broken up as follows:Appendix 1 - Theugia-Goetia in Sloane 3824Appendix 2 - Tables of demons from the Lemegeton (24 pages of tables!)This is a dream work of comparitive study on the Goetic entities, and their rank. Also included are Hebrew spellings of the names, alternate spellings, what if any stead ridden, other qualities, ruling angel, number of legions, planet (based on the metal associated with the spirit's rank) evoked appearance, and attributed powers.Appendix 3 - Thomas Rudd's synthesis of Goetia and EnochiaAppendix 4 - Rudd describes 61 demons.Appendix 5 - Sources for the material in the Lemegeton.Appendix 6 - Seals from Sibley's Goetia.Appendix 7 - Shem ha-Mephorash AngelsAppendix 8 - Ecclesiastical Planetary HoursAppendix 9 - This is an odd piece but it really speaks to the 16th century mindset of Goetia and self justification. It is an explanation of names used in the Goetia, with some other random Kabalah thrown in. But if you ever need say, the consecrating prayer of Venus, well, there you go.Appendix 10 - A study of some of the words used in evocation. This section is a Greek and Hebrew list of derivations of words used in Goetic evocations.Appendix 11 - Narrative of Dr. Rudd, Sir John Heydon and a spirit "How a man may have the continual Society of a Guardian Genius"Appendix 12 - Variant forms of Heptameron style circles.Appendix 13 - Observations of metals and times of bindings.Appendix 14 - Equipment diagrams. I was hoping for more here, but it serves its purpose.Appendix 15 - Scot's form of commanding spiritsIf you want to have a complete curriculum of Solomonic study, I suggest that you purchase this volume along with Joseph Peterson's Lemegeton. The Peterson edition is a scholerly comparitive work, while the present work is a snapshot of Solomonic Magick being put to practical work. These two volumes not only complement each other, but they are both equally vital to building an accurate picture of the scope and impact of this cycle of magick.Mr. Skinner and I have discussed the theory of Goetic workings in the past. It should be noted that the authors not only report the dualistic model of Goetic workings, they champion the theory behind it. I myself have a different view, seeing the Lemegeton as a "Book of the Dead" for the living, moving High Shamanism into 16th century Europe (not to mention 21st Century Americas). Consider how many of these beings start out as a spirit-animal, only putting on a comely human form after a battle of wills with the exorcist of the Art. Never the less, I could hardly put this volume down. There are many pearls in these pages for any student of Solomon.On a final note, the author pulls back the veil a bit on why there are no Goetic spirits associated with Mars, and raises the question as to there being a single demon attributed to Saturn. I had made a similar comment in my review of Runyon's reworking of the Goetia some time ago.

It's a pacifier.It's a rattle.It has the most secure clip mechanism I have ever seen. A baby would have to be bionic to remove this thing. Just watch out for skin!I have to say that the advancements in binky tech has taken me a bit by suprise. I never expected this level of sophistication in a mouth-plug.This is THE PERFECT car binky, hands down. No dropping and rolling under the seat with the stale Dorito bits and dog hair. In fact, the baby trying to reaquire binky dock is probably helping develop manual dexterity.Flawless execution.

Cedar gets a rawhide roll every day after dinner.They do a decent job of abraiding his teeth clean, but they do not have any enzyme action.That's where these chews come in. They aren't going to provide the same amount of scraping as a thick rawhide roll because they just aren't that "tough". They are gone in about 30 seconds. But they will provide papaya enzyme which may be helpful in further fighting the formation of plaque.They smell good and Cedar says they taste good.I give one of these after the rawhide for a better clean.Good health to you and your canine friend!

These things SMELL delicious. Like they smell so good if somebody were dieting, it might be a problem having these in the house. LOLCedar absolutely loves these.What I wish it had in addition to condroitan and glucosamine:Boswellia extract: This is an anti-inflamatory that has helped Cedar quite a bit.Boswellia 400 mg 100 Caps - Swanson PremiumTurmeric: This is a spice and it also seems to help quite a bit.Starwest Botanicals Organic Turmeric Root Powder 1 lbUnsapifinable Avocado and Soybean oil: HUGE improvement on this stuff.Avoca ASU Tablet, 120-CountTogether they got Cedar from limping to a mere bunny hop or two when he first starts walking in the morning. I can't tell you what a huge change that is for him. He is back to joining me every morning on the morning walk.If you can get the same results from the main two ingredients (and many can) you will be really pleased with the convenience of just reaching in a bag and tossing a treat his way. Otherwise, get the products listed above and blend them in a soup that you offer before the main meal. That's what I do with Cedar.Good health to you and your canine friend.

This is the food that we finally decided on for Lucy. She's a cattle dog X St. Barnard mix. A whopping 80 lbs of dog that needs to be a svelt 60.I like the natural ingredient list, including the absence of corn and soy.The lack of artificial colors and flavors boosts confidence as well.Fruits, veg and antioxidants also put our fears at rest.All of that and it is delivered right to the door.I would like to see probiotics added to the formulation but other than that, this is a pretty complete package.

This is a great food for your small dog.It took a couple of days for Chigger to get used to it, but his teeth seem to be staying much cleaner than when he was eating from a can.I would like to see Iam's ditch the corn and add a probiotic for a five star dog food but this fits the bill and is a HUGE jump over the store brands like "Old Roy".

A lot of folks get their opinion pre-packaged for them from DogFoodAdvisor dot com. The problem with that site is two fold:1. They ignore the advances in domestic dog nutrition in favor of wolf nutrition. Google "dogs evolved to digest starch" and you will see that the nutritional profile of a domestic dog has moved on from that of a wolf.2. They are absolutely slanted. Check out THEIR review on scam dot com.The first ingredient is "chicken by-product meal," This is a great ingredient for elderly dogs because the bones, beaks and feet are high in protein, chondroitin and glucosamineAs for the corn meal, many dogs have trouble with it. The other starch ingredients are fine, as you can Google...dogs have the enzymes to digest starches. They developed that by following us in the stone age.The addition of anti-oxidants are a huge plus as well. I would say that to get a higher score from me they would need to take out the corn and add probiotics to their prebiotic blend.

This is one of two foods we are feeding Lucy. She is a cattle dog X St. Barnard mix. HUGE girl, but she should weight 60 and is more like 80.She digs right in, so the taste is certainly there.With focus on digestion, protein, joint health in addition to caloric restriction this is a great product to slowly move your dog to an ideal weight.Just be sure to follow the feeding instructions on the package. No cheating on their behalf!

Cedar had one of these and got very ill. After a quick Google search I discovered there has been an ongoing problem with chicken jerky treats, and some dogs didn't survive.Dogs get sick. It may have been nothing more than a coincident of timing. That being said, I am not going to be giving him the rest of these.

Corn meal is the third ingredient. But..chicken is the first ingredient. This is a high-middle quality dog food. I feel confident using a food like this as PART of a dog's eating plan.Overall this product is a huge leap above the store brand which will have no chicken (just by-product) and usually corn starts as the first ingredient.Never did a farmer say, "It's cold and the wolves are coming down from the mountain. SECURE THE CORN!"To improve my  rating I would like to see the corn gone, digestion aid like a pro-biotic and more of a focus on joint maintenance.

If your animal has sensitivity to certain ingredients this might help. No wheat or soy. Krypto has to watch those ingredients or his ears get infected. What does food have to do with ears? Allergy. For a dog allergy can be a full body issue. Krypto turns red all over and his ears get really yeasty. This is a great product that avoids both of those ingredients.Add to that the joint support and immune support with antioxidants and you have a huge step above the store brand garbage that gets churned out.I would like to see this go from "chicken meal" to "chicken" and the removal of corn before going higher on my rating.

This is a very high quality product fro being a Purina brand. It starts out with chicken as the first ingredient. If you are considering a step up from "store brand" this is one step in the right direction.Cedar gets a variety and this is one that he really likes.Formulas that support joint mobility are a plus, as joint issues are becoming more common in older dogs.There are better foods out there, but there are worse foods out there as well.

Deluxe <adjective> of better quality and usually more expensive than the usual ones of its kind : very luxuriousNope.These are nice towels. Very soft. They dry very fast on the rack. (A huge plus in Texas as things tend to mildew after a single use.) But they don't dry YOU as well as say...those towels they have at the spa. That's a deluxe towel right there.These towels do a serviceable job. As a towel, it is certainly in working order, doing what a towel does, which is make a wet thing less wet than it was just prior to its application. For the price, these are STILL a great value. No two ways about it. As a purchase, I endorse it.But see, here's the thing. I feel like I need one and a half of these to complete the operation with the same level of efficiency as those overly plush towels at the spa. In other words, like any other regular towel I have applied to myself with determination.A better name for this towel might be "Divatex Home Fashions 10-Piece Completely Serviceable Towel Sets, Cream".Don't get me wrong. These towels will go into rotation between the water closet and hamper along with all of the other towels currently in my employ. They did the job. But I have used a luxurious towel before and this falls short of the dictionary term deluxe. Now, that being my only gripe, that they have overstated, to a moderate degree, the actual quality of the textile in question, I only removed one star. I mean, they do perform the process of removing most surface moisture from your skin as you would expect.It's simply that I expected that firm fluffy experience of an overly plush towel, drying me as only they can. And that isn't what's for sale here.There must be some towel tech, some manufacturing process, loop count or thread count, or maybe a weave that gives a more absorbant and plush towel experience like at the spa. But whatever the secret, you won't find it here. Just a good serviceable towel.

If you are just moving out of mom and dad's or if she got everything in the divorce, this should be part of your "new start" kit.This set has one of everything that a single guy could want. If you are a family, sure, you want a 12" skillet and a six quart stock pot. But for one guy? This fills the bill in a single box. And the red coating shows a little style for when you do have a female friend over.In the box you will find:* 10 inch skillet (Stir fry, phad thai)* 8 ½ inch skillet (Scrambled eggs, hash browns)* 6 quart stock pot with lid (Chili, stock, boiling potatoes)* 3 quart pot with lid (Hot dogs, boiled eggs)* 3 quart sautÃ© pan with lid (Who are we kidding? You are going to use it as a skillet!)* 2 quart saucepan with lid (reheating leftovers from anything above)* 1 quart saucepan with lid (Beef-a-roni, canned soups and stews)Some reviewers have taken away a star because of the low heat suggested for this cookware. That's pretty much true for all nonstick coatings. It greatly increases the life of the pan. You could go with stainless steel cookware. More versitile for sure, but they take longer to clean, and if you are a single guy, you have better things to do than clean and reseason a pan.

This might be a great product for you. If you want a single bottle to open, then I say go for it. It sure speeds up getting out the door in the morning. While this product is fairly expensive when compared to the individual ingredients, that's okay if what you want is convenience. You get that, and you pay for that.If budget is an issue, or say you want the dosage of CLA that is used in studies then this isn't the right way to go. You are going to want to buy your oils seperately. You will get higher dosage for less cost.Bottom line, it depends on what you are looking for. The quality of the product is good, and I noticed no after-taste. I really have an issue with going to work fish-burping. And this product didn't cause that once.

This works great for my garage, and on the OUTSIDE of my fence border. Behind my property is 160 acres of "green belt" as described by the HOA, but in reality is scrub, cedar and cactus. While I dig the natural setting, a natural setting means critters.I had left a bag of birdseed and a bag of grass seed in the garage over winter. Even after getting rid of it, there came an invading force of mice and rats who had pretty well entrenched themselves come spring.These things brought the signs of vermin invasion down to zero.BUT I would only use these in my garage or the outside of my fence (or other pet free zones) as they are NOT pet resistant. Cedar my cattle dog could have this open in a pair of minutes.If you have a garage and a spring invasion I think this is the ticket. If you are looking for something for your back porch or inside of your fence row AND have dogs, you are going to want to go another direction.

This worked great for my garage.I had left a bag of birdseed and a bag of grass seed in the garage over winter. Even after getting rid of it, the mouse army in my garage had set up a base camp from which to launch incursions into the home proper.These things took down the invasion force in short order.BUT I would only use these in my garage as they are NOT pet resistant. Cedar my cattle dog could have this open in a pair of minutes.If you have a garage and a spring invasion I think this is the ticket. If you are looking for something for your back porch or fence row AND have dogs, you are going to want to go another direction.

I was skeptical if the stomach protection feature would make a difference but compared to the 8 strain Now Foods brand this product is quite remarkable.One thing I notice is that there is no information on the product description on what strains are included or what research has been done on the strains. So in order to make this review more helpful I am going to fill in the missing blanks.Bifidobacterium Infantis SD-5845*Strongly linked to gut health and studies have confirmed improvement of irritable bowelBifidobacterium Lactis*Provides immune support*Decreases inflamation of the bowelBifidobacterium Longum*Allergy relief*Bowel movement*Competes with pathogenic microbesBifidobacterium Bifidum*Regulation of microbial homeostasis*Suppression of carcinogenic enzyme activity in the gut*Improves gut mucosal barrierLactobacillus Plantarum*Regulates intestinal permiability*Helps IBS*Indication that it may help with depressionLactobacillus Acidophilus*Cramping*Immune support*Anti-cancer activityI have found this the most useful product of its kind. I haven't tried them all but I have tried a few.I hope you find this review helpful. I think it certainly fills in some of the missing pieces from the description at the very least.

I am no conniseur of fine cold meds. But I have taken my fair share.This does exactly what you have come to expect from Ny-Quil. It deadens the ache, lowers the fever, clears the chest and puts you down for the night. And it does all of that with a lower price point.I am a fan and will be keeping a bottle of this in the night stand next to the Kindle and emergency flashlight.

I think this is a great dogfoot compared to your average store brands.Salmon as the first ingredient and no grains make this a good choice.But it isn't a salmon ONLY dogfood. If your dog has allergies like mine has, you want to have a look at the ingredients. Chicken is among the top six ingredients and can be a problem for many dogs. It's easy to see a grain free salmon dog food and think it is going to be great for your food sensitive canine companion only to discover it isn't what you were looking for. Not a knock just go in with your eyes open.Another possible problem for you might be the farmed salmon which are often raised with antibiotics."Liver flavor" rather than liver, also leaves some open questions.All in all, however, this is a great high energy dog kibble from a quality brand. Cedar loves it.For the price it meets the expected level of quality and palatability.

I am probably just going to switch this over to an auto-ship product to be honest.After dropping coffee due to anxiety, I lost that spring in my step. I had tried some B-vitamins and parsley in my smoothies but I wasn't getting my energy back.Part of that was likely due to the fact that I had overtaxed my energy system with all of that coffee. I was exhausted and needed some time to rest. But even after a rest and a detox I felt sluggish and tired.This stuff kicked me into gear without any "speedy" heart racing jitter-fest. It just slowly dialed me back up to 11.The studies I have read says that this is happening on the cellular level. Not sure I care how or where it is happening just as long as I have the energy and cognitive fortitude to engage my day again.If you have the greed to drop on this, I suggest that you do. It would be nearly impossible to get this level of PQQ from your regular diet.

This is no HEPA central air unit to keep your whole house allergen and dander free, but if you have sinus allergies and a bedroom, then I recommend it.My house is bordered on the back with about 160 acres of cedar trees, which drop pollen all winter long. It really makes me miss living in Indiana where the first frost stops allergies for the next four months.At any rate, if you are like me and wake up with your eyes glued together in the morning, this is the universal solvent you have been looking for.It fixes the bulk of the problem without breaking the bank, like a redo of your air handling system might cause.For even more relief I suggest the following products in addition to this unit:Ceramic Neti Pot | 50% Faster Flow than other Neti Pots | with 'Comfort Spout'Mucinex Extended-Release Bi-Layer 600 mg Tablets, 100 eaAdded to your regular allergy routine, this might be the way to go with spring of 2014 slated to be the worst pollen year in decades.

I ordered this thing like Monday and it's here by Wednesday from Hong Kong. Crazy fast. I realize that customs can hold things up so your mileage may vary.Exactly what I was looking for in a game device. I wish the manual was more robust, but that's what community forums are for. This thing is a beast of a handheld compared to other open game systems I have tried. It's a keeper.

I have been a huge fan of Pinnacle Studio products for years.This release is no dissapointment.I don't get every release, so much had changed since my last copy. It has greatly improved the process of importing video and photos from your digital device of choice. Combined with video capture devices such as a Dazzle Dazzle Digital Video Creator DVC-90 Video Capture Device and Movie Maker you can even convert all of your old VHS tapes into electronic media files...which I have done.The ability to import projects from your iPad's Avid Studio is a huge plus as well. You can even creat custom-fit soundtracks. But probably the best improvement is the way in which you can instantly share your videos via Facebook or YouTube rather than just making a DVD and dropping it in the mailbox...but you can still make DVD's as well.This is not a high end video editing suite, but for the masses, the "you and me" types, Pinnacle has always delivered both form and function.

This book is full of the realities of running a nonprofit. Sure, there are a million little nuanced things you will learn in the process, and all of those can't be in a book. But what this book does, is creates the lattice, framework if you will, on which you will hang all of those new concepts and skills on as you learn and grow your nonprofit organization.The included CD ROM is really worth the price of entry here. On it you will find useful forms and templates which are very high quality. You can tell actual operators in the field have had their hand in the production of this volume due to the attention to real-world detail and the no B.S. way in which the information is laid out.In addition to this book I would also suggest the following:How to Form a Nonprofit Corporation (book w/ CD-Rom)Nonprofit Meetings, Minutes & Records: How to Run Your Nonprofit Corporation So You Don't Run Into TroubleEffective Fundraising for Nonprofits: Real-World Strategies That Work

The premise of the book is great. Review different fasting protocols and then leave the reader with enough information to give it a go. However there is a strong bias toward a Paleo Diet that isn't evident from the title.This bias is particularly evident in the section that covers the Warrior Diet. The Warrior Diet is an Intermittent Fasting protocol that gives you a four hour eating window every day. In the famine part of your day you can have an apple or two to tide you over. In Fast Diets for Dummies the raw vegetarian part of the day is turned on it's head without any indication that this is the authors own change and not part of the original Warrior Diet. Instead of apples (raw, whole food, vegetarian) now you can have whey protein (processed, heat damaged, fractional food). The point of the Warrior Diet could not have been missed to a larger degree unless it included candy bars and heroin.I gave it two stars, because if you ARE Paleo (and there is nothing wrong with that) then this book will be exactly what you are looking for. Packaging a stealthy payload of biased information however has never been the way to win me over.Here are some choices that might serve you better if you are not Paleo inclined:Fasting and Eating for Health: A Medical Doctor's Program for Conquering DiseaseThe Warrior Diet: Switch on Your Biological Powerhouse For High Energy, Explosive Strength, and a Leaner, Harder BodyThe Every-Other-Day Diet: The Diet That Lets You Eat All You Want (Half the Time) and Keep the Weight Off

The one I got had obviously been returned previously. It was covered in greasy fingerprints.The GameCenter.APK file was not installed and is not available for download making the unit completely useless for the purpose intended.I wanted to return it for a replacement, but exchange was not an option, so I got a different model from another vendor.

The main floor of our house is primarily hardwood and tile, partially covered with area rugs and runners, an ideal situation for this vacuum.  The Alize canister does an excellent job on these surfaces, quickly picking up the ubiquitous pet hair and everyday dirt that accumulates on the floor.  The suction is outstanding, especially  for a small, lightweight machine such as this one.  It features six separate power settings including an automatic one that you can just set and forget.  On some of our rugs, the higher settings are just too powerful and make it difficult even to push the vacuum around.  That's why it's great to have so many options.  On the lower settings, it's so quiet that you could literally use it when everyone is asleep and not risk disturbing them.  Even our normally noise-averse cats don't react to it and they usually run for the hills when they as much as see a vacuum.The Miele Alize is compact, light and highly maneuverable, making it easy to navigate and to carry up and down the stairs.  Its 36 foot long cord offers great range without requiring frequent searches for fresh outlets and its cord retraction system is simply awesome, the best I've ever seen.  The three included attachments (dusting brush, upholstery tool and crevice nozzle) store neatly inside the canister so there's no worry about losing them.  The telescoping stainless steel wand easily adjusts to the proper height befitting the user and the job to be done.  And if you're vacuuming under dim light conditions, the handle comes equipped with a battery powered LED light that illuminates the area and turns itself off after 30 seconds.As much as I appreciate the relative ease and economy of bagless vacuums, there's a lot to be said for Miele's AirClean filtration system.  When used properly, the filters and the bags capture 99.9% of all damaging particles and prevent their release back into the air, a nice feature for all of us and a must for allergy and asthma sufferers.

One of things I like best about this small device aside from the fact that it takes up very little room in my overcrowded kitchen, is that it requires no external power.  You can take it virtually anywhere: camping, picnics, the office lunch room and enjoy freshly cut vegetables wherever you go.The spiralizer itself is well designed and constructed of BPA-free ABS plastic and includes two very sharp Japanese steel blades.  It's a simple device that seems built to last.  It's very easy to use and for me, the results have been picture-perfect.  That it encourages us to eat more vegetables isn't a bad thing either.Another important consideration for me is that Kitchen Supreme is very responsive and sincerely concerned with customer satisfaction.  Other reviews have mentioned this as well and I experienced it myself as I had occasion to email them after I purchased the spiralizer.  Within a very short time, I received the answer to my question and some other helpful information as well.

With all the electronic gadgets we've accumulated over the years, we can never have too many charging stations.  This one stands out because it offers a variety of charging options in a small form factor.  Just plug it in to a wall outlet (where it only takes up the bottom half) and voila, you've got 2 AC outlets and 2 USB ports plus a handy 7" micro USB cable.  For added convenience, there's a small ledge that's built into the top of the charger and it's perfect for cradling a phone or small tablet while it's being charged.This well-designed power station allows you to charge two devices at once if you wish.  While it has already seen a lot of use in our home, I expect that it will prove to be invaluable when traveling.

Heating and air conditioning tend to lower the humidity and really dry out the air in a room, wreaking havoc on dry skin.  I've tried many creams and lotions over the years and while I've liked some, none has really stood out as a favorite.  The ones most effective at dispelling the dryness all seemed to leave a greasy residue so I was loathe to touch anything until all the lotion was finally absorbed or wiped off.  Although it moisturizes very well, Eucerin doesn't present that problem.  Immediately after applying it to my hands, I can pick up a book or my knitting without worrying about leaving stains behind.  Of course, it's not just for hand care.  I slather it all over after a shower and my skin stays soft and moisturized for hours.Because it really works and it's fragrance-free, my husband likes it and has started using it too.

This slim, compact hub doesn't take up a lot of room but offers the convenience of seven 3.0 USB ports in a single device.  Plug it into a 3.0 USB port on your computer and you'll enjoy truly fast transfer rates, about 10 times faster than 2.0.  It's also backward compatible so even if your computer doesn't feature 3.0 technology, this will work with 1.0 and 2.0, albeit at slower speeds.  The power and indicator lights are a nice feature, allowing you to check your status at a glance and unlike most other hubs I've used, the TP-LINK has a switch so you can shut it off when not in use.  Simplifying things even further, it's truly plug and play with no drivers to install.I've got four of the seven ports in use already and everything's been running seamlessly.  I'm delighted to be able to run ancillary equipment such as external drives simultaneously rather than plugging and unplugging them into my computer individually. If your USB-powered devices are exceeding the available ports on your computer, the TP-LINK UH700 is a reasonably priced alternative..

Hyperbole aside, this product leaves my hair manageable, soft and shiny which is pretty much why I use a conditioner in the first place.  I don't find that it leaves a residue, nor does it weigh down my hair as some other products have done.  As such, I like this rejuvenating conditioner, will continue to use it and will likely purchase it when this runs out.The bottle is well designed for its purpose.  Its size and shape make it easy to handle in the shower and the flip top dispenses just the quantity you want without any fuss at all.As for the scent, it's just fine.  It doesn't send me into paroxysms of ecstasy but I don't find it unpleasant either.  This, of course, is entirely subjective and will not hold true for everyone.

As pretty much anyone knows, evaluating a particular fragrance is entirely subjective and personal.  With that in mind, I quite like Rochas Eau Sensuelle and find it pleasantly fruity/floral with an appealing hint of spice to counteract and balance the sweetness.  The bouquet which is comprised of Rochas' signature white flowers plus mango and a smattering of dried fruit, is neither overwhelming nor cloying but as fresh and clean as a warm spring day.  And while its complexity certainly makes a statement, it's not so heavy that it can't be worn during the day as long as you take care not to apply it too lavishly.To avoid over-application when using a spray bottle, rather than spraying it on myself directly, I prefer the old trick of lightly spritzing the air  and then walking into the cloud of fragrance.  I've never gone wrong with this technique.  You derive the subtle benefit of the lovely scent without stopping people in their tracks.

These pouches feature UV protection to prevent fading and color distortion due to light exposure.  It's a very useful feature which I've not seen on any of the other pouches that I've used.  The 3-mil thickness is ideal for most of my laminating needs although for more durability, they're also available in a 5-mil version.I use them primarily for document and photograph preservation, recipes, knitting and crochet patterns, anything I wish to protect from dirt, dust and tearing, etc.  A look around your house will probably give you many more ideas but in case you're stumped, Fellowes has a helpful site with suggestions and downloadable templates for laminating projects for home, work or school.  You can find it at Fellowes.com/ideacenter.Recently, I laminated a multi-page knitting pattern.  For half of the pages, I used the Fellowes ImageLast pouches and for the other half, another well-known brand also in 3-mil.  All of the laminated pages turned out well with a good seal and no waves or air bubbles but the Fellowes pages were slightly heavier and stiffer and didn't show any tendency to bow as the others sometimes did.  Fellowes makes a good quality product which I am happy to recommend.

This lightweight case perfectly fits the 12.2 inch Galaxy Tab Pro with ample room for the extras that you might want to bring along.  On one side, there's a large pocket which extends from one end of the case to the other. It's secured in the middle with a velcro tab.
